summary: 01/01/2020: Assailants set fire to an Ncell telecommunications tower in Jurethum, Bagmati, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incident in leaflets left at the scene and accused Ncell Private Limited of evading taxes and stealing from the Nepali people.

01/01/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused targeting an Ncell telecommunications tower in Pipira, Karnali, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).
01/01/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Suluk, Raqqah, Syria. At least three people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Pul-e-Jadid Regi, Farah, Afghanistan. Three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/01/2020: Two explosive devices detonated outside the Institute of Engineers, Bangladesh (IEB) in Dhaka city, Dhaka, Bangladesh. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost along the Balkh-Jawzjan Highway in Balkh, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed in the attack. Four other officers were reported missing, but it was unclear if they'd been abducted. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Bilchiragh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of three attacks in Faryab in one night. Five security personnel, including one police officer and one soldier, were killed and three others were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Dashti Archi district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least nine people, including National Directorate of Security officers, soldiers, and police officers, were killed and four other security forces were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/01/2020: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire on a Frontier Corps vehicle in Mir Ali, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One police officer was killed and a soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2020: Assailants threw two grenades at the residence of Gul Zafar Khan in Ghaki, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Khan, a Member of the National Assembly (MNA), was not harmed in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused at Thanti Bazaar in Khalanga, Karnali, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

01/01/2020: Assailants set fire to the office of the divisional officer for Muyuka Subdivision in Muyuka, South-West, Cameroon. There were no casualties in the attack. Separatists claimed responsibility and stated the reason for the attack was to erase the upcoming February twin elections materials found in the office.
01/01/2020: Assailants shot and killed Aremeyaw Nasigri, the secretary to the Chief of Gbintri, in Gbintri, North East, Ghana. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Qaysar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of three attacks in Faryab in one night. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting pro-government militia members in Punjab Qala, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least 13 people were killed and three others were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a United Nations vehicle in Gao city, Gao, Mali. Two Belgian soldiers were injured in the blast. The Al-Barnawi (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) faction of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2020: Assailants attacked Security Belt forces in Mahfad district, Abyan, Yemen. Two soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. In addition, two soldiers, identified as Qais Ahmad Asish and Hussein Awad Al-Hanashi, were abducted, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

01/03/2020: Assailants armed with baseball bats and iron bars beat and killed a civilian along Ashleigh Park road in Carrickfergus, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ulster Freedom Fighters (UFF).

01/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on a passenger bus in Nyongoro, Lamu, Kenya. At least three people, including a police officer, were killed and two others were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/02/2020: Assailants shot and killed Safar Mohammad, a radio station technician, in Police District 2, Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Baghlani Jadid district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Five police officers were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
01/02/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a police officer in Saq-dan, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying Abdulahi Sojar in Bengua, Oromia, Ethiopia. Sojar, the chairperson of the economic sector standing committee, was killed and two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2020: An assailant attempted to stab Israeli soldiers in Alon Shvut, West Bank. The assailant was injured when soldiers opened fire and there were no other reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Baza, Michika, Adamawa, Nigeria. This was one of three attacks that occurred on this day. Lawan Andimi, Michika LGA Chair of the Christian Association of Nigeria, was kidnapped, at least 15 assailants were killed, and there were an unknown number of civilian casualties across the ensuing clashes. Lawan Andimi was executed on January 20, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Kwuapale, Michika, Adamawa, Nigeria. This was one of three attacks in Michika on this date. Lawan Andimi, Michika LGA Chair of the Christian Association of Nigeria, was kidnapped, at least 15 assailants were killed, and there were an unknown number of civilian casualties across the ensuing clashes. Lawan Andimi was executed on January 20, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Kwuapa, Michika, Adamawa, Nigeria. This was one of three attacks that occurred on this day. Lawan Andimi, Michika LGA Chair of the Christian Association of Nigeria, was kidnapped, at least 15 assailants were killed, and there were an unknown number of civilian casualties across all three attacks. Lawan Andimi was executed on January 20, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

01/02/2020: Assailants, including suicide bombers in explosives-laden vehicles, attacked Syrian Army soldiers in At-Tah, Idlib, Syria. This was one of two similar incidents in Idlib on the same day. At least 30 soldiers and assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the attacks.

01/02/2020: Assailants, including suicide bombers in explosives-laden vehicles, attacked Syrian Army soldiers in Jarjanaz, Idlib, Syria. This was one of two similar incidents in Idlib on the same day. At least 30 soldiers and assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the attacks.

01/00/2020: Sometime between December 31, 2019 and January 4, 2020, assailants opened fire on the convoy of Taizz Governor Nabil Shamsan in Taizz, Yemen. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah Party.

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked a construction site and set fire to vehicles in Keredari, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties, but a number of workers were held hostage in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Agha Jan, Diyala, Iraq. One police officer was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/02/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a village councilor, identified as Lorna Marfil, in San Vicente, Laguna, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2020: Assailants threw an explosive device and opened fire targeting civilians in Abu Sayda, Diyala, Iraq. At least three people were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2020: An assailant attacked a prison intending to free prisoners suspected of terrorism in Niono, Segou, Mali. The assailant was killed in the attack. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security posts in Dara-i-Sufi Payin district, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including five assailants and six security personnel, were killed and seven assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in Buufow, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Eight civilians were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Imam Safer, Diyala, Iraq. One security forces member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/02/2020: Assailants abducted Osman Musa from his farm in Jaal, North Sinai, Egypt. Musa was shot and killed sometime on or before January 21, 2020. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victim of cooperating with security forces.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 01/03/2020: An assailant, identified as Nathan C., attacked civilians with a knife in Villejuif, Ile-de-France, France. One civilian was killed and two others were injured in the attack before the assailant was shot and killed by police. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Jihadi-inspired extremist. Sources noted that witnesses heard the assailant shout "Allahu Akhbar" during the attack. Authorities stated that they found religious items in the assailant's backpack, and suspected that he had been radicalized in the prior year.

01/03/2020: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Qahwa Khana, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Eight assailants were killed and three police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/03/2020: Assailants raided Bila Amboldar, Borno, Nigeria. Three civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
01/03/2020: Fourteen explosive devices were discovered and safely defused by police in Kunduchira, Kerala, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2020: Assailants raided Tawari, Kogi, Nigeria. At least 29 people, including a ward chair and an imam, were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. The assailants also set fire to houses, religious buildings and a clinic during the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists carried out the attack.

01/03/2020: An assailant vandalized and threw a Molotov cocktail targeting a Planned Parenthood in Newark, Delaware, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The assailant, identified as anti-abortion extremist Samuel James Gulick, spray painted the Latin words "Deus Vult" which translate to "God wills it" on the building.

01/03/2020: Assailants set fire to the Church of San Francisco de Borja in Santiago, Santiago Metropolitan, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2020: Assailants abducted and killed an alleged police informant in Budurumaha, Odisha, India. The Kalahandi-Kandhamal Border Committee faction of the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI - Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2020: Assailants stopped and set fire to a vehicle transporting wood in Collipulli, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian in Kilengwani, Tana River, Kenya. The hostage was released the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

01/03/2020: Assailants fired rockets targeting civilians in Ghalak, Ibb, Yemen. At least two civilians were killed and an unknown number of civilians were injured in the attack, which lasted until the following day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
01/03/2020: An explosive device detonated in Na-khod-Amodah village, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2020: Assailants executed three civilians accused of working with the Somali government in Buqda, Hiiraan, Somalia. The victims had previously been abducted from El Ali village on an unknown date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

01/03/2020: An explosive device planted in the vehicle of Abu Hareth Qubba detonated in Jarabulus, Aleppo, Syria. Qubba, a Syrian National Army (SNA) commander, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/04/2020: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a school bus along the Toeni-Tougan Road in Dagale, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. At least 14 civilians, including seven children, were killed and nine others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: An explosive device planted in a vehicle detonated targeting civilians in Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers along the A3 highway in Jakana, Borno, Nigeria. At least ten people, including six assailants and four soldiers, were killed and two others were injured in the ensuing clash which spanned three days. The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants threw a grenade targeting Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a tribal leader, identified as Datu Sammy Diwangan, in Canangaan, Bukidnon, Philippines. The New People’s Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident, noting Diwangan was targeted in retaliation for his opposition to NPA recruitment activities and plans for the group to expand their operations in Barangay Canangaan.

01/04/2020: A pipe bomb detonated in the front yard of a civilian residence in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/04/2020: Assailants shot and killed Ahmed Salah Balsam, an activist, in Baghdad city, Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants threw an explosive device targeting a police station in Mondomo, Cauca, Colombia. One police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Dagoberto Ramos Mobile Column of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 01/04/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Bagmati, Lalitpur, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants fired projectiles that landed and detonated near the United States Embassy at Celebration Square in the Green Zone in Baghdad city, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on the same day. Kata'ib Hezbollah claimed responsibility in a warning prior to the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants fired a projectile that struck a house 500 meters from As-Salam Palace in Karada neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. At least three people were injured in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on the same day. Kata'ib Hezbollah claimed responsibility in a warning prior to the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants fired projectiles at Balad Air Base in Yathrib, Saladin, Iraq. At least three Iraqi soldiers were injured in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on the same day. Kata'ib Hezbollah claimed responsibility in a warning prior to the incident.
01/04/2020: An explosive device detonated in Khash Rod district, Nimroz, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: Multiple explosive devices detonated near Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) and pro-Iran militia vehicles outside of Sukhnah, Homs, Syria. At least 10 militia members were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/04/2020: Assailants armed with knives and firearms killed a military captain in Mansour neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Jue-e-Naw, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/05/2020: Assailants armed with rocket-propelled grenades and firearms attacked Camp Simba, a military base, in Jipe, Lamu, Kenya. In addition to four assailants, three people, including a United States (US) soldier and two US contractors, were killed and two other US contractors were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was part of its “Al-Quds (Jerusalem) shall never be Judaized” campaign.

01/05/2020: Assailants attacked the palace of a traditional ruler in Babungo, North-West, Cameroon. At least 18 local officials were abducted in the attack, and the hostages were released within 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ambazonian separatists.

01/05/2020: An assailant attempted to stab police officers in Gelsenkirchen, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. The assailant was killed when the officers opened fire and there were no other reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that the assailant may have shouted "Allahu Akbar" during the attack.

01/05/2020: An assailant attempted to stab police officers in Metz, Grand-Est, France. The assailant was injured when the officers opened fire and there were no other reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Muslim extremist. Sources noted that the assailant shouted "Allahu Akhbar" during the attack. Authorities suspected that the assailant had ties to militant groups.
01/05/2020: Assailants shot and killed a member of the Sikh community in Chamkani, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint in Anger Bagh, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least five people, including a police commander and four assailants, were killed and another police officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/05/2020: Assailants armed with sledgehammers attacked Jawaharlal Nehru University in New Delhi, Delhi, India. At least 26 people, including students and faculty, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh.

01/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Taizz governor Nabil Shamsan on Jamal abd al-Nasr Street in Taizz, Yemen. Shamasan was not harmed, but one guard was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah Party.

01/05/2020: Assailants equipped with an explosives-laden vehicle attacked a military base in Shargha, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least ten people, including nine assailants and one soldier, were killed and seven others, including six assailants and one soldier, were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: An explosive device planted in the car of a regional security official detonated in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. Two security officials were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Two explosive devices were discovered and safely defused by police in Sarguli, Odisha, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
01/05/2020: A roadside bomb was discovered and safely defused in Salarzai, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in Kyauktaw, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

01/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dalat rally near the Aparajeyo Bangla statue at Dhaka University in Dhaka city, Dhaka, Bangladesh. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related attacks at the University on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Two explosive devices detonated near the Dhaka University Central Students’ Union building in Dhaka city, Dhaka, Bangladesh. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related attacks at the University on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Assailants fired an M79 rifle grenade at the house of school principal in Fort Pikit, North Cotabato, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Frontier Corps convoy in Salarzai, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of Sarwar Ali in Uttara neighborhood, Dhaka, Bangladesh. Ali, a trustee of the Liberation War Museum, was not harmed, though he and three other members of his family were briefly held hostage during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/04/2020: Assailants abducted and handcuffed 14 shepherds in the desert near Sabkhah, Raqqah, Syria. All 14 hostages were shot and killed a short time later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by either the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) or an Iranian militia.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/05/2020: Assailants attacked military personnel in Tel Diab, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least two soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. Another soldier was abducted and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/05/2020: Police apprehended an assailant armed with a knife and fuel attempting to attack Arab residences in Abu Gosh, Jerusalem, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested an individual identified as Dor Oved, an Israeli settler.

01/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Shaikh Ahmad, the head of the biometric department of the provincial police force, in Bolan, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and four police officers, including Ahmad, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/05/2020: Assailants attacked and killed two civilians in Baluch, Samangan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/05/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Korak-e-Moghul, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least six people, including two pro-government militia members and four assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/05/2020: Assailants attacked an army outpost in Qaysar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the incident. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/00/2020: Sometime between January 1, 2020 and January 8, 2020, security forces discovered and safely defused 40 explosive devices in Farah, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting the Babil area, Baghdad, Iraq. This was one of two related rocket attacks in Baghdad on this date. At least six civilians were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Assailants fired two rockets targeting the Green Zone in Baghdad city, Baghdad, Iraq. This was one of two related rocket attacks in Baghdad on this date. At least six civilians were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Assailants set fire to the house of Wilfred Fusi Naamukong, a Social Democratic Front (SDF) Member of Parliament in Mankwi, North-West, Cameroon. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

01/05/2020: Assailants threw petrol bombs at the Sheung Shui police station in Fanling, Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but a vehicle was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2020: Assailants abducted five civilians from Fino, Mandera, Kenya. Four of the hostages were released, but the outcome of the fifth hostage is unknown. It is believed the hostage were transported from Kenya into Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

01/06/2020: Assailants detonated a roadside bomb and opened fire on soldiers in Alatona, Segou, Mali. Five soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were killed in the attack. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/06/2020: Assailants abducted four students in Oromia, Ethiopia. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/06/2020: An explosive device detonated outside the Konstantinos Mitsotakis Foundation on Psaromilingou Street in Athens, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anarchists.

01/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Major General Olusegun Adeniyi, the Theatre Commander of Operation Lafiya Dole, near Auno, Borno, Nigeria. An unknown number of assailants and a driver were killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the attack.
01/06/2020: An assailant abducted Mohamed Maïga, a village chief, from his home in Gossi, Timbuktu, Mali. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/06/2020: An explosive device detonated on al-Beid bridge in Gamboru, Borno, Nigeria. Between 30 people were killed and 35 people were injured, including Nigerians and Cameroonians. Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/06/2020: Assailants abducted Issa Chou, the mayor of Babessi, and four of his councilors in Babessi, North-West, Cameroon. The hostages were released on January 22, 2020 following a ransom payment. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ambazonia separatists.

01/06/2020: Two assailants threw petrol bombs at Spicegirl, a restaurant, on Lai Chi Kok Road in Sham Shui Po, Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/06/2020: Assailants attacked Moudoukoua, Extreme-North, Cameroon. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. At least six civilians were killed and three others were abducted across both attacks. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/06/2020: Assailants attacked Itere, Extreme-North, Cameroon. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. At least six civilians were killed and three others were abducted across both attacks. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/06/2020: Assailants attacked a Special Anti-Robbery Squad (SARS) base in Kundori, Borno, Nigeria. At least three Nigerian Police Force officers were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/06/2020: Assailants attacked Kasso, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least three people were killed and four other people were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

01/06/2020: An explosive device detonated at an under-construction mosque on the outskirts of Mandali, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/06/2020: Assailants attacked Shamaki, Taraba, Nigeria. Two civilians were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2020: Assailants abducted two travelers along the Caloto-Toribio road in El Palo, Cauca, Colombia. The hostages were released on January 6, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Dagoberto Ramos Mobile Column of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 01/06/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the residence of Uday al-Jabri in Nasiriyah, Dhi Qar, Iraq. Al-Jabri, an activist, was injured and his house and vehicle were damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/07/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a Frontier Corps (FC) vehicle along McConaughey Road in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two people were killed and 14 others, including five security personnel, were injured in the blast. 01/14/2020: Assailants abducted and tortured Maxwell Nashon, a journalist and Fombina FM station employee, from his residence in Yola, Adamawa, Nigeria. Nashon was released and succumbed to his injuries the following day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/14/2020: An explosive device detonated on a road in Police District 2, Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. Two children were killed and eight other civilians were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Mazari Sharif on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/14/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting police responders in Police District 2, Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Mazari Sharif on this date. One police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/14/2020: Two pipe bombs detonated outside a home on Monagh Drive in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/14/2020: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a security convoy guarding Turkish road construction workers in Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Three Somali soldiers were killed and two others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2020: Assailants abducted three University of Maiduguri students along Damaturu-Maiduguri Road in Jakana, Borno, Nigeria. One student was released a short time later while another hostage was executed on January 22, 2020. The whereabouts of the third hostage is unknown. The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the attack.
01/14/2020: An incendiary balloon detonated in the Gaza Strip, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/14/2020: Assailants disguised as soldiers abducted an off-duty soldier and his wife along the Damaturu-Maiduguri road in Mainok, Borno, Nigeria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
01/14/2020: Assailants abducted five healthcare workers in Kachan, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. All five workers were released as of January 26, 2020. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/14/2020: Assailants opened fire on the home of Huber Dario Sanchez, former Abrego mayor, in Abrego, Norte de Santander, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Popular Liberation Army (EPL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/14/2020: Assailants shot and killed Jaiber Alexandeer Quitumbo Ascue, an indigenous social leader, in Vichiqui, Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/14/2020: Assailants shot down a military aircraft conducting a training exercise south of Rafah, North Sinai, Egypt. The pilot of the aircraft was killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.

summary: 01/14/2020: Assailants opened fire on Yordan Tovar in Teteye, Putumayo, Colombia. Tovar, a union leader and social activist, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/14/2020: Assailants stole 2,000 cattle from shepherds in Faydat, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in the Mayadin desert on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/14/2020: Assailants opened fire on military personnel responding to a previous attack near Mayadin, Deir ez-Zor in Bir Houmaima, Homs, Syria. At least 11 soldiers and two shepherds were killed while there were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related incidents in the Mayadin desert on the same day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/14/2020: Assailants executed seven shepherds by firing squad in Ayyash, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed it to the Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR).

summary: 01/15/2020: Assailants attacked a police station in Irumu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Five police officers and one civilian were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Seven people, including four drivers and two civilians, were killed and four others including Bubaram were injured in the attack. The hostages were released on January 22, 2020. Ansaru (Jama'atu Ansarul Muslimina Fi Biladis Sudan) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Ansaru (Jama'atu Ansarul Muslimina Fi Biladis Sudan)

The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they targeted the victim because the government had not punished the victim for stealing national property.

01/20/2020: An assailant stabbed and killed his boss and friend, William Knight, after a political argument on a construction site along Florida Turnpike near State highway 528 in Orlando, Florida, United States. An American flag was draped next to Knight’s body and the packaging was found nearby. The assailant, Mason Toney, called witnesses terrorists and fled the scene before he was arrested several hours later in Brevard County. Sources noted that Toney and his boss had opposing political views, with Knight supporting Donald Trump and Toney being anti-government, believing “that the government is bad and out to get him.” Sources also noted that Toney came to work that day with a backpack, which was very unusual.

This was one of two similar attacks targeting police in Kunduz on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Taliban.

01/29/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Lakhshak-e-Qarchaghi, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least two officers were killed and two other officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/29/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Tarin Kot district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least eight officers were killed and four other officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/28/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Dashti Archi district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Dashti Archi on this date. At least 13 people, including soldiers and a police officer, were killed and 11 others, including seven soldiers and three police officers, were injured across the three attacks. Additionally, at least one soldier was abducted during the clashes and their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/29/2020: Assailants attacked the Korak-e-Mughul outpost in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least one pro-government militia member was killed and another militia member was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/29/2020: Assailants disguised in military uniforms opened fire on the convoy of Brig. Gen. Joselito Salido, the deputy director of the Directorate for Integrated Police Operations, in Tikalaan, Bukidnon, Philippines. One police officer was killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

01/29/2020: Assailants abducted a suspected police informant in Navagaon, Chhattisgarh, India. The suspected informant was killed later that night. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

01/29/2020: Assailants fired mortars at the Torkham Border Terminal in Torkham, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/29/2020: An assailant set fire to the Central International Fellowship Church in Fruitridge Pocket area, Sacramento, California, United States. A firefighter was injured in the attack. This was one of two attacks targeting churches in Sacramento within 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Weun Luang Lee was arrested by police for setting the fires.

01/28/2020: Assailants ambushed two civilian vehicles in Maridi city, Maridi, South Sudan. At least two civilians were injured and three others were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping remains unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Salvation Front (NAS).
01/29/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely detonated at the Millipat Hotel Limited in Nsukka, Enugu, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/29/2020: Assailants attacked a military outpost along the Baghdad-Daquq road in Daquq district, Kirkuk, Iraq. Two Iraqi soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 01/29/2020: Assailants attacked a military post in Buhriz, Diyala, Iraq. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 01/30/2020: Two pipe bombs detonated in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/29/2020: Assailants attacked Blaram Island in Logone-et-Chari district, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least five fishermen were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/29/2020: Assailants fired rockets that landed and detonated in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least four people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the People's Protection Units (YPG).

01/29/2020: Assailants launched missiles from Yemen targeting Saudi Aramco in Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missiles were intercepted by the Saudi Air Defense System and there were no reported casualties in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/29/2020: Assailants fired rockets at a Turkish Armed Forces (TSK) convoy in al-Rashidin neighborhood, Aleppo, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on a soldier in Dora neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. The soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/29/2020: Assailants attacked and set fire to the Church of Christ in Jabarona, Khartoum, Sudan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/29/2020: Assailants threw petrol bombs at the Tin Shui Wai police station in Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks targeting police within a 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/29/2020: Assailants threw three petrol bombs at the Kwai Chung Police Station in Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks targeting police within a 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/29/2020: Assailants threw two petrol bombs at a police vehicle in Mong Kok, Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks targeting police within a 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: A female suicide bomber detonated inside a residence in Muna Dalti, Borno, Nigeria. Aside from the death of the assailant, at least one person was injured in the blast. This was one of two suicide bombings in Muna Galti in a short period of time. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources noted that the attacks bore the hallmarks of Boko Haram.

01/30/2020: A female suicide bomber detonated at open-air classes in Muna Dalti, Borno, Nigeria. In addition to the assailant, at least three people were killed and four other people were injured in the blast. This was one of two suicide bombings in Muna Galti in a short period of time. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources noted that the attacks bore the hallmarks of Boko Haram.

01/30/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Mulolya, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Three people were killed in the attack. This was one of four related attacks near the state borders of North Kivu and Ituri on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

01/30/2020: Assailants set up a fake checkpoint and abducted eight people near Qariyatakh, Diyala, Iraq. This was one of two similar attacks in Diyala on the same day in which a total of nine civilians were abducted. At least one hostage was executed and his body was discovered the following day. Three other hostages were released on February 18, 2020, February 19, 2020 and February 24, 2020. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 01/30/2020: Assailants abducted a driver from a vehicle along a road in Diyala, Iraq. This was one of two similar attacks in Diyala on the same day in which a total of nine civilians were abducted. At least one hostage was executed and his body was discovered the following day. Three other hostages were released on February 18, 2020, February 19, 2020 and February 24, 2020. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 01/30/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Mandumbi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 11 people were killed in the attack. This was one of four related attacks near the state borders of North Kivu and Ituri on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Aveli, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One person was killed in the attack. This was one of four related attacks near the state borders of North Kivu and Ituri on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked civilians and set fire to homes and motorcycles in Mamove, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Six people including three women and a child were killed in the attack. This was one of four related attacks near the state borders of North Kivu and Ituri on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

01/30/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused on train tracks in Nasirabad, Balochistan, Pakistan. Security forces also opened fire on assailants planting the device, killing one. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Baloch Liberation Army (BLA).

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Dahana-i-Ghuri district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and six other officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/30/2020: An assailant opened fire on anti-Citizenship Amendment Act protesters at Jamia Milia University in New Delhi, Delhi, India. A student was injured in the attack. Rambhakt Gopal, a Hindu extremist, claimed responsibility for the incident. Gopal also stated that the attack was in retaliation for the death of a boy killed in Uttar Pradesh. Sources noted that Gopal had a history of social media posts that discussed "restoring Hindu pride."
01/30/2020: A pipe bomb was discovered and safely defused in the garden of a home along Mulderg Drive in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers in Damasak, Borno, Nigeria. Security forces repelled the attack and the outcome is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP).

01/30/2020: Assailants opened fire on Jordan Abdulrahman Ibrahim, a barangay chairperson and president of the Association of Barangay Chairpersons (ABC) of South Upi, at a roadside stand along the National Highway in Dalumangcob, Maguindanao, Philippines. Ibrahim was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: Explosive devices detonated targeting three counterterrorism CCTV cameras near the Lower House parliament building at Dabka Junction, Mogadishu, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. This was one of two coordinated attacks on CCTV cameras in Mogadishu on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
01/30/2020: An explosive device detonated in Khanabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Three children were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

This was one of two coordinated attacks on CCTV cameras in Mogadishu on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked a military position in Choua, Lac, Chad. At least 24 people, including soldiers, civilians, and 21 assailants, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/30/2020: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of Halyna Tereshchuk, a Radio Free Europe correspondent, in Lviv city, Lviv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked a gendarmerie post in Sarakala, Segou, Mali. There were no reported casualties, but vehicles were stolen and at least one soldier and one gendarme were reported missing in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated at the customs area in Tall Abyad, Raqqah, Syria. At least two Turkish civilians were killed and four other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked Ankouna, Pensa, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in Pensa on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked Rokoutin, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. Nine people were killed in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in Pensa on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: Assailants attacked Boulga, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in Pensa on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: Assailants abducted four Community Initiative for Sustainable Development (COMINSUD) humanitarian aid workers in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Three of the hostages were injured and all four were released on January 31, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

01/30/2020: Assailants stopped a woman using donkeys to transport food in Mang, Ghor, Afghanistan. While there were no human casualties, the four donkeys were shot and killed and the food was stolen. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/30/2020: Assailants threw seven petrol bombs at the Hung Hom Police Station in Ho Man Tin, Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks targeting police within a 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: Assailants threw two petrol bombs at the Mong Kok Police Station in Prince Edward, Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks targeting police within a 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/30/2020: An assailant attacked and stabbed Imran Aliyev in Lille, Hauts-de-France, France. Aliyev, a blogger and critic of Chechen authorities, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources noted that the assailant was likely a Chechen that returned to Russia the day after the attack took place.

01/31/2020: Assailants abducted Gyanendra Joshi, a municipal chair of the Nepal Communist Party (NCP), in Chaurbandale, Sudurpashchim, Nepal. Joshi was beaten and injured before being rescued by police later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/31/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police team at a toll plaza in Ban, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Three assailants were killed and one police officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incidents to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

This was one of two projectile attacks in Southern district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incidents to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

01/31/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely in Fazil Bega, Kabul, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed and one civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/31/2020: An explosive device detonated in Kirumampakkam, Tamil Nadu, India. One person was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/31/2020: Assailants attacked an Ebola treatment center in Biakutu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two assailants were killed and a child was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Mayi Mayi militia.

01/31/2020: Assailants abducted Mark Frerichs, a United States civilian contractor, in Khost, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown.  The Taliban claimed responsibility; however, a spokesperson later denied carrying out the attack. Sources also attributed the incident to the Haqqani Network, which denied involvement.

01/31/2020: Assailants attacked military forces in Askira, Borno, Nigeria. At least three soldiers were killed and five civilians were injured in the ensuing clash. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/31/2020: Assailants fired five rocket-propelled grenades that landed and detonated near Qayyarah Air Force Base housing United States forces in Qayyarah, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: An explosive device attached to a refrigerated truck was discovered and safely defused at the Silverwood Industrial Estate in Lurgan, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. The intention was for the device to detonate on a ferry traveling between Belfast and Scotland. The Continuity Irish Republican Army (CIRA) claimed responsibility and stated that the attack was timed with Brexit Day (when the United Kingdom was scheduled to leave the European Union).

In addition, in the ensuing clash a mortar landed on a house, killing two children and injuring two other people. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an Anti-LGBT extremist who video taped the assault and also shouted slurs at the couple regarding their sexuality.

Alal was not injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least two security guards were killed and two other people, including Ali, were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on several people, including a National Directorate of Security (NDS) worker, in Parwan, Afghanistan. One person was killed and another two, including the NDS worker, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/01/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives laden vehicle targeting pro-government forces in Zahra, Aleppo, Syria. The assailant was the only reported casualty. This was one of three related attacks in Aleppo on this date. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/01/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives laden vehicle targeting pro-government forces in Zahra, Aleppo, Syria. The assailant was the only reported casualty. This was one of three related attacks in Aleppo on this date. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/01/2020: An explosives laden vehicle targeting pro-government forces detonated in Zahra, Aleppo, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of three related attacks in Aleppo on this date. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/01/2020: Assailants attacked Lamdamol, Sahel, Burkina Faso. At least 18 civilians were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

02/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on a convoy transporting Cameroon People's Democratic Movement (RDPC) officials along the Bamenda-Mbengwi highway in Alahnki, North-West, Cameroon. Two RDPC officials and one police officer were injured in the attack. This was one of two attacks targeting the convoy on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.
02/01/2020: An explosive device planted in a vehicle detonated in Mir Ali, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The driver was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/01/2020: Assailants attacked pro-government militia members near the Amu River in Shahri Buzurg district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least two militia members were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

02/01/2020: Assailants attacked a local police outpost in Karaiz Khoni Bala Murghobi, Herat, Afghanistan. At least three people, including a police officer and two pro-government militia members, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

02/01/2020: Assailants attempted to extort money from villagers in Bugso, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. Police forces responded to the attack, and three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

02/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting military forces at a jetty near Nyaung Bin Hla, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Somali National Army (SNA) and African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) joint military base in Qalimow, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. Eight soldiers and ten assailants were killed and 13 soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/02/2020: One explosive device partially detonated and another was safely defused on a train at the Lo Wu station in Lo Wu, Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack. An unidentified individual claimed responsibility for the incident, stating that the attack was in protest of Hong Kong’s refusal to close the border to stop the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.

02/02/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) post in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least two CRPF members and seven civilians were wounded in the blast. The Resistance Front (TRF) claimed responsibility for the attack.  Sources also noted that three Jaish-e-Muhammad members were arrested in connection with the incident.

summary: 02/02/2020: An assailant armed with a knife and a fake explosives-laden vest stabbed civilians in Streatham neighborhood, London, England, United Kingdom. Two civilians were stabbed and injured in the attack before police responded, killing the assailant and injuring a third civilian. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Sudesh Amman and noted that he had previously pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). Following the attack, the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed that one of its "soldiers" carried out the attack and that the assailant answered calls to target civilians in countries that belong to the coalition fighting against ISIL.

02/02/2020: Assailants fired mortars targeting a military post in Garsale, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/02/2020: Assailants fired mortars targeting a military post in Ilbig, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

Additionally, two women were abducted and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.
