02/02/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Border Security Force (BSF) patrol near Badeteoda, Chhattisgarh, India. One BSF soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

02/02/2020: An explosive device detonated at a playground in Shantipur, West Bengal, India. An unknown number of other explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in the area. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/00/2020: Sometime between January 26, 2020 and February 9, 2020, assailants abducted an unknown number of election candidates over the prior two weeks in North-West, Cameroon. This was one of two similar attacks in which 120 candidates were abducted over the two week period. At least 60 hostages were released while the fate of the remaining victims is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/00/2020: Sometime between January 26, 2020 and February 9, 2020, assailants abducted an unknown number of election candidates over the prior two weeks in South-West, Cameroon. This was one of two similar attacks in which 120 candidates were abducted over the two week period. At least 60 hostages were released while the fate of the remaining victims is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on Citizenship Amendment Act protesters outside Gate 5 of Jamia Millia Islamia in Delhi city, Delhi, India. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on military forces in Lafitat, North Sinai, Egypt. At least five soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 02/02/2020: Assailants attacked Mandumbi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of seven attacks in Ituri on this day. At least 26 people were killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/03/2020: An explosive device detonated near Madhur Canteen at Dhaka University in Dhaka, Bangladesh. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2020: Assailants set fire to a girls' school in Bodala, Takhar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/03/2020: Assailants seized a Horn International Relief and Development Organisation (HIRDO) aid vehicle near Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. Two aid workers were abducted in the attack, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/03/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Ndalya, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 11 people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/03/2020: Assailants used drones to fire projectiles at Sahn al-Jinn military base in Marib, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/03/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a religious scholar in Zanda Jan, Herat, Afghanistan. One other person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/03/2020: Assailants set fire to an Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) office in Orlu district, Imo, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2020: An explosive device detonated near a passenger vehicle in Afmadow district, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least four people were killed and six others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2020: An assailant armed with a knife attacked gendarmes at a barracks in Dieuze, Grand-Est, France. At least one gendarme was injured and the assailant was shot and injured in the incident. In a call to the police prior to the attack, the incident was claimed to have been carried out in the name of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). After the attack it was also discovered that the assailant, identified as Mattias R., had enlisted in the military two months prior.

02/03/2020: At least 15 explosive devices were discovered and safely defused outside Kunduz city, Kunduz, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/03/2020: Assailants attacked an uprising force along the Sari Pul-Jawzjan Highway in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least 17 people, including 11 assailants and six uprising members, were killed and three other security forces members were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2020: Assailants attacked Sofi Qala, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one pro-government militia commander was killed and eight other soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/03/2020: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail at an under-construction police station in Concepcion, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but two assailants were arrested. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Lafoole, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least four civilians were killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2020: An explosive device attached to a balloon detonated in the backyard of a residence in Kfar Aza, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two similar projectile attacks in Southern on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

02/03/2020: An explosive device attached to a balloon landed in Saad, Southern, Israel. The device was safely defused by police officers. This was one of two similar projectile attacks in Southern on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2020: Assailants preached to civilians at gunpoint in Dadbule, Wajir, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources suspected the involvement of Al-Shabaab.

02/03/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely in Obe district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least two assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Taliban.

02/04/2020: Assailants stabbed three civilians, two Chinese nationals and an Australian national, in Hulhumale, Male, Maldives. The three civilians were injured in the attack. The Lions of Khilafah in the Maldives claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Lions of Khilafah in the Maldives

summary: 02/04/2020: Assailants raided Nraha, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of five related attacks targeting villages in Quissanga district on this date. At least seven farmers were beheaded and several houses were set on fire across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: Assailants raided Mussomero, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of five related attacks targeting villages in Quissanga district on this date. At least seven farmers were beheaded and several houses were set on fire across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: Assailants raided Namadai, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of five related attacks targeting villages in Quissanga district on this date. At least seven farmers were beheaded and several houses were set on fire across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: Assailants raided Namoruma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of five related attacks targeting villages in Quissanga district on this date. At least seven farmers were beheaded and several houses were set on fire across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: Assailants raided Mahate, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of five related attacks targeting villages in Quissanga district on this date. At least seven farmers were beheaded and several houses were set on fire across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: An explosive device detonated near the residence of Hadiya Al-Khaybani in Al-Fahud, Dhi Qar, Iraq. Al-Khaybani, the dissolved Provincial Council Integrity Committee President, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: Two explosive devices detonated successively near Iraqi Army vehicles in Abu Ghraib district, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least three soldiers were injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on Abu Muqtada al-Izrajawi outside his residence in Amarah, Maysan, Iraq. Al-Izrajawi, a Sadrist movement leader, died on February 5, 2020 from injuries he sustained in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/04/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a female police officer on their way home from work in Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/04/2020: An assailant identifying himself as a government employee handed over a bag containing an explosive device to a shopkeeper near a private school in Zando, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The device was later safely defused by police officers. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: Assailants abducted Doctor Daniel Moreno in Jolo, Sulu, Philippines. The physician was rescued on March 24, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

02/04/2020: A sniper opened fire and killed a police officer in Firoozah, Badghis, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/04/2020: Assailants attacked Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one police special forces member and two assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

02/04/2020: Assailants threw a firebomb at the car of Nikos Karamanlis, the Paraskinio newspaper publisher, in Agia Varvara district, Athens, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on a pickup truck in Amatongas, Manica, Mozambique. The driver was killed and a passenger was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Renamo Military Junta and the Mozambique National Resistance Movement (MNR).

02/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military barracks in Euyomojock, South-West, Cameroon. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, two gendarmes and a sub-prefect were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/04/2020: Assailants attacked Saho Rami, Niger, Nigeria. An unknown number of people were injured and abducted during the assault. Some of the hostages were later rescued on or before February 15, 2020. The whereabouts of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

02/04/2020: An explosive device detonated in a restroom of the Lai Chi Kok public library in Lai Chi Kok, Hong Kong, China. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that the attack was motivated by public calls to close Hong Kong's borders to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

02/04/2020: Assailants attacked an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp in Makintari, Diffa, Niger. This was one of two related attacks on IDPs on this date. At least three people were killed and two people were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/04/2020: Assailants attacked an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp in Kangouri, Diffa, Niger. This was one of two related attacks on IDPs on this date. At least three people were killed and two people were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) officers in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least one police officer and two assailants were killed and one assailant was injured in the ensuing clash. The Hind Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).
gname: Hind Province of the Islamic State

summary: 02/05/2020: An explosive device detonated near the convoy of Dr. Alaa Rikabi at Al-Haboubi Square in Nasiriyah, Dhi Qar, Iraq. Dr. Rikabi, a prominent demonstrator, was not harmed; however, four other people were injured in the attack. A second device was later discovered and safely defused at the scene by security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2020: Assailants attacked Iraqi Volunteer Forces in Naameh, Saladin, Iraq. At least three soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/05/2020: Assailants shot and killed an Iraqi Volunteer Forces soldier in Mtaibija, Saladin, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/05/2020: Assailants fired a rifle grenade at a police station in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2020: Assailants attacked national army soldiers in Jaroub, Al Jawf, Yemen. At least 15 assailants were killed and other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/05/2020: An assailant armed with a knife entered a Church of the Latter Day Saints missionary training center in Sao Paulo city, Sao Paulo, Brazil. The assailant attempted to stab police officers when they arrived at the center. The assailant was shot and killed by the officers. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2020: Assailants abducted three truck drivers from Qadir Karam, Sulaymaniyah, Iraq. The hostages were rescued on February 16, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/05/2020: An assailant opened fire inside a mosque in Harnai, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one police officer was killed and one person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2020: Assailants armed with knives and firearms attacked protesters and set fire to tents at al-Sadrain Square in Najaf city, Najaf, Iraq. At least 11 protesters were killed and 121 other people were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Saraya al-Salam.

02/05/2020: Assailants threw incendiary devices at sit-in tents in Tahrir Square, Baghdad, Iraq. One person was injured and three tents were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2020: Security forces intercepted and arrested an assailant traveling to plant two explosive devices near Rangajan, Assam, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA).

02/05/2020: Assailants set fire to a trailer truck in San Juana, Norte de Santander, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks along the Ocana-Cucuta highway on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Los Pelusos faction of the Popular Liberation Army (EPL).

02/05/2020: Assailants shot at and set fire to two trailer trucks in Brisas del Tarra, Norte de Santander, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks along the Ocana-Cucuta highway on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).
02/05/2020: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a residence in Mayfield, Cork, Ireland. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol vehicle in Masjid-e-Safid, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and three other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/05/2020: Assailants raided Issele-Azagba, Delta, Nigeria. Two people were abducted and later killed. Their bodies were recovered on or around February 18, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved.

02/04/2020: Assailants raided Mozogo, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least two people were killed and 20 houses were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on a customs checkpoint along Jibia-Zamfara road in Faru, Katsina, Nigeria. One customs officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Zangon Attakar, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least three people, including two Fulani civilians, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: Assailants attacked a military camp in Dinangourou, Mopti, Mali. An unknown number of assailants were killed and six soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: Assailants attacked two human rights activists, including Novaya Gazeta journalist Yelena Milashina, outside a hotel in Grozny, Chechnya, Russia. The victims were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/06/2020: Assailants abducted 20 passengers from two vehicles in Madiama, Mopti, Mali. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire on a Kenyan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy near Dhobley, Lower Juba, Somalia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: An explosive device detonated against a government official's vehicle in Hodan neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least one person was killed and two people were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: An assailant in a vehicle rammed into Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) soldiers in First Station neighborhood, Jerusalem, Israel. At least 14 soldiers, including a dual Israeli-American citizen, were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

02/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on Sheikh Hazim Al-Halfi along Al-Qasim Street in Basra city, Basra, Iraq. Al-Halfi, a Sadrist movement leader, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at the Lal Bazaar Police Station in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least one Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) observation post in Dolev, West Bank. At least one soldier was injured and the assailant later died from wounds he suffered in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant, Fakhr Mahmoud Abu Zayed Qurt, as a Palestinian extremist.

02/06/2020: An assailant opened fire on Israeli police officers outside Temple Mount between King Faisal Gate and Lions Gate in Old City neighborhood, Jerusalem, West Bank. The assailant was killed and at least one officer was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an Arab-Israeli extremist, identified as Shadi Bana. Sources noted that the assailant had recently converted from Christianity to Islam.

02/05/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused near Jaswanta Path in Pan Bazar area, Guwahati, Assam, India. This was one of two related attacks in Guwahati on this day. The United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Paltan Bazar, Guwahati, Assam, India. This was one of two related attacks in Guwahati on this day. The United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/06/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Taluqan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: Assailants attacked Gla, Diyala, Iraq. At least two people were killed and two other people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 02/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on construction workers in Molia, Tillaberi, Niger. At least 4 people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: Assailants attacked Ibua, Taraba, Nigeria. At least two civilians were killed and an unknown number of houses were set on fire during the raid. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of a Jukun militia.

02/06/2020: Assailants fired mortars that struck a house in Qaysar, Faryab, Afghanistan. Four people were killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/06/2020: Assailant abducted an off-duty soldier from his vehicle on Maimana-Andokhi road in Dawlatabad district, Faryab, Afghanistan. The soldier was executed shortly after. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/06/2020: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a residence in Mayfield, Cork, Ireland. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/06/2020: An explosive device detonated in Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on 112 Task Force Battalion personnel in Ngwom, Borno, Nigeria. At least one assailant was killed and several assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
02/06/2020: An explosive device detonated in Kyaukme, Shan, Myanmar. One civilian was killed and another civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/06/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Abdul-Raqib Ali, an Al-Islah party leader, in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/06/2020: An explosive device detonated while being defused near Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. Four soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/07/2020: Assailants attacked Siewali, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. Eleven civilians were killed and the village was razed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2020: Assailants shot and killed Abdullahi Farah Gab, the father of a police reservist, at his residence in Sangole, Garissa, Kenya. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/07/2020: An explosive device attached to a minibus detonated in Jisr Diyala neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. At least three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/07/2020: An explosive device detonated near an army vehicle in Buhriz, Diyala, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at the Al-Rafidain Center for Dialogue in Najaf city, Najaf, Iraq. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2020: Assailants set fire to a motorcycle and a residence in Mapimbi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least one person was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/07/2020: Assailants in a vehicle opened fire on a Sikh police officer patrolling near Uvas Reservoir in Morgan Hill, California, United States. Sukhdeep Gill, a Santa Clara County Sheriff's Deputy, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/07/2020: Assailants opened fire on Rex Maleficiado, a 6th Infantry Division staff sergeant, outside a church near Camp Gonzalo Siongco in Datu Odin Sinsuat, Maguindanao, Philippines. Maleficiado was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

02/07/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Gogone, Diffa, Niger. At least six civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). Sources noted that the victims were suspected of providing support to the Shekau faction of Boko Haram.

02/07/2020: Assailants abducted three workers of a grain producer while they were waiting for a ride to work in Santa Rita, Isabela, Philippines. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army.

02/07/2020: Assailants abducted a bodybuilder in Khowaja Pesta, Kunduz, Afghanistan. The hostage was killed a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/07/2020: An explosive device detonated as it was being defused in Chimtal district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/07/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Shor Tepa district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/07/2020: Assailants opened fire on police officers and National Directorate of Security members in the 14th Police District, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least one police officer and one NDS member were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/07/2020: Assailants attacked and killed a local police officer in Hussainkhel, Baghlan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/07/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least eight people were killed by assailants slitting their throats and 20 other people were reported missing in the incident. At least 12 of the missing people were found dead on February 9, 2020. The whereabouts of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/07/2020: An explosive device detonated near Morwai Kalan, Jharkhand, India. A child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

02/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an electricity tower in Medellin, Antioquia, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related attacks targeting energy towers in La Cruz on the same day. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2020: An explosive device targeting an electricity tower was discovered and safely defused in Medellin, Antioquia, Colombia. This was one of two related attacks targeting energy towers in La Cruz on the same day. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2020: An assailant wearing an Afghan military uniform opened fire on United States and Afghan military forces at a base in Shirzad district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. In what is considered an insider attack, six people, including two American troops and one Afghan soldier and the assailant, were killed and nine others, including six American forces and three Afghan soldiers, were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/08/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Fourth Company outpost in Mutaybijah, Saladin, Iraq. At least one soldier and two assailants were killed and another soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/08/2020: An explosive device detonated near a military vehicle in Rustumiyah area, Baghdad, Iraq. At least one soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2020: An explosive device detonated near a popular market in Rasheed neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. At least three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/08/2020: An explosive device detonated in Hurriya neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/08/2020: An explosive device detonated in Jokuk area, Baghdad, Iraq. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/08/2020: An explosive device detonated in Baghdad al-Jadeeda area, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2020: An assailant opened fire on police officers inside a police van after asking for directions near Simpson and Barretto Streets in Hunts Point neighborhood, Bronx, New York City, United States. At least one officer was injured in the assault. This was one of two attacks carried out targeting police officers by the same assailant within 12 hours. Authorities arrested Robert Williams in connection with the attack. During interrogation, Williams stated that he was "tired of police officers."
02/08/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/08/2020: Assailants set fire to a post office storing election materials in Bafut, North-West, Cameroon. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

At least three people were killed and 50 people, including civilians and vigilante members, were injured in the assaults. At least 200 cattle were also stolen. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected that the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) carried out the attacks.

02/08/2020: Assailants raided Old Gurmana, Niger, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks targeting villages in Shiroro district on this date. At least three people were killed and 50 people, including civilians and vigilante members, were injured in the assaults. At least 200 cattle were also stolen. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected that the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) carried out the attacks.

02/08/2020: Assailants raided Ashirika, Niger, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks targeting villages in Shiroro district on this date. At least three people were killed and 50 people, including civilians and vigilante members, were injured in the assaults. At least 200 cattle were also stolen. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected that the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) carried out the attacks.

02/08/2020: An explosive device detonated at the house of Victor Aguirre, a journalist for VA Television, in Naranjal, Guayas, Ecuador. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2020: The Explosive Ordnance Disposal team discovered and safely detonated an explosive device along Banki Junction – Miyanti Road in Bama district, Borno, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2020: The Explosive Ordnance Disposal Team discovered and safely detonated two explosive devices in Bitta, Borno, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/08/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Khost, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and two other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military convoy transporting election materials to Jakiri, North-West, Cameroon. At least three soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that separatists carried out the attack.

02/08/2020: Assailants attacked Younas Boneri and his son in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. Boneri, the General Secretary of the Sindh Awami National Party (ANP), and his son were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2020: An assailant drove his vehicle into a Republican voter registration tent in Jacksonville, Florida, United States. No casualties were reported in the attack. Authorities identified the assailant as Gregory William Loel Timm. In a police report, Timm told authorities that he "does not like President Trump" and that "someone had to take a stand."

02/09/2020: Assailants, including suicide bombers, opened fire at Zilzal 15 checkpoint near Gora, North Sinai, Egypt. At least seven soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on checkpoints in Gora on this day. At least 10 assailants were killed and seven other soldiers were injured across the three attacks. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 02/09/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting an army unit in Timiaouine, Adrar, Algeria. In addition to the assailant, at least one soldier was killed and six other soldiers were injured in the blast. The Algeria Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 02/09/2020: Assailants opened fire targeting civilians at an army checkpoint in Auno, Borno, Nigeria. At least 30 people were killed, an unknown number of people were set on fire, and at least 22 civilians were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Shekau faction of Boko Haram.

02/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on police officers and set fire to a police station in Keremou, Alibori, Benin. At least one officer was killed, one was wounded, and one other was reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

02/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on gendarmes in Alatona, Segou, Mali. At least three gendarmes were killed and three soldiers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Mosazai, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and three other people, including one officer and two soldiers, were wounded in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Mambasa, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least seven people were killed and shops were looted in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/09/2020: Assailants shot and killed Yoro Ould Daha, a top military commander of the Arab Movement of Azawad (MAA) in Tamkoutat, Gao, Mali. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).

02/09/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely while being planted along a road in Daraband, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/09/2020: An explosive device detonated at a quarry in Muhzin, Saladin, Iraq. At least three workers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 02/09/2020: An assailant entered the 41st Police Precinct along Longwood Avenue and opened fire in Bronx, New York City, United States. At least two police officers were injured in the assault. This was one of two attacks carried out targeting police officers by the same assailant within 12 hours. Authorities arrested Robert Williams in connection with the attack. During interrogation, Williams stated that he was "tired of police officers."

02/09/2020: Assailants shot and killed Ghulam Nabi, a contractor, outside his home in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind.

02/09/2020: Assailants fired three rockets targeting a military airfield on the outskirts of Kunduz, Afghanistan. The assailants then opened fire on the airfield. At least six assailants were killed and four other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/09/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused at the forest in Chintagupha, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

02/09/2020: Assailants threw two incendiary devices at a residence and attempted to ram the front door in Dungannon, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Frontier Corps (FC) patrol close to Shahrag Coal Mines in Shahrag, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one soldier was killed and five other soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2020: Assailants set up a road block and abducted six people along Maigumeri-Yubio Road in Madamari, Borno, Nigeria. At least three people were freed by the Nigerian Army on February 10, 2020, while the fate of the other three hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/09/2020: Assailants attempted to commit an arson attack on polling stations in Bangem, South-West, Cameroon. Seven assailants were killed as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/09/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a police checkpoint in Nahri Saraj district, Helmand, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least four police officers and two civilians were killed and another police officer was injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/09/2020: Assailants attacked Maash Aaba, Takhar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in Dasht-e-Qala on the same day. In the ensuing clashes with security forces a mortar hit a house, killing two people and injuring four other people. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

02/09/2020: Assailants attacked Qabr-e-Zubair, Takhar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in Dasht-e-Qala on the same day. In the ensuing clashes with security forces a mortar hit a house, killing two people and injuring four other people. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

02/09/2020: Assailants attacked a security forces patrol in Aliabad district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and another police officer was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/09/2020: Assailants attacked pro-government militia members in Baharak district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least one commander was killed and another militia member was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/09/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Godam, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least two civilians were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/09/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint near Gora, North Sinai, Egypt. This was one of three related attacks on checkpoints in Gora on this day. At least 10 assailants were killed and seven other soldiers were injured across the three attacks. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 02/09/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint near Gora, North Sinai, Egypt. This was one of three related attacks on checkpoints in Gora on this day. At least 10 assailants were killed and seven other soldiers were injured across the three attacks. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 02/09/2020: Assailants attacked 121 Battalion military forces in Pulka, Borno, Nigeria. At least one assailant was killed as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP).

02/09/2020: Assailants attempted to stop people from voting in Babungu, North-West, Cameroon. Two assailants were killed in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/10/2020: Assailants attacked the home of a pastor in Sebba, Sahel, Burkina Faso. One person, a deacon, was killed and seven people were abducted in the attack. Five of the hostages, including the pastor, were found dead on February 13, 2020 and the two others were released on February 12, 2020. 02/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on a gendarmerie post in Tanwalbougou, Est, Burkina Faso. At least nine assailants and two civilians were killed and 14 civilians were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

02/10/2020: An explosive device planted in a backpack detonated targeting a primary school in Zawiya, Libya. At least three students were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

02/10/2020: Assailants attacked troops in Gajiganna, Borno, Nigeria. One soldier was killed and one gun truck was seized in the incident. This was one of two attacks in nearby Borno villages on the same day. The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/10/2020: Assailants in trucks fitted with machine guns attacked positions of troops and militias in Rann, Borno, Nigeria. At least five people, including two assailants and three security personnel, were killed in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2020: Assailants threw an explosive device at a convoy of civilian security company with ties to the United States near Yusufiyah, Babil, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Saraya Thorat Aleshreen claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Diyala Archaeological Inspectorate employee near Jerusalem Intersection in Al-Quds, Diyala, Iraq. The employee, who is also related to a former Diyala Governor, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2020: Assailants attacked eastern Taizz, Yemen. At least 13 assailants were killed and several other assailants were injured while it is unknown whether there were any military casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) officers in Erapalli, Chhattisgarh, India. At least two officers and one assailant were killed and six other officers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/10/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and three other officers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/10/2020: Assailants attacked an intelligence and police forces military convoy in Jangal Bagh, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed and 33 other security personnel were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

02/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police post near Ayorou, Tillaberi, Niger. At least two police officers were killed and another officer was injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy (ACJD) members in La Libertad, Chontales, Nicaragua. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Guerrilla Front 33 faction of the New People's Army (NPA).

At least three people, including two assailants and one gendarme, were killed and two gendarmes were injured in the ensuing clash with security forces. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/11/2020: A suicide bomber detonated targeting a checkpoint outside the Marshal Fahim National Defense University in Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least six people were killed and 13 people were injured in the blast. The casualties included both military personnel and civilians. An explosives-laden vehicle was also discovered and defused at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

02/11/2020: A magnetic explosive device attached to a military vehicle detonated in Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Brigadier General Mustafa Abido in Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. Two people, including Abido and a bodyguard, were killed in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on a 212 Battalion army barracks in Tungushe, Borno, Nigeria. At least 2-3 assailants and one soldier were killed while one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two attacks in nearby Borno villages on the same day. summary: 02/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on Nizar Thanoun in Jamia area, Baghdad, Iraq. Thanoun, the Rashid Satellite Channel general supervisor, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/11/2020: Assailants fired three mortars at the Cemetery of Awi in Daquq district, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

This was one of two related attacks carried out by the same assailant within 24 hours. The assailant, identified as Heather Meisel, was arrested and claimed responsibility, stating that the incidents were intended to send a message to religious institutions.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, who denied involvement.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

summary: 02/23/2020: Assailants attacked an army camp in Bambara Maounde, Timbuktu, Mali. At least two assailants and three soldiers were killed and five soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, two soldiers were reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

02/23/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a pro-government rally in Ambo, Oromia, Ethiopia. At least 29 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oromo Liberation Front.

02/23/2020: Security forces intercepted and destroyed an explosives-laden boat in the Red Sea of the coast of Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/23/2020: Assailants attacked Djombo Djenenke, Mopti, Mali. At least two civilians were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2020: Assailants in the Gaza Strip fired at least 20 rockets, at least 10 of which were intercepted by the Iron Dome Missile Defense system over Nir Am, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to the killing of Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) member Muhammad al-Naim and the "ill-treatment" of his body by an Israeli army bulldozer.

02/23/2020: Assailants attempted to plant an explosive device along the Gaza Strip-Israel border near Khan Yunis, Gaza Strip. Both assailants were shot and killed by the Israeli Democratic Forces (IDF). The Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2020: Assailants fired an unknown number of rockets, some of which were intercepted by the Iron Dome Missile Defense system, over Ashkelon, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to the killing of a senior group member.

02/23/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Jain Bhavan Saurabhanchal building in Madhuban, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI - Maoist). Later authorities ruled out the involvement of Maoists.

02/23/2020: An explosive device detonated near a military convoy in Shah Wali Kot district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Following the blast, assailants then opened fire on the convoy. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/23/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a police officer in Yangi Qala, Balkh, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/23/2020: Assailants attacked raided Issele-Azagba, Delta, Nigeria. One person was killed, one person was injured, and one person, Helen Benwari, was abducted. The hostage was injured and released on February 26, 2020, following a ransom payment. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/23/2020: Assailants opened fire and set fire to the Radio Television Caraibes building in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, Haiti. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Port-au-Prince on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to police officers who were protesting against poor working conditions and making demands to form a union.

02/23/2020: Assailants attacked an Army barracks in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, Haiti. At least two soldiers were killed and six people were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks in Port-au-Prince on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to police officers who were protesting against poor working conditions and making demands to form a union.
02/23/2020: Security forces discovered and safely detonated an explosive device at Mile 4 of Baga-Doron Road in Cross Kauwa, Borno, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2020: Assailants threw grenades at a police checkpoint in Peshawar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2020: Assailants opened fire on Orlando Castillo, a human rights leader, in Buenaventura, Valle del Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2020: Assailants pursued a civilian, Ahmaud Arbery, with their trucks while he was jogging in the Satilla Shores neighborhood in Brunswick, Georgia, United States. Arbery was struck by one of the trucks and in the ensuing struggle was shot and killed. Authorities identified the assailants as Gregory McMichael, Travis McMichael, and William Bryan. In criminal proceedings, the assailants testified that they pursued Arbery because they believed he was involved in a series of burglaries in the neighborhood. Further investigations revealed that Travis McMichael had called Arbery a racial slur during the assault and that he had previously posted threats against African Americans on social media. All three assailants were found guilty of federal hate crime charges on February 22, 2020.

02/24/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Sanmatenga, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. Four people, including police officers and a civilian, were killed and five others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/24/2020: A sniper shot and injured an Iraqi Volunteer Forces soldier in Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2020: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Lt. Col. Suhail al-Dulaimi detonated along a highway in Karma, Al Anbar, Iraq. Lt. Col. al-Dulaimi, an Iraqi Volunteer Forces regiment commander, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army convoy in Pusht Rod, Farah, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2020: Assailants abducted Ahmad Ali Hassani, the Dara-i-Sufi Bala district head, along with two guards in Chapchal, Samangan, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/24/2020: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia checkpoint in Parabarat, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least five people, including militia members and a civilian, were killed and six other civilians were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/24/2020: Assailants attacked a police barracks with grenades in Ginchi, Oromia, Ethiopia. There were an unknown number of police officers who suffered from smoke inhalation. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2020: Assailants fired a rocket that landed and detonated at a playground in Sderot, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four projectile attacks in southern Israel on the same day. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to continued Israeli airstrikes in Gaza Strip that followed retaliatory Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) attacks. A spokesperson for Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) stated that the group wanted to "affirm the bombardment for bombardment model."

02/24/2020: Assailants fired a rocket that landed and detonated at the yard of a home in Sderot, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four projectile attacks in southern Israel on the same day. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to continued Israeli airstrikes in Gaza Strip that followed retaliatory Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) attacks. A spokesperson for Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) stated that the group wanted to "affirm the bombardment for bombardment model."

02/24/2020: Assailants fired a rocket that landed and detonated near a home in Netivot, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four projectile attacks in southern Israel on the same day. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to continued Israeli airstrikes in Gaza Strip that followed retaliatory Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) attacks. A spokesperson for Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) stated that the group wanted to "affirm the bombardment for bombardment model."

02/24/2020: Assailants fired 50-100 projectiles, of which 90% were intercepted by the Iron Dome Missile Defense system, in Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four projectile attacks in southern Israel on the same day. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to continued Israeli airstrikes in Gaza Strip that followed retaliatory Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) attacks. A spokesperson for Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) stated that the group wanted to "affirm the bombardment for bombardment model."

02/24/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near a truck transporting Chetsadakorn Sichan along Ban Not-Saba Yoi Road in Ban Not, Songkhla, Thailand. Assailants then opened fire on the truck following the blast. Sichan, the Saba Yoi district assistant chief, and seven other people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2020: Assailants set fire to Gottsunda Church in Gottsunda, Uppsala, Sweden. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2020: Assailants attacked and killed a police officer in Chimtal-e-Markazi, Balkh, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

02/24/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Chaudhry Javed, a Pakistan Muslim League (PML-N) leader, in Yazman, Punjab, Pakistan. Two people, including Javed, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/24/2020: Assailants fired a rocket that struck a house in Khar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2020: Assailants attacked Kikingi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Five assailants were killed and one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/24/2020: An assailant armed with a machete attacked the Crown Spa erotic massage parlor on Dufferin Street in North York neighborhood, Toronto, Ontario, Canada. At least one woman was killed and another woman and the assailant were injured in the assault. An individual claimed responsibility for the incident and authorities identified the assailant as being inspired by the incel ideology.

02/25/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Lieutenant Colonel Ahmad Shahata Abd Al-Maqsoud in Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. At least three soldiers, including Abd Al-Maqsoud, were killed and several soldiers were injured in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on Javedullah Khan in Shakardara, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Khan, a local Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz leader, peace committee member, and journalist, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2020: An explosive device detonated near a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) convoy in Gao district, Gao, Mali. At least three Irish soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2020: Assailants abducted two farmers in Gouzoudou, Extreme-North, Cameroon. The two farmers were killed sometime after. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, two Russian suspects were arrested in connection with the attack.

The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP).

The hostages were released a short time later, and the vehicles were destroyed. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Dimasa National Liberation Army (DNLA) and the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah (NSCN-IM).

02/26/2020: Assailants abducted a pro-government militia member in Moshaki, Ghazni, Afghanistan. The hostage was killed a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on a security post near an airport in Kenyam, Papua, Indonesia. At least three people, including one police officer and two soldiers, were injured in the attack. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/26/2020: Assailants attacked Hadd, Lahij, Yemen. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least one soldier was killed, one civilian was injured, and four other civilians were abducted in the incident. The whereabouts of the hostages is unknown. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/27/2020: An explosive device detonated at a market in Mahmudiyah, Babil, Iraq. Two civilians were killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Shindand district, Herat, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/27/2020: An explosive device detonated near a police convoy in Asiab Khan, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

This was one of two attacks carried out by the same assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

This was one of two coordinated bombings at the building on this date. The Armed Affinities in Revolt claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was intended to "disrupt the daily life of the region's bourgeois class, like an avalanche of hatred and vengeance."

02/27/2020: Assailants abducted three women in Maikadiri, Borno, Nigeria. All three hostages were rescued by 271 Tank Battalion troops later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/28/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Kapisa, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks targeting checkpoints on this date. At least one police officer was killed and three officers were killed across the assaults. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

02/28/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Laghman, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks targeting checkpoints on this date. At least one police officer was killed and three officers were killed across the assaults. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

summary: 03/09/2020: Assailants attacked and killed the son of former president Ali Saibou near Ouallam, Tillaberi, Niger. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the attack to the Islamic State in the Greather Sahara (ISGS).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 03/10/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Sanjitak, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least one pro-government militia member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/10/2020: An explosive device detonated near a police vehicle in 14th Police District, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military truck in Pisky, Donetsk, Ukraine. At least one soldier was killed and four soldiers were injured in the attack. The Donetsk People's Republic claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/10/2020: Assailants shot and killed two activists in Amarah, Maysan, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a liquor store in Bab al-Muadham, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint in Mdeina, Basra, Iraq. One police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a police station in Kakapora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/10/2020: Assailants attacked Kourou Kanda, Mopti, Mali. Ten people were killed and many homes were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on a suicide bomber before they reached their target in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The explosives detonated and killed the assailant but there were no other injuries in the foiled attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2020: Assailants abducted two teachers from Majzar district, Marib, Yemen. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. This was one of three related attacks targeting schools in Majzar district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/10/2020: Assailants detonated explosive devices targeting Al Salah school in Majzar district, Marib, Yemen. There were no reported casualties; however, the school was destroyed. This was one of three related attacks targeting schools in Majzar district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/10/2020: Assailants detonated explosive devices targeting Al Muthanna school in Majzar district, Marib, Yemen. There were no reported casualties; however, the school was destroyed. This was one of three related attacks targeting schools in Majzar district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
03/10/2020: Assailants attacked the Al-Houta post in Shibam, Hadramawt, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2020: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of Nicolaus Fest in Charlottenburg neighborhood, Berlin, Germany. Fest, a leading Alternative for Germany (AfD) member, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2020: A letter bomb delivered to 37-year old man detonated in Fabrica di Roma, Lazio, Italy. The mother of the intended target opened the letter and was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Anarchists.

03/10/2020: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail at the Hindu Munnani office in Katoor, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2020: Assailants attacked an army base in Diff, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least two soldiers and six assailants were killed and another soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on Alexis Vergara in Llano de Tabla, Cauca, Colombia. Vergara, a General Confederation of Labor (CGT) of Colombia member, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2020: Assailants attacked Al-Utamah, Al Jawf, Yemen. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/10/2020: Assailants attacked a military outpost near Mueda, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of two related attacks in Cabo Delgado on this date. At least 12 soldiers were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State.

summary: 03/10/2020: Assailants attacked a military outpost near Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of two related attacks in Cabo Delgado on this date. At least 12 soldiers were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 03/10/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers in Nguia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least 11 soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State.
