summary: 03/10/2020: An assailant drove his vehicle into a church serving as a polling station at Friendly Temple Missionary Baptist Church on Dr. Martin Luther King Drive in St. Louis, Missouri, United States. The assailant then poured water and bleach on voting machines and a polling official and threatened voters. There were no reported casualties in the attack. James Rowell claimed responsibility for the incident and stated “Ain’t nobody voting here today! I have the ability to kill everyone!”

03/11/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Palaposh, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least one pro-government militia member was killed and another member was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on police officers in Aqcha, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least two officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/11/2020: An explosive device detonated along a highway in Chinzai, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and three other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/11/2020: Assailants abducted and killed five soldiers in Garmsir, Helmand, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Jabibar, Mandera, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks along this road on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/11/2020: Assailants blocked a road, stopped a bus and forced passengers to disembark in Jabibar, Mandera, Kenya. The bus's mechanic was abducted and killed in the attack while the remaining passengers were allowed to leave. This was one of five related attacks along this road on the same day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2020: Assailants blocked a road and attacked a local government vehicle in Jabibar, Mandera, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks along this road on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/11/2020: Assailants blocked a road and stopped a Kenya Medical Supplies Agency (KEMSA) vehicle in Jabibar, Mandera, Kenya. At least four KEMSA employees were taken hostage and the vehicle was set on fire. Two of the hostages were killed shortly after the abduction and the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. This was one of five related attacks along this road on the same day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the vehicle was targeted because they believed it was transporting Safaricom equipment

03/11/2020: Assailants blocked a road and attacked a vehicle carrying khat in Jabibar, Mandera, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five attacks along this road on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/11/2020: Assailants attempted to extort from civilians in Pinabacdo, Samar, Philippines. Security forces responded to the attack, and two assailants and one soldier were killed in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

03/11/2020: Assailants shot and killed Maria Liza Toledo, a Ginatilan municipal councilor, outside the municipal building in Ginatilan, Cebu, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2020: Assailants abducted a District Reserve Guard (DRG) officer in Argatta, Chhattisgarh, India. The hostage was killed and his body was discovered later the same evening. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

03/11/2020: An explosive device detonated outside of the under-construction home of former Communication Minister Gokul Prasad Baskota in Lokanthali, Bagmati, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incident in pamphlets left at the scene.

03/11/2020: Assailants abducted a 15-year old girl in Gaurikhel, Province 2, Nepal. The hostage was rescued the following day, on March 12, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

03/11/2020: Assailants armed with mortars and other weapons attacked a Somali National Army (SNA) base in Awdheegle, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if there were any casualties in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2020: A sniper opened fire on Colonel Mohammed Sharaf Al-Sulayhi, a joint forces liaison officer, in Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Al-Sulayhi was wounded in the attack and died on April 17, 2020 as a result of his injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/11/2020: Assailants shelled Hadrami, Hays, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Several buildings were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/11/2020: A letter bomb was identified and safely defused at a postal sorting facility in Fiumicino, Lazio, Italy. This was one of four related letter bomb attacks in Lazio on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack may have been carried out by Anarchists.

03/11/2020: A letter bomb was identified and safely defused at a postal sorting facility in Tivoli, Lazio, Italy. This was one of four related letter bomb attacks in Lazio on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack may have been carried out by Anarchists.

03/11/2020: A letter bomb addressed to Francesco Chiricozzi, a former CasaPound member, was intercepted and safely defused at a postal sorting facility in Ronciglione, Lazio, Italy. This was one of four related letter bomb attacks in Lazio on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack may have been carried out by Anarchists.

03/11/2020: A letter bomb was identified and safely defused at a postal sorting facility along Via Tancia in Rieti, Lazio, Italy. This was one of four related letter bomb attacks in Lazio on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack may have been carried out by Anarchists.
03/11/2020: Assailants attacked a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, India. The worker was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2020: Assailants raided the residence of Adnan Rashidi, an Iranian Kurdish journalist, in Penjwin, Sulaymaniyah, Iraq. Rashidi and two of his family members were held hostage during the assault. All three hostages were released later the same day, though Rashidi was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2020: An explosive device detonated in Yebyu, Tanintharyi, Myanmar. At least one person going to fix a water pipe in a jungle area near a village was injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Yebyu on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Karen National Union.

03/11/2020: An explosive device detonated in Yebyu, Tanintharyi, Myanmar. At least one person walking to a rubber plantation was injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Yebyu on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Karen National Union.

03/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police officer guarding a journalist's office in Kanju, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers and mortars were fired at civilians near Poe Hpyu Kyun, Rakhine, Myanmar. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/05/2020: Assailants shelled the Al-Thawra general hospital and residential areas in Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/12/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Chahar Bolak district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least one local police officer was killed and another officer was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/11/2020: Assailants fired rockets targeting a military base housing Operation Inherent Resolve forces in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. At least three soldiers, including two United States soldiers and one British soldier, were killed and 12 soldiers were injured in the attack. United States, British, and Polish nationals were among the wounded. The Revolutionary League claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded the withdrawal of United States troops from Iraq. Sources also attributed the attack to Kata'ib Hezbollah.

03/12/2020: An explosive device detonated in Sadr city, Baghdad, Iraq. One civilian was injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in different parts of Baghdad on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2020: An explosive device detonated in Obaydi, Baghdad, Iraq. One civilian was injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in different parts of Baghdad on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2020: Assailants attacked members of Central African Liberation Movement for Justice (MLCJ) in Ndele, Bamingui-Bangoran, Central African Republic. During the clashes, at least 40 civilians were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Popular Front for the Renaissance of the Central African Republic (FPRC) and said they intentionally fought in Ndele town to cause maximum material and human damage.
gname: Popular Front for the Renaissance of the Central African Republic (FPRC)

summary: 03/12/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated at a security checkpoint in Tal Halaf, Al Hasakah, Syria. At least four people, including Turkish soldiers and militia members, were killed and 10 other people, including seven civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the People's Protection Units (YPG).

03/12/2020: Assailants shot and killed Alejandro Garde, a former New People's Army (NPA) member and current police informant, in Tacpao, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
03/12/2020: An explosive device detonated at the Transandino pipeline in Mallama, Narino, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Seijang, Manipur, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in Khost, Afghanistan. This was one of three attacks in which 13 roadside bombs were defused across different provinces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. This was one of three attacks in which 13 roadside bombs were defused across different provinces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting the house of Basra governor Asaad Al-Eidani in Basra, Iraq. At least one police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

The assailants suffered an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security outposts in Badakhshan, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security outposts in Wardak, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security outposts in Logar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/13/2020: Assailants attempted to plant an explosive device between At Tuhayta district and Khawkhah district in Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Security forces intercepted the assailants, defused the device, and there were no casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/13/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in Marjah, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of two similar incidents in which 15 devices were defused in different Helmand districts on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

03/13/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and defused in Nawa-i-Barakzayi district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of two similar incidents in which 15 devices were defused in different Helmand districts on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

03/13/2020: Assailants fired a missile and artillery shells into a residential neighborhood east of Taizz, Yemen. At least five civilians were killed and several civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked mourners in Tyohembe, Benue, Nigeria. Three people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on villages in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked mourners in Chongu, Benue, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks on villages in the area on this date. At least four people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured across this attack and an attack in Tse Ayev village. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked mourners in Ayev, Benue, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks on villages in the area on this date. At least four people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured across this attack and an attack in Chongu village. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.
03/13/2020: An assailant threw an explosive device at a police station in Kasarda, Odisha, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on Rahim Sagh al-Bandaf al-Montafaji in Zubair, Basra, Iraq. Al-Montafaji, an activist, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/13/2020: Assailants shelled the Al-Thawra general hospital in Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked Assaga village in Gueskerou, Diffa, Niger. At least one civilian was killed in the attack. This was one of five related incidents in Gueskerou on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked Djougoulou village in Gueskerou, Diffa, Niger. This was one of five related incidents in Gueskerou on this date. At least seven people were killed across this attack and two other attacks in Boula Massai and Boula Fougouri villages. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.

03/13/2020: Assailants attacked Boula Massai village in Gueskerou, Diffa, Niger. This was one of five related incidents in Gueskerou on this date. At least seven people were killed across this attack and two other attacks in Djougoulou and Boula Fougouri villages. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.

At least seven people were killed across this attack and two other attacks in Boula Massai and Djougoulou villages. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.

03/14/2020: Assailants attacked a military convoy near Timorak, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least three soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/15/2020: An assailant killed four police officers in an insider attack in Charshakhi, Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

At least eight people, including two police officers and six assailants, were killed and six other police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

At least three United States soldiers and two Iraqi soldiers were injured in the attack. The Revolutionary League claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded the withdrawal of United States troops from Iraq. Sources also attributed the attack to Kata'ib Hezbollah.

03/14/2020: Assailants attacked a vehicle of students in Birnin Gwari district, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and at least three others were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/14/2020: Assailants attacked a military detachment in Namisguima, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. Two people, including one solider and one assailant, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

03/14/2020: A sniper shot and killed an Iraqi Volunteer Forces member in Al-Zargah, Saladin, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 03/15/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Udzi Mindalagat, councilor of Datu Montawal town, while he was driving in Kayaga, North Cotabato, Philippines. Mindalagat and two others were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

He was suspicious that the ship may have been docked to spread COVID-19 or to facilitate a government takeover.

The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/02/2020: An incendiary device was discovered and removed at Ruth's House (a Jewish nursing home) in Longmeadow, Massachusetts, United States. The assailant attempted to light the device by setting fire to a Christian religious pamphlet left in the nozzle of the canister, but the attempt failed. John Michael Rathbun was identified as the assailant through DNA evidence. Sources noted that Rathbun, who had a history of anti-Semitic and racist posts on the internet, including an April 2 online calendar event titled "N…..r killing day" and an April 3 event titled "Jew killing day." Authorities suspected that Rathbun was part of an unnamed white supremacist group that discussed using explosives to carry out mass casualty attacks against religious and racial minorities. An unidentified member of the group posted online in March 2020 that the group should target "that jew nursing home in Longmeadow Massachusetts" which authorities suspect was in reference to Ruth's House.

04/02/2020: Assailants attacked Nkiedoro village in Bassa, Kogi, Nigeria. No casualties were reported though 15 houses were set on fire during the attack. Authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

summary: 04/06/2020: Assailants attacked the a timber company camp in Matarara, Susseundenga, Manica, Mozambique. An unknown number of workers were taken hostage, one of whom, a Vietnamese national, was killed. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Renamo Military Junta claimed responsibility for the attack, stating that they would target the foreign investment and their exploitation of resources unless the government solves the "Renamo problem."

04/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military base in Bamba, Gao, Mali. At least 10 assailants, including commander Abu Yahya al-Jaza'iri, and 25 soldiers were killed and several assailants and six soldiers were injured in the attack and ensuing clash. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2020: Assailants attacked Syrian soldiers in Deir ez-Zor, Syria. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/06/2020: Assailants attacked a police vehicle in Shorabak, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least one officer was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/06/2020: Assailants attacked Kircinga, Madagali, Adamawa, Nigeria. At least one civilian was injured and several houses were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram and Fulani extremists.

04/06/2020: An explosive device detonated along a bridge in Gorgunda, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
04/06/2020: An explosive device detonated against a motorcycle near Panhwar Sanhri, Balochistan, Pakistan. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2020: Security forces discovered and defused four explosive devices between Hubasan and Binanggaran, Samar, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/06/2020: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle in Bai Temur, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were killed and two were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/06/2020: Assailants set fire to a transmission mast in Rotterdam, South Holland, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/06/2020: Assailants fired three rockets targeting a complex housing oil facilities and workers in Burjesiyah, Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2020: Assailants set fire to a military tank and stole two other vehicles in Mussa district, Askira, Borno, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the raid. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

04/06/2020: Assailants fired mortars and opened fire in Ali Saray, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the same area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/06/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting police officers searching the scene of an earlier attack in Ali Saray, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three police officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the same area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/06/2020: Assailants set fire to a vehicle belonging to Frank Hansel, the chief whip for the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party in the local parliament, in Berlin, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but the car was destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2020: An assailant stabbed a telephone employee thought to be working on a 5G mast in Kilburn, London, United Kingdom. The employee was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/07/2020: Assailants attacked a police vehicle in Puli Alam, Logar, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/07/2020: Assailants abducted eight civilians after a civilian had opened fire on them in Nahri Surkh, Balkh, Afghanistan. All of the hostages were killed shortly after the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/07/2020: Assailants abducted a territorial army member in Qarchaghi, Badghis, Afghanistan. The hostage was killed a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces enforcing a COVID-19 curfew in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. At least one police officer and nine civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/07/2020: Assailants attacked Mautide, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Several structures, including a health post, school, and houses, were set on fire in the incident. This was one of two similar attacks in Muidumbe on the same day. At least 39 assailants were killed across both incidents. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attacks.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/07/2020: Assailants attacked Miengueleua, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of two similar attacks in Muidumbe on the same day. At least 39 assailants were killed across both incidents. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attacks.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/07/2020: Assailants attacked houses in an unknown number of villages in Mueda, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/07/2020: Assailants attacked Xitaxi, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least 52 youth were killed in the attack after refusing to join the armed group. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attacks.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/07/2020: Assailants threw a grenade and opened fire on a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) patrol in Bijbehara, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One CRPF officer was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. The Hind Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Hind Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/07/2020: Assailants attacked a militia checkpoint in Dara-i-Sufi Bala district, Samangan, Afghanistan. TThis was one of two related incidents targeting checkpoints in villages within this district on this date. At least 17 people, including 15 assailants and two militia members, were killed and 27 others, including 22 assailants and five militia members, were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

04/07/2020: Assailants attacked a militia checkpoint in Dara-i-Sufi Bala district, Samangan, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents targeting checkpoints in villages within this district on this date. At least 17 people, including 15 assailants and two militia members, were killed and 27 others, including 22 assailants and five militia members, were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

04/07/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Selwan al-Jundi, a local Baath Party official, in Nawah, Daraa, Syria. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/07/2020: Assailants raided a World Food Programme (WFP) warehouse in Mahate, Quissanga, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/07/2020: Assailants extorted civilians in Lakandula, Las Navas, Northern Samar, Philippines. One soldier was killed in the ensuing clash, while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/07/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) logistic convoy between Dahan-e-Murgha and Hisarak in Shahrak district, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least 18 assailants were killed in a retaliatory airstrike. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

04/07/2020: Assailants attacked an army logistics convoy in Pul-e-Rigi, Farah, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed and another assailant was injured in a retaliatory airstrike. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/07/2020: Assailants abducted four workers from a coal mine in Sharag, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two hostages were released and two hostages were shot and killed the following day on April 8, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/07/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Levies patrol in Gorky, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one Levies officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/07/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Philippine Army patrol performing COVID-19 outreach in Aguilan, Panuran, Iloilo, Philippines. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, one soldier was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/07/2020: Assailants opened fire civilians and a pastor in Ngbra-Zong, Bassa, Plateau, Nigeria. At least four people were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/07/2020: Assailants attacked and looted civilian homes in Matinglob, Tagdangua, Davao de Oro, Philippines. At least one assailant was killed in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/07/2020: Assailants raided a bridge construction site in Kishtapur, Maharashtra, India. There were no reported casualties, but several vehicles and equipment were set on fire in the attack. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident in a pamphlet and banner left at the site.

04/07/2020: Assailants attacked residents and set fire to shops in Chul, Askira district, Borno, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Chul on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram.

04/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel responding to the scene of an earlier attack in Chul, Askira district, Borno, Nigeria. At least two people were killed and three people were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Chul on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram.
04/07/2020: Assailants attacked Wemdio, Askira, Borno, Nigeria. At least two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

04/07/2020: Assailants ambushed Federal Police forces near Dibis, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three police officers were abducted in the attack. The hostages were killed and their bodies were recovered on April 9, 2020. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/07/2020: Assailants stole food packs from local officials in Guinmayohan, Balangiga, Eastern Samar, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/07/2020: Assailants attempted to attack a military base in Gamboru, Ngala, Borno, Nigeria. At least two assailants were killed and an unknown number of other assailants were wounded in an ensuing clash with security forces when they intercepted the assailants. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram.

04/07/2020: A drone dropped an explosive device on a Ukrayina TV crew in Krasnohorivka, Donetsk, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Donetsk People's Republic.

04/07/2020: Assailants attacked Toufou, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least one person was killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the assault. In addition, the assailants looted and set fire to residences and a health center in the village. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

04/08/2020: Assailants opened fire on the National Directorate of Security provincial spokesperson in Maymana, Faryab, Afghanistan. Three people, including the spokesperson, an NDS cameraperson, and a police officer, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2020: Assailants attacked Ntchinga, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/08/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and safely defused outside the guesthouse of a Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) politician in Nowshera district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2020: An explosive device detonated against a forest worker vehicle in Gulec, Diyarbakir, Turkey. At least five people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/08/2020: Assailants shot and killed a doctor at Miijiska market in Yaaqshid neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2020: Assailants attempted to kidnap a Choves Loh, a journalist, from his residence in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Loh was injured, but was not successfully abducted. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

04/08/2020: Assailants threw four homemade Molotov cocktails at St. Catherine Laboure Roman Catholic Church in Wheaton, Maryland, United States. There were no reported casualties, but the church was damaged in the attack. Authorities identified the assailants as Andrew Costas and Rebecca Matathias, who confessed to carrying out the attack. Matathias told authorities that Costas had described himself as the "Anti-Christ." Sources noted that Costas was arrested in March 2020 for drawing swastikas on a synagogue.

04/08/2020: Assailants abducted a former police officer in Kohakamokasa, Maharashtra, India. The former officer was dragged for 200 meters before being shot and killed. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was accused of being a police informant.
04/08/2020: An explosive device detonated in a tunnel in Kani Dumlan, near Dibis, Kirkuk, Iraq. A police officer was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) members in Aythah, Nineveh, Iraq. Three PMF members were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/08/2020: An explosive device detonated as it was being defused in Kirkuk, Iraq. At least two Federal Police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/08/2020: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Ramzi Mahrous, governor of Socotra in Hidaybu district, Socotra, Yemen. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Southern Resistance Forces (SRF).

04/08/2020: Assailants opened fire on Ramanand Yadav in Khagaria, Bihar, India. Yadav, a local gangster, his nephew, and an associate were killed and five others were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

04/08/2020: Assailants attacked residents and set fire to residences in Jootar, Ukum, Benue, Nigeria. At least three people were killed, two soldiers were reported missing, and approximately 200 houses were damaged in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Jukun militia.

04/08/2020: Assailants raided the staff quarters at a Societe Le Nickel (SLN) mining site in Kouaoua, North, New Caledonia. There were no reported casualties, but a house and a vehicle were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, two men were arrested in connection with the attack.

04/08/2020: Assailants attacked Shaoude, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least two people were injured and houses were set on fire during the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
04/08/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a school principal in Gulzar Aka neighborhood, Khost, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2020: Assailants abducted five Central Bank of Afghanistan employees in Ahmad Abad, Herat, Afghanistan. All five hostages were shot and killed a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/09/2020: Assailants fired five rockets from a vehicle targeting Bagram Airbase near Bagram, Parwan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 04/09/2020: Assailants attacked a military detachment in Solle, Nord, Burkina Faso. Five soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. Additionally, four soldiers were reported missing. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on police forces in Riyadh, Kirkuk, Iraq. Two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/09/2020: Assailants attacked Iraqi Volunteer Forces at al-Siddiq military airport outside Hulaywah, Saladin, Iraq. At least five assailants and three volunteer forces and four volunteer forces were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/09/2020: An explosive device detonated against a military vehicle between Koro and Dinangourou, Mopti, Mali. Three people, including a regional government official and two soldiers, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a tractor in Islah, Diyala, Iraq. Two farmers were killed and two farmers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 04/09/2020: A landmine detonated near Awdheegle, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least four civilians were killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2020: Assailants attacked military positions near Sukhnah, Homs, Syria. At least 29 people, including 18 soldiers and 11 assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/09/2020: Assailants shot and killed Ildefonso Nablo Jr., a former New People's Army member, in Buluan, Calbiga, Samar, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/09/2020: Assailants set fire to a transmission mast in Nuenen, North Brabant, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Afghan Local Police (ALP) district commander in Shahr-e Safa, Zabul, Afghanistan. Three people, including the district commander and two bodyguards, were killed and another bodyguard was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Taliban.

04/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on a gendarmerie station in Sebekoro, Kita, Kayes, Mali. One gendarme was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.
04/09/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Abdul Karim Haqmal, an imam at the Hazrat Ali mosque, in Barinkot, Farah, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2020: Assailants attacked residents in Muambula, Muidumbe, Quirimbas, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least five people were killed and a local church, homes of church missionaries, and a secondary school were damaged in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/09/2020: Assailants attacked a customs post in Sanankoro, Kita, Kayes, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the incident to Muslim extremists.

04/09/2020: Assailants fired a missile that struck a security building in Marib, Yemen. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/08/2020: Assailants shelled a neighborhood in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least one civilian was killed and two other civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed that attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
04/09/2020: Assailants attacked and killed a civilian in Agbenema, Omala, Kogi, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident through a video in which members of the group can be seen shouting "IS endures" and "God is Great."
