summary: 04/20/2020: Assailants abducted eight civilians resisting extortion attempts in Sholgara district, Balkh, Afghanistan. All hostages were shot and killed a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Malian military personnel between Tanal and Debere, Douentza, Mopti, Mali. At least 12 soldiers were injured in the blast. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/20/2020: Assailants armed with machetes and firearms attacked Tse Vambe, Guma, Benue, Nigeria. A farmer was beheaded and several houses were set on fire in the attack. This was one of three related attacks carried out by the assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/20/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Tse Gishe, Guma, Benue, Nigeria. Two civilians, including one woman who was sexually assaulted, were injured in the attack. This was one of three related attacks carried out by the assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/20/2020: Assailants attacked Mande Gem, Guma, Benue, Nigeria. At least eight people were shot and injured in the attack. In addition, two people were abducted. The hostages were rescued later the same day. This was one of three related attacks carried out by the assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/20/2020: Assailants opened fire on a World Health Organization (WHO) vehicle carrying COVID-19 test samples in Minbya, Rakhine, Myanmar. The driver was killed and a health department worker was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, military sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA), which denied involvement.

04/20/2020: An explosive device detonated in Karji, Farah, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed and another was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/20/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused three explosive intended to target police forces responding to an earlier attack in Bhalurungi, Jharkhand, India. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the area overnight. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/20/2020: Police personnel safely defused a letter bomb sent to police commissioner Chris Tang Ping-keung at the police headquarters  along Arsenal Street in Wan Chai neighborhood, Hong Kong, China. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an army vehicle near the Balligodle army base on the outskirts of Merca, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least seven soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/20/2020: Assailants attacked an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base housing Kenyan troops in Hosingow, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least 10 assailants were killed and 24 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/21/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused along Thomond Road in Ballyfermot, Dublin, Ireland. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/20/2020: Assailants attempted to throw incendiary devices at an IDF post near Amos Junction in Maale Amos, West Bank. At least one assailant was injured when soldiers opened fire before the attack could take place. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/20/2020: Assailants set fire to villages in Akure North district, Ondo, Nigeria. Several civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/20/2020: Assailants attacked residents and set fire to residences in Talla, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least two people, including the village chief, were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

04/20/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military checkpoint in Los Mangales, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Army of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 04/20/2020: Assailants hurled a petrol bomb targeting the Kherson synagogue in Kherson, Ukraine. There were no casualties as the device failed to ignite upon impact. Two Neo-Nazi extremists were arrested, and sources noted the attack was meant to mark the birthday of Adolf Hitler.

04/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Sangha commune in Bandiagara, Mopti, Mali. At least 12 people were killed and six others went missing in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/21/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Ghulam Sakhi Ghafori, the provincial police chief, in Bandar-e Zyarat, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and three officers, including Ghafori, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/21/2020: Assailants threw a grenade and attempted to steal weapons from police officers in Keegam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties, as the grenade did not detonate, and three assailants were arrested. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting the convoy of the Khost provincial governor in Darwaz-e Jamhoriat, Khost, Afghanistan. One assailant was killed and five other people, including 3 civilians, were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, source suspected the involvement of the Taliban.
04/21/2020: An explosive device detonated near 5th division soldiers in Umm Al Hinta, Diyala, Iraq. At least two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/21/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) patrol in Lazzakhah, Nineveh, Iraq. At least two PMF soldiers were killed and two other soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/21/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) patrol in Kanus, Nineveh, Iraq. At least three PMF soldiers were killed and three other soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
04/21/2020: An explosive device detonated near a factory in Surah, Saladin, Iraq. At least two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a bus transporting Federal Police officers in Dab Al Kabir, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one officer was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/21/2020: Assailants shot and killed Roldan Geroche, the father of a former New People's Army (NPA) member, in Dalimdim, Laak, Davao de Oro, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/21/2020: Assailants attacked military positions in As Sawmaah district, Al Bayda, Yemen. At least eight people, including one soldier and seven assailants, were killed in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2020: Assailants detonated a remote-controlled explosive device and opened fire targeting a military vehicle in Mir Ali, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one solider was killed and one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2020: An explosive device detonated in Kagai Bazaar, Khogyani district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least eight civilians, including two doctors, were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/21/2020: Assailants ambushed military vehicles near Garin-Kada, Zurmi, Zamfara, Nigeria. Four soldiers and at least 24 assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on Army personnel providing security for aid distribution in Diat, near Maria Aurora, Aurora, Philippines. Two soldiers were killed and three soldiers were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/21/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of Mumtaz Senel, the mayor of Yesilova district and a member of the main opposition Republican People’s Party (CHP), in Yesilova district, Burdur, Turkey. Senel and his wife were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle at a market in Khost, Afghanistan. Five people, including four soldiers and one civilian, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Taliban.

04/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of an antibiotics company in Phar Pyo, Rakhine, Myanmar. The driver of the vehicle was killed and a passenger was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

04/21/2020: Assailants attempted to kidnap a civilian in Azagba-Ogwashi, Aniocha South, Delta, Nigeria. At least one assailant was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/21/2020: Assailants attacked Tamur Jamil, northeast of Zalingei, Central Darfur, Sudan. One person was killed and five others were injured in the assault. In addition, an unknown number of villagers were held hostage and several houses were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2020: Assailants shot and killed a village chief working at a COVID-19 quarantine checkpoint in Julian Olivas, Camalaniugan, Cagayan, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2020: Assailants abducted 17 students from their houses in Dhamar, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/21/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Toopkhana, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least eight people, including seven Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers and one pro-government militia member, were killed and 10 other officers were injured while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts at a copper mine in Mes Aynak, Logar, Afghanistan. At least eight Afghan Public Protection Forces members were killed and five other members were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/22/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Sozma Qala, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least two three police officers were killed and six other security force members were injured while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. Additionally, one officer was abducted and his whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Mir Hazar, Zari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 13 people, including one police officer and 12 assailants, were killed and ten others, including three police officers and seven assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of three related incidents in Kandahar on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

04/22/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Sargo, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 20people, including four police officers and 16 assailants, were killed and 13 others, including four police officers and nine assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of three related incidents in Kandahar on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

04/22/2020: Assailants abducted 16 individuals of the Tarabin tribe in Baghdad, North Sinai, Egypt. A tribal elder among the hostages was killed on June 6, 2020. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/22/2020: Assailants attempted to abduct individuals of the Tarabin tribe in Wadi al-Sirr, South Sinai, Egypt. The abduction attempt was unsuccessful and an unknown number of assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/22/2020: Assailants attacked military checkposts in Kamarband, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed and four other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of three related incidents in Kandahar on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

04/22/2020: An explosive device detonated near a civilian vehicle along Ghazni-Jaghatu Road in Pirakai, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least four civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/22/2020: An explosive device detonated near a security forces patrol in Narin Kupri, Diyala, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed and seven other soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/22/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on 16th Infantry Battalion soldiers in Kapihan, Malabog, Paquibato, Davao del Sur, Philippines. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/22/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely in Khakrez district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least two assailants were killed and three other assailants were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/22/2020: An assailant rammed their vehicle into and stabbed an Israeli Border Police officer in Abu Dis, West Bank. The officer was injured and the assailant was killed when other officers opened fire. Police officers also defused a pipe bomb found at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Mohammed Halsa, a Palestinian extremist.
04/22/2020: Assailants abducted four medical workers from Ibn Sina Hospital in Sirte, Libya. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2020: Assailants attacked a Security Belt Forces checkpoint in Lawdar district, Abyan, Yemen. At least one security member was killed and another was abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

04/22/2020: Assailants set fire to a transmission mast along Zwanenburgseweg in Vlissingen, Zeeland, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/22/2020: Assailants set fire to a mobile telecommunications mast in Hollyhill, Cork, Ireland. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/22/2020: Assailants attacked a poultry farm in Issele-Azagba, Aniocha South, Delta, Nigeria. At least two people, including a farm manager and watchman, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
04/22/2020: Assailants attacked a government post in Kuf Ab district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2020: Assailants set fire to two WPD company transport trucks assisting in the construction of the Malleco Wind Farm in Collipulli, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2020: Assailants shot and killed Hugo de Jesus Giraldo Lopez, a human rights advocate and local social leader, at his house in San Pedro, Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Tarin Kot, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including four police officers and seven assailants, were killed and five other officers and approximately 15 other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2020: Assailants attacked Qalay-i-Zal, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least four people, including both soldiers and police officers, were killed and three others were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2020: Assailants opened fire on a national army checkpoint in Darqad district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least six people, including one soldier and five assailants, were in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/23/2020: Assailants attacked a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) checkpoint in Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. At least two PMF soldiers were killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/23/2020: Assailants fired three mortars that landed and detonated in Had Akhdar, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2020: Assailants in two explosives-laden vehicles attempted to attack a Ugandan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base at the Barawe airport in Barawe, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. The three assailants were killed in the blasts. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/23/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Regional Councillor Barry Amadou in Gayeri, Est, Burkina Faso. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2020: Assailants attacked military checkpoints in Dashti Archi district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 10 assailants were killed and eight other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/23/2020: An explosive device detonated against a vehicle in Sohbatpur district, Balochistan, Pakistan. One person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2020: Assailants attacked civilians traveling in Kinyandoni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One person was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR).
gname: Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR)

summary: 04/23/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of a United States diplomat, causing the car to crash, in Khartoum, Sudan. It is unknown whether the diplomat was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/23/2020: An explosive device detonated near a French forces vehicle outside In Araban, Menaka, Mali. At least two soldiers were injured in the blast. One of the injured soldiers died from his wounds on May 1, 2020. The Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 04/00/2020: Sometime between April 19, 2020 and April 27, 2020, an assailant attempted to attack Sultan Ahmet Mosque in Waldkraiburg, Bavaria, Germany. The assailant then set a fire in a garbage bin nearby. There were no reported casualties in the attack. An assailant, identified as Muharrem D., was arrested in connection with the attack and stated that he was an Islamic State supporter and voiced hatred towards Turks and espoused an "anti-Turkish worldview."

04/23/2020: Assailants abducted a 16-year old indigenous civilian in Murindo, Antioquia, Colombia. The hostage was released on May 23, 2020 after an explosive device that her captors instructed her to plant detonated prematurely. The hostage was injured in that blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

04/24/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of a police officer in Teghah-e-Timor, Ghor, Afghanistan. The officer's brother was killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/23/2020: Assailants opened fire on security outposts in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least 15 people, including 13 local police officers and two assailants, were killed and another police officer was taken hostage in the ensuing clash. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/23/2020: Assailants abducted a police constable, identified as Constable Javaid Jabbar, from his residence in Vihil, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The hostage was released later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2020: Assailants threw a grenade and opened fire on a camp of 29 Battalion Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) in Doonwari, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least three CRPF members were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/24/2020: Assailants fired four mortars that landed and detonated in Had Akhdar, Diyala, Iraq. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/24/2020: Assailants abducted Constable Sartaj Ahmad Ittoo from Shirpora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The constable was rescued later that day and at least two assailants were killed and one police officer was wounded during the rescue. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).

04/24/2020: Assailants threw three grenades targeting a hotel in Muse, Shan, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ta'ang National Liberation Army (TNLA), which denied responsibility.

04/24/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilian convoy being protected by park rangers in Virunga National Park in Rumangabo, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 17 people, including 13 rangers and four civilians, were killed and five people, including three rangers and two civilians, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR), which denied involvement.
gname: Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR)

summary: 04/24/2020: An assailant set fire to the Islamic Center of Cape Girardeau in Cape Girardeau, Missouri, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Nicholas Proffitt was arrested and charged in connection with the incident. Sources noted that Proffitt had previously attacked the mosque in 2009 and also stated that he targeted the building "because of the religion of those who worship there."

04/24/2020: Assailants attacked Djupabii, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 13 people and 10 assailants were killed and 20 people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 04/24/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a police vehicle carrying personnel of the Department of Social Welfare and Development and local officials in Rizal, Masbate, Philippines. At least one police officer and one government official were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/24/2020: Assailants set fire to a transmission mast in Almere, Flevoland, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/24/2020: Assailants set fire to a transmission mast on a tower along Van Duylstraat in Rotterdam, South Holland, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/24/2020: Assailants set fire to two footway boxes with broadband and phone cables along Springboig Avenue in Cranhill, Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting the same footway boxes in 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/24/2020: Assailants opened fire on the 303rd Infantry Brigade (IB) in Gawahon, near Victorias City, Negros Occidental,  Philippines. At least four assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/24/2020: Assailants attacked an Army patrol in Bayog, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. One soldier was killed. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/24/2020: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of former Borno governor, Senator Ail Modu Sheriff, along Maiduguri-Damaturu highway in Auno, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. At least five people, including three police officers, were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
04/24/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/24/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and defused in Khost, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/24/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and defused in Kapisa, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/24/2020: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and defused in Helmand, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2020: An explosive device detonated at an Afghan Local Police (ALP) base in Dara-i-Sauf Payeen, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least one officer was killed and four other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2020: Assailants opened fire on Jesus Memije Martinez, an official of the Human Rights Commission of the State of Guerrero (CDHEG), in Coyuca de Benitez, Guerrero, Mexico. Martinez and his son were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2020: Assailant attempted to rob the house and car of a Tarabin tribe member in Hama, North Sinai, Egypt. The tribe member was shot and killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/24/2020: Assailants opened fire on Floro Samboni Gomez at his residence in Loma Larga Bajo, Cauca, Colombia. Samboni Gomez, the president of the Loma Larga Bajo community action board, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Haidarabad, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least two pro-government militia members were killed and four other militia members were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/25/2020: Assailants fired a mortar at a residence in Kamengi Oliya, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast, No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/25/2020: Assailants destroyed a transmission tower in Baghlan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the atack to the Taliban.
04/25/2020: Assailants fired two mortars that landed and detonated in Had Akhdar, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2020: A sniper opened fire on emergency police officers between Abu Karma and Qubbah Diyala, Iraq. At least two officers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/25/2020: Assailants fired rockets targeting houses in Shalez, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Ghazni on this day. One civilian was killed and 11 others were injured across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/25/2020: Assailants fired rockets targeting houses in Arzo, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Ghazni on this day. One civilian was killed and 11 others were injured across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/25/2020: Assailants launched rockets and mortars on civilians in Kuhi, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least five civilians were killed and six others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
04/25/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a civilian in Sofi Qala, Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/25/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Almar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. One person was killed and another person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/25/2020: Assailants attacked military positions in Husha district, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least 16 people, including five soldiers and 11 assailants, were killed and 24 others, including 11 soldiers and 13 assailants, were wounded in the attack and ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/25/2020: Assailants set fire to a transmission mast along Bloemendaalsweg in Waddinxveen, South Holland, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

04/25/2020: Assailants abducted three farmers from Ibusa, Oshimili North, Delta, Nigeria. All three hostages were released shortly after the payment of a ransom. This was one of two similar attacks in Ibusa on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/25/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian from Ibusa, Oshimili North, Delta, Nigeria. The hostage was released shortly after the payment of a ransom. This was one of two similar attacks in Ibusa on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/25/2020: Assailants attacked security personnel in Datta Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Seven assailants and four security personnel were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2020: Assailants set fire to two footway boxes with broadband and phone cables along Springboig Avenue in Cranhill, Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting the same footway boxes in 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities asserted that the attack may have been carried out in relation to a conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

Taiwo was released on April 30, 2020 and Olabode was released on May 4, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

05/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Afghan Local Police (ALP) post in Mohammad Hassan, Paktika, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
05/04/2020: Assailants attacked and killed a female police officer in Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying Da Afghanistan Breshna Sherkat (DABS) employees near a power pylon in Chimtala, Kabul, Afghanistan. Four employees were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2020: Assailants fired missiles at a power pylon in Charikar, Parwan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks on pylons in Parwan on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/04/2020: Assailants fired missiles at a power pylon in Charikar, Parwan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks on pylons in Parwan on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) patrol in Handwara, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least four people, including three police officers and one civilian, were killed and another seven police officers were injured in the attack. The Revolutionary Front claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also noted that the assailants were linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

05/04/2020: Assailants attacked a Somali military and African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in Qoryoley district, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least six assailants were killed as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/04/2020: Assailants threw a grenade targeting a Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) camp guarding a power installation in Wagoora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One CISF officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/04/2020: Assailants attacked Mangara, Paktika, Afghanistan. At least 17 assailants were killed and 10 other assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

summary: 05/04/2020: Assailants attacked Cagembe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of 11 attacks across Cabo Delgado between May 3, 2020 and May 13, 2020 in which at least 11 people were kidnapped. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

05/04/2020: Assailants armed with firearms attacked Namaculo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. Additionally, at least five civilians were abducted, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. 05/12/2020: Assailants attacked Bakin Kogi, Kaduna, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in Kaduna within 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

05/12/2020: Assailants attacked Idanu-Doka, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and two others were injured in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in Kaduna within 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.
05/12/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian from his residence in Qabr Umayr, North Sinai, Egypt. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/13/2020: Assailants attacked Aqcha Numa, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including two pro-government militia members and five assailants, were killed and six others, including four militia members and two civilians, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/13/2020: Assailants attacked a local police outpost in Naw Abad, Takhar, Afghanistan. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least four police officers were killed and five other police were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on worshipers praying in a local mosque in Toro Dando, Khost, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a police officer in Panjwai district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle in Gardez, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least five people, including two soldiers, one police officer, and two civilians, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/13/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Tapamurch Nasiri, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including five assailants and two police officers, were killed and six others, including three assailants and three police, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/13/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police chief in Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. The police chief was killed and two bodyguards were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/13/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Hakim Abad, Laghman, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were killed in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/13/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting security personnel responding to a previous incident in Hakim Abad, Laghman, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/12/2020: Assailants threw a hand grenade at a tribal jirga in Chaknawar, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 12 people, including tribal elders, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 05/13/2020: Assailants attacked Ntoto, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of 11 attacks across Cabo Delgado between May 3, 2020 and May 13, 2020 in which at least 11 people were kidnapped. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

05/13/2020: Assailants attacked Diaca, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of 11 attacks across Cabo Delgado between May 3, 2020 and May 13, 2020 in which at least 11 people were kidnapped. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).
05/13/2020: Assailants attacked Kyaw Linn, a journalist, with a slingshot in Sittwe, Rakhine, Myanmar. Linn was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/13/2020: Assailants stopped a passenger bus transporting forestry workers along Route 5 South in Pidima, Ercilla, Araucania, Chile. The assailants forced the passengers to disembark and used the bus to block the road, stopping three trucks. There were no reported casualties, but three vehicles, including the bus and two trucks, were set on fire and another truck was damaged by gunfire. This was one of two similar incidents in this area on this day. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the attack and called for the release of eight Mapuche prisoners, who were detained for involvement in rural violence.

05/13/2020: Assailants stopped a truck and used it to block the road near Collipulli, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties, but the assailants set fire to three trucks and threw stones at two other vehicles during the attack. This was one of two similar incidents in this area on this day. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/13/2020: A land mine detonated targeting children picking mangoes in Charkay, Rakhine, Myanmar. Two children were killed and one other was injured. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA), which the group denied

05/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on Elpedio Julway Mahinay at his farm in Planas, Guihulngan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. Mahinay, a barangay councilor, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA). In addition, the assailants stated that the victim was targeted for supporting the Army and the government.

05/13/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Leonardo Pinheiro, a local news blogger and activist, in Bananeiras, Silva Jardim, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2020: Assailants attacked Makyali, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least seven people were killed in the attack. Others were reported missing and their whereabouts are unknown. This was one of three related attacks in Kaduna within 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

05/14/2020: An explosive device detonated near a police patrolling vehicle in 14th Police District, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed and three others, including two police officers and a civilian, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/14/2020: In an insider attack, assailants killed two police officers at a security outpost in Siah Sang, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Two other officers were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/14/2020: Assailants opened fire on security forces at a checkpoint in Sarak-e-Naw, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and four others, including two police offficers and two civilians, were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/14/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Maidan Hawai, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least six people, including two police officers, three soldiers, and one civilian, were killed and five others, including four security forces members and a civilian, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/14/2020: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Dawlatabad district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least five commandos were killed and one Humvee was struck by a rocket while another ran over an explosive device that detonated during the attack. This was one of two similar attacks that occurred in this district on the same date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/14/2020: An explosive device detonated near a military vehicle in Dawlatabad district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least four soldiers were killed and two other soldiers were injured in the blast. This was one of two similar attacks that occurred in this district on the same date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/13/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Aks-I-Daud, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least ten people, including five assailants and five police officers, were killed and six others, including three assilants and three police, were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, another police officer was abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/14/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Qara Boian, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least four people, including two pro-government militia members and two assailants, were killed and another militia member was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/14/2020: Assailants attacked Quissanga district, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Security forces repelled the attack and eight assailants were killed. The Islamic State Central Africa Province claimed responsibility for the incident.

The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources also attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and the Haqqani Network.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/14/2020: A sniper shot and killed the Mukhtar of Mubarak village, in Mubarak, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

05/15/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. 05/15/2020: Assailants opened fire on security forces in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least three security forces members, including two police officers, were killed and 11 others were abducted in the assault. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. 05/15/2020: Assailants set fire to a cell phone tower along Todd Place in Otahuhu, Auckland, New Zealand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar arson incidents targeting towers in Auckland on the same night. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities suspected that the attacks may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists and noted that the assailants told victims that "they had no right to wear a facemask" and accused them of trying to import COVID-19 into their territory.

05/00/2020: Sometime between May 1, 2020 and May 31, 2020, assailants abducted 20 civilians near Barani, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. At least six hostages were killed and one hostage was released on an unknown date. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).

05/17/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a police officer in western Khost, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/17/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military vehicle in Ahmad Shah Baba Mina, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the assault. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 05/17/2020: Assailants opened fire on border forces members in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Ahangaran, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least five people, including three police officers and two assailants, were killed and another two police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/17/2020: An assailant opened fire on a security forces checkpost in Regi, Farah, Afghanistan. Khaki Safed district police chief Tufan (Toofan) Nawruzi was killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2020: Assailants attacked a vehicle in Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least five people, including two police officers and three civilians, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, who denied involvement.

05/17/2020: Assailants attacked Kokola, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Seven civilians were killed. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also suspected the involvement of the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

summary: 05/17/2020: An female suicide bomber drove a scooter taxi into the vehicle of Ahmed Mus Nur, the governor of Mudug province, and detonated an explosive device in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. At least five people were killed, including Nur, his brother, two bodyguards, and the assailant. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/17/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Taqi, Logar, Afghanistan. Security forces repelled the assault with an airstrike, which killed seven assailants and injured five additional assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/17/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Qabr Umayr, North Sinai, Egypt. At least three people and nine assailants were killed and eight people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/17/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Regi, Farah, Afghanistan. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least two police officers were killed and four officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/17/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Gajiganna, Borno, Nigeria. At least 20 civilians and an unknown number of assailants were killed and 14 other people were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram.

05/17/2020: A landmine detonated in Dih Yak district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, who denied involvement.

05/17/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Kieran Wylie, a former member of the Provisional Irish Republican Army (IRA) and Oglaigh Na hEireann, along Lenadoon Avenue in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Dissident Republicans.

05/17/2020: Assailants threw a petrol bomb targeting a house in Downhill Avenue area, Newtownbreda, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2020: Assailants armed projectiles and firearms attempted to attack Baga, Kukawa, Borno, Nigeria. At least 20 assailants were killed and nine soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram.

05/17/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Iraqi Volunteer Forces responding to a fire set at a wheat field in Cherdaghli, Saladin, Iraq. At least one Volunteer Forces member was killed and three were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/17/2020: Assailants set fire to a wheat field in Cherdaghli, Saladin, Iraq. No casualties were reported. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/17/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Kodi Khel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. Five assailants were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/17/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Mama Khel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. Five assailants were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/17/2020: Assailants opened fire on Mohammad Naeem Safi, an influential tribal elder and private school owner, inside his residence in Ghazi Khan Khel, Kapisa, Afghanistan. Safi was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/17/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a former Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) fighter in Hawayij, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2020: An assailant armed with a shotgun threatened to ram his vehicle into the gate of a Coast Guard base in Essexville, Michigan, United States. The assailant, identified as Jesse T. McFadden, was unable to gain access to the base and drove away. Police later arrested McFadden at a nearby gas station. In a call to police dispatchers earlier in the day, McFadden indicated that he wanted to attack a both a police station and Standish hospital where he intended to "disrupt the power to the hospital, unlock the doors, and release patients under COVID-19 quarantine." Authorities believed that he attempted to steal the helicopter to aid in his attack on the police station and hospital.
05/18/2020: Assailants set fire to the house of a musician and religious figure in Ujaldhal, Sylhet, Bangladesh. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2020: Assailants, including a suicide bomber in an explosives-laden vehicle, attacked a National Directorate of Security (NDS) base in Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least eight people, including the assailant and seven NDS members, were killed and 40 other people were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the Afghan government "declaring war" on the group and carrying out attacks on civilians in Taliban-held areas.

05/18/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan forces in Hazara Qeshlaq, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least 14 people, including seven assailants and seven pro-government militia members, were killed and five others, including three assailants and two militia members, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2020: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle in Khaki, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least four people were killed and eight others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Naw Abad, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least two security forces members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Turkmen Qoduq, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2020: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Khwaja Noor, Herat, Afghanistan. At least two people, including one soldier and one civilian, were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2020: Assailants attacked a military patrol in Nongodoum, Nord, Burkina Faso. At least seven people, including two soldiers and five civilian defense volunteers, were killed in the incident. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal-Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/18/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Frontier Corps (FC) convoy assigned to protect an oil and gas facility in Pir Ghaib, Bolan district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least six soldiers were killed and four other soldiers were injured in the blast. The United Baloch Army (UBA) and the Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) separately claimed responsibility for the attack.
05/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on soldiers in Mand, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one soldier was killed in the assault. The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/18/2020: An explosive device detonated near Nizameia Mosque at Eidek bazaar in Idak, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one soldier was killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2020: Assailants opened fire and set fire to houses in Dapchi, Yobe, Nigeria. One soldier and five assailants were killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram.

05/18/2020: Assailants attacked Obo, Haut-Mbomou, Central African Republic. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the ensuing clash with the army. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the incident was carried out by the Union for Peace in the Central African Republic (UPC), which denied involvement.

05/18/2020: Assailants set fire to crop fields south of Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one Shia militia member was killed and three other members were injured when attempting to put out the fire. summary: 05/18/2020: Assailants set fire to a Télédiffusion de France (TDF) relay in Jarrie, Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes, France. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three attacks targeting telecommunication relays in Grenoble on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, authorities suggested that the attacks may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, authorities suggested that the attacks may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Anarchists.

05/18/2020: Assailants set fire to an ATM at the intersection of Omirou Street and Paleologou Street in Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. 05/18/2020: Two female suicide bombers detonated at the residence of a militia member in Mandarari, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. 05/18/2020: Assailants attacked Kautikari, Borno, Nigeria. At least one person was beheaded and a herder was abducted in the incident. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Boko Haram.

05/18/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Kelele, seven miles from Eringeti, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Six people were killed in the raid. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

05/18/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Iftikhar, Kirkuk, Iraq. One security personnel member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/18/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a military convoy in Maza, Gujba, Yobe, Nigeria. At least two soldiers and three assailants were killed and three soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/18/2020: Assailants threw an incendiary device at Amar Koul Temple in Badamwari, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2020: Assailants tampered with the brakes on the vehicle of prominent human rights lawyer Aiman Omarova in Almaty, Kazakhstan. Omarova was able to escape the car before it caught fire. She also noted that legal documents were stolen from her car. No group claimed responsibility for the incident, which Omarova said was related to her work exposing Muslim reeducation camps in China. In the previous year, Omarova had discovered a dead cat hung on her gate and contended that her dog was poisoned - both incidents were thought to be related to her job activities as well.

05/19/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Sanjidak, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/19/2020: Assailants opened fire on worshipers inside a mosque in Gorchak, Khost, Afghanistan. At least three people were killed and another person was injured in the assault. Sources also suspected that the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State may have carried out the attack.

05/19/2020: Assailants attacked an army post in Bilabirim, Diffa, Niger. At least 12 soldiers and seven assailants were killed and 10 soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/19/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan Army headquarters in Warduj district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed and three soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/19/2020: Assailants ambushed a military patrol in Werebere, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. Two soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2020: Assailants cut sleepers on a railway and derailed a Fepasa company train transporting pine wood logs near Pidima, Ercilla district, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the incident and called for the release of Mapuche political prisoners detained in Angol prison

05/19/2020: Assailants stopped a bus carrying Fulani civilians along Wukari-Rafin kada road in Wukari, Taraba, Nigeria. 05/19/2020: Two assailants attempting to plant an explosive device on a Ministry of Defense vehicle were identified and arrested in Kote Sangi, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

The Resistance Front (TRF) claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack t the Hind Province of the Islamic State.

General Barre, a police commander and the national police health department acting chief, was not harmed as he was not in the vehicle; however, one bodyguard was killed and at least three police officers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacked and stated that General Ali Hersi Barre was targeted for his affiliation with the federal government.

05/20/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Doma, Mopti, Mali. Four people were killed and one person was reported missing following the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2020: Assailants attacked Obo, Haut-Mbomou, Central African Republic. At least ten assailants were killed and one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash with military and MINSUCA forces. 05/20/2020: Assailants briefly held villagers hostage in Gadchiroli, Maharashtra, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist), noting that the targeted villagers had removed Maoist banners and pamphlets from the scene of an earlier attack.

05/20/2020: An assailant armed with a semi-automatic rifle opened fire on civilians at the Westgate Entertainment district in Glendale, Arizona, United States. Three people were injured in the attack. Armando Hernandez Jr. claimed responsibility in a Snapchat video just prior to the incident. Hernandez was arrested and revealed to authorities that he was an incel and that he had "targeted couples to make them 'feel the pain he feels on a daily basis."'

05/20/2020: Assailants attempted to set a mosque on fire in Hawal, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least three people, including one police officer and two assailants, were killed and another officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

05/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a joint police checkpost in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Head constable Anoop Singh was killed and two police officers were injured in the attack. 05/21/2020: An assailant opened fire on a soldier and attempted to ram his vehicle into a gate at the Naval Air Station in Corpus Christi, Texas, United States. The soldier was injured and the assailant was shot and killed by other soldiers at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources identified the assailant as Adam Alsahli. Sources noted that Alsahli had expressed support for hard-line Islamic clerics and Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

05/21/2020: Assailants equipped with an explosives-laden vehicle and firearms attacked a Somali National Army (SNA) base in Burdhubo, Gedo, Somalia. At least five assailants were killed and it is unknown if any assailants were wounded as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Al-Shabaab.

05/21/2020: Assailants abducted one person in Wulgo, Borno, Nigeria. The hostage was released a short time later when soldiers pursued the assailants. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/21/2020: Assailants attacked Robert Hurtado, a former member of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC), in Munguido, El Litoral del San Juan, Choco, Colombia. Hurtado was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/22/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Faizabad, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least nine people, including two soldiers, three territorial army members, and four assailants, were killed and seven other security force members were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/22/2020: A sniper shot and killed Abdullah Rasul, the district police chief, at the police headquarters in Chaki Wardak district, Wardak, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
