05/25/2020: An assailant drove his vehicle into a herd of sheep near Deirat, West Bank. There were no human casualties, but a number of sheep were killed and injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to an Israeli settler.

05/25/2020: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attacked a military base in Dhobley, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least two assailants were killed and dozens of other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Al-Shabaab.

05/25/2020: An assailant attempted to stab a Border Police officer on Meir Naker Street in Jabal Mukaber, Jerusalem, West Bank. Border Police officers shot and injured the assailant. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

05/25/2020: An explosive device detonated near a security forces vehicle in Mir Ali, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/25/2020: Assailants shot and killed Aniceto Rasalan, secretary to the mayor, while eating at a restaurant on Notre Dame Avenue, Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/25/2020: Two assailants armed with pistols opened fire on Philip Mkhwanazi, a municipal councilor and the Khula village induna (head), near his residence in Khula, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. Mkhwanazi was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on Thamsanqa Gcabashe, an African National Congress (ANC) Youth League secretary for eThekwini municipality, at a friend's residence in Hammarsdale, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. Gcabashe was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/25/2020: Assailants attacked Biziba in Uvira, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

05/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a security convoy near Qalat city, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least three soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/26/2020: Assailants set fire to a 5G phone mast along Brodie Avenue in Mossley Hill, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suggested that the incident may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

05/26/2020: Assailants attacked an army position in Soueram, Fotokol, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least five assailants and two soldiers were killed in the attack. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/26/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Tikamaibo, near Irumu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 26 people were killed in the attack. This was one of two related attacks overnight in the area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

05/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Somali National Army (SNA) patrol in Galoley, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. At least nine soldiers were killed and several others were injured. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that they would "continue attacking those who sabotage peace and stability" in Somalia.

05/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Tarnol area, Islamabad, Islamabad Capital Territory, Pakistan. Two police officers were killed in the attack. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on Tehsil Khan, a former Taliban commander and a peace committee member, near Wana, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Khan was injured and his brother (Karam Khan) were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/26/2020: Assailants fired a ballistic missile targeting a meeting of senior military and defense officials at the Sahn al-Jinn base near Marib, Yemen. At least seven soldiers, including relatives of the Army chief of staff, were killed and several soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
05/26/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in Godagil, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/26/2020: Assailants set fire to offices inside the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints-Kalaeloa Chapel on Lauwiliwili Street in Kalaeloa, Hawaii, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/26/2020: Security forces intercepted four assailants attempting to plant an explosive device on a civilian vehicle in Beit Shemesh, Jerusalem, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attempted attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Colonel Saleh Ali Jaber in Shibam, Hadramawt, Yemen. Jaber and four bodyguards were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/26/2020: Assailants set fire to approximately 100 residences in Mee Let Wa, Chin, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties as the village had been deserted in February 2020, though assailants also opened fire on civilians who attempted to extinguish the fire. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA), which denied involvement.
05/26/2020: Two explosive devices detonated in Muse, Shan, Myanmar. At least one child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/26/2020: Assailants attacked Kabingo village, Minembwe, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of two attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

05/26/2020: Assailants attacked Kivumu village, Minembwe, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of two attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

05/27/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a police commander in Bazaar-e-Sarkocheh, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/27/2020: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Shajoy district, Zabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/27/2020: Assailants abducted seven health workers and a shopkeeper at a Zamzam Foundation health center in Galoley, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. All eight hostages were killed and their bodies were discovered on the outskirts of the village the following day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of Al-Shabaab.

05/27/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Turkish military convoy along the M-4 highwat in Ghassaniyeh, Idlib, Syria. At least one Turkish soldier was killed and another was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to The Turkestan Islamic Party.

05/27/2020: Assailants attempted to attack a security checkpoint in Saladin, Iraq. Security forces repelled the attempted attack, destroying two vehicles. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/27/2020: Assailants opened fire on a security post in Habash, near Sadr al-Yusufiyah, Babil, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed and one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/27/2020: Assailants attacked military positions in Raqqah, Syria. At least 19 people, including 11 assailants and eight soldiers, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/27/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Puntland Dervish Forces patrol near Bulo Hawo, between Bardale and Qansax Dheere, Bay, Somalia. The commander was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/27/2020: Assailants extorted civilians in Xariima, Dinsor, Bay, Somalia. Security forces responded to the incident killing two assailants and injuring an unknown number of other assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/27/2020: Assailants abducted three former rebels who had joined peace efforts in Canvais, Motiong, Samar, Philippines. The outcome of the hostage taking is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

05/27/2020: Two assailants attempted to ignite incendiary devices outside of the residence of Dimitris Stamatis, the head of the Deposits and Loans Fund, in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. There were no reported casualties as the devices failed to ignite. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Anarchists.

05/27/2020: Assailants attacked Nkulu, Nyunzu, Tanganyika, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least two people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured across the three attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Hapa Na Pale and the Twa Militia.

05/27/2020: Assailants attacked Lengewe, Nyunzu, Tanganyika, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least two people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured across the three attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Hapa Na Pale and the Twa Militia.

05/27/2020: Assailants attacked Bandale, Nyunzu, Tanganyika, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least two people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured across the three attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Hapa Na Pale and the Twa Militia.

05/27/2020: Assailants abducted Bishop Joseph Masin, the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) chair, in Bukan Sidi, Lafia, Nasarawa, Nigeria. Masin was released on May 30, 2020. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved.

05/30/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in 5 Nisan area of Baglar, Diyarbakir, Turkey. One police officer, Atakan Arslan, was killed. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/27/2020: Assailants in Afghanistan fired two mortars that landed and detonated in Gardaoo, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/27/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a police post in Putkha, Sopore, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties as the device failed to detonate and was later defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, four Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) members were arrested in connection with the attack.
05/27/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Zulfiqar Ali Mandranifor, a journalist for Koshish Daily, in Jacobabad, Sindh, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of the Hajj and Religious Affairs minister in Hisa-i-Duwumi Kohistan district, Kapisa, Afghanistan. The minister was not harmed, but at least one bodyguard was killed and three other bodyguards were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/28/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Sarjoy Dokhtar, Parwan, Afghanistan. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, seven soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the attack. Additionally, two other members were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/27/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpost in Regi neighborhood, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 15 people, including seven police officers and eight assailants, were killed and one other officer was injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, three officers were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/28/2020: Security forces opened fire on a suicide bomber in an explosives-laden vehicle attempting to drive past a checkpost in Rajpora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack, as the assailant fled the scene and the explosives were safely defused. Sources suspected that the assailant intended to target a Central Reserve Police Forces (CRPF) convoy later the same morning. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

05/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Somali National Army (SNA) vehicle along Awdhegle-K60 Road in Awdheegle, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Five soldiers were killed. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that they would "continue attacking those who sabotage peace and stability" in Somalia.

05/28/2020: Assailants attacked Macomia town, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least 97 people, including 78 assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash and occupation of the town, which lasted until March 30. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/28/2020: Assailants attacked Dogon farmers in Tile, Mopti, Mali. At least seven farmers were killed, some of which were burned alive. This was one of three incidents in different Dogon farming villages in the same 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Muslim extremists.

05/28/2020: Assailants attacked Dogon farmers in Bankass, Mopti, Mali. This was one of three incidents in different Dogon farming villages in the same 24-hour period. At least 20 farmers were shot and killed or burned to death across the two attacks in Bankass and Koro. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incidents to Muslim extremists.

05/28/2020: Assailants attacked Dogon farmers in Koro, Mopti, Mali. This was one of three incidents in different Dogon farming villages in the same 24-hour period. At least 20 farmers were shot and killed or burned to death across the two attacks in Bankass and Koro. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incidents to Muslim extremists.

05/28/2020: Assailants attacked a displaced persons camp in Mikenge, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two United Nations peacekeepers and three civilians were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

05/28/2020: Assailants opened fire on Hussein Mohamed Daud, a former electoral delegate, in Yaqshid, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. Daud and his bodyguard were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/28/2020: An explosive device planted in the vehicle of Abdishakur Hussein Abdi detonated near Muna Hotel in Hamarweyne, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. Abdi, a senior police officer, and his security guard were killed and another police officer was injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out as part of a larger effort to "clear the path by wiping those who oppose" their agenda.

05/28/2020: Assailants attempted to extort food from civilians in Limonda, Opol, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. When villagers refused, the assailants set fire to a church and four houses. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident, but later denied involvement.

05/28/2020: Assailants opened fire on KC Rathod, the Una municipal president and a former BJP MLA, in Una, Gujarat, India. Three people, including Rathod, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/28/2020: Assailants ambushed the convoy of HirShabelle state President Mohamed Abdi Waar in Gaal, Hiiraan, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to tribesmen.

05/28/2020: An assailant armed with an AK-47 style rifle opened fire targeting the 3rd precinct police station in Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States. No casualties were reported in the attack. The police station was the scene of a concurrent protest where it was set on fire. Ivan Harrison Hunter, member of the Boogaloo movement, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "I helped the community burn down that police station” and “I didn’t’ [sic] protest peacefully Dude … Want something to change? Start risking felonies for what is good." Sources noted that Hunter was in contact with Steven Carillo, another member of the Boogaloo movement, and encouraged him to "go for police buildings."

05/29/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Birjanak, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/29/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in the Piro Kalachi, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least two people were killed and five other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan border force security outposts in Maqbalo Valley, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least 35 people, including 20 assailants and 15 soldiers, were killed and three other soldiers and dozens of other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/29/2020: An explosive device detonated in Pozalich, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least one child was killed and another child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants ambushed a convoy of traders, being escorted by a local defense group, while on their way from Titao to Solle in Loroum district, Nord, Burkina Faso. At least 15 people were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.
05/29/2020: A landmine detonated targeting an Afghan Army vehicle in Kurki, Herat, Afghanistan. Three soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants attacked Litamanda, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of four similar attacks in the same area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants attacked Chai, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of four similar attacks in the same area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants attacked Nova Zambezia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of four similar attacks in the same area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants attacked Nova Vida, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of four similar attacks in the same area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/29/2020: Assailants set fire to forests in Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on federal security officers outside of the Ronald V. Dellums Federal Building in Oakland, California, United States. Officer David Patrick Underwood was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. Authorities arrested Steven Carrillo and Robert Justus in connection with the incident, and Justus confessed his involvement as a driver. Authorities stated that Carrillo and Justus were members of the Boogaloo movement. Steven Carrillo pleaded guilty to murder charges in connection with the attack and stated that he was aligned with the Boogaloo movement and wanted to carry out attacks against federal law enforcement personnel. Sources noted that the assailants were members of a Facebook group affiliated with the Boogaloo movement.

05/29/2020: An assailant attempted to run over Israel Defense Forces (IDF) soldiers near Halamish, West Bank. The soldiers opened fire on the vehicle, killing the assailant. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

05/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on National Directorate of Security (NDS) personnel in Charikar, Parwan, Afghanistan. A passerby was killed and one NDS official was injured in attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/29/2020: Assailants shot and killed Rene Boy Jagunos, a Barangay councilor, in Sinaysayan, Kitaotao, Bukidnon, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants raided a Kumar-Rai Construction Company bridge construction site near Ghaghri, Jharkhand, India. Two employees were abducted and several workers were beaten in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants opened fire and abducted four people in Boji-Boji Owa, North East, Delta, Nigeria. Two people were injured and the hostages were released the following day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved.

05/29/2020: An assailant armed with a kitchen knife attempted to stab a police officer outside the City Hall building in Temple Terrace, Florida, United States. The assailant was shot and killed while one officer was injured in the attack. The assailant was identified as Heba Momtaz Alazhari. Her brother, Muhammed Momtaz Al-Azhari, had been arrested five days earlier. In a reconstructed note found at her residence, she stated that she wanted to carry out a jihad in revenge for the arrest of her brother.

05/29/2020: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attacked a Burmese border patrol station in Thazin Myaing, Rakhine, Myanmar. At least four police officers were killed and nine other people, including six other officers and three family members, were abducted in the assault. The three family members were released on May 30, 2020, and the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for military operations against an AA camp that resulted in casualties.

05/29/2020: An explosive device detonated near a military convoy outside Nan-Kut, Kuktai, Shan, Myanmar. Following the blast, assailants the attacked the convoy. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. The Ta'ang National Liberation Army (TNLA) claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Madain, Diyala, Iraq. At least three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: Assailants attacked workers at a manganese mine in Tassiga, Gao, Mali. No casualties were reported, though mining equipment was stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/29/2020: Assailants attacked an electricity substation in Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/29/2020: An assailant lit a container filled with gasoline outside a police station in Washington, District of Columbia, United States. The police station was not damaged in the attack. The assailant, identified as Jerrit Jeremy Pace, was arrested at the scene; in a social media post prior to the attack, Pace "announced his intent to burn down a police station" and "encouraged rioting against law enforcement."

05/29/2020: An assailant drove his vehicle into a crowd of protestors in Bakersfield, California, United States. At least one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested an individual, Michael Tran, in connection with the incident. Additionally, sources stated that Tran had driven by the protest multiple times and engaged with protesters prior to the assault.

05/30/2020: An explosive device detonated near a security outpost in Shapo, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least two shepherds were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/30/2020: Assailants fired a mortar at a security outpost in Joy Dukhtar, Parwan, Afghanistan. The mortar missed the outpost and struck a house, killing three children. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/30/2020: An explosive device detonated near a military vehicle in Al-Maghara, North Sinai, Egypt. At least five soldiers were killed in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/30/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Khursid TV vehicle at a traffic square in Police District 4, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two people, incluidng a journalist and the driver, were killed and six other employees were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/30/2020: Assailants raided Kompienga cattle market and opened fire on traders and civilians in, Kompienga, Est, Burkina Faso. At least 35 people were killed and several more were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/30/2020: Assailants ambushed a humanitarian convoy returning from Foube near Barsalogho, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. 13 people, including civilians and military police, were killed while 40 others were wounded. Six police officers were also reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/29/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost near the the Kamal Khan Water Dam in Chahar Burja district, Nimroz, Afghanistan. A police officer was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/30/2020: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail into an NYPD vehicle in Fort Greene neighborhood of Brooklyn, New York City, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Two assailants, Colinford Mattis and Urooj Rahman, were arrested in connection with the incident. Sources noted that the suspects were seen traveling in their vehicle attempting to pass out incendiary devices to rioters earlier in the evening. The suspects pled guilty and claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/30/2020: Authorities apprehended three armed assailants making Molotov cocktails in a parking lot in Las Vegas, Nevada, United States. The assailants were on their way to attack a Black Lives Matter protest. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities identified the assailants, Stephen Parshall, Andrew Lynam, and William Loomis, as members of the Boogaloo movement and stated that the group intended to incite violence and riots at the protest for the death of George Floyd.

05/30/2020: Assailants attacked Kwabula, Askira-Uba, Borno, Nigeria. At least two civilians were killed and an unknown number of civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Shekau faction of Boko Haram.

05/30/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Jarabulus, Aleppo, Syria. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) and the People's Protection Units (YPG).

05/30/2020: Assailants attacked a Federal Police security point in Sawiyah, Saladin, Iraq. At least one police officer and two assailants were killed and five other officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/31/2020: Assailants abducted nine civilians from farms near Katwa, Walese Vonkutu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Five of the hostages were killed, one escaped, and the fate of the remaining hostages remains unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

05/30/2020: Assailants attempted to set fire to the vehicle of Eric Alauzet, a La Republique En Marche!(LREM) Member of Parliament, in Besancon, Bourgogne-Franche-Comte, France. Alauzet's vehicle was not damaged, but two other cars in the area were set on fire. No casualties were reported in the attack. Anarchists claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/30/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Maqam, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one assailant was killed and one assailant was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/30/2020: An assailant threw an explosive device at police officers during a protest in Charlotte, North Carolina, United States. One officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/30/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle carrying Colonel Nabil Al-Walidi in Ghathamah, Marib, Yemen. Colonel Al-Walidi, the commander of the Saqr 2 Brigades, and an unknown number of other soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/30/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Hisarak district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 19 people, including three local police officers and 16 assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/31/2020: Assailants opened fire on police officers at a fruit market of a bazaar in Ghoryan district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one officer was killed and two other officers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/31/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan forces defusing an explosive device in Chaghra, Wardak, Afghanistan. In the ensuing clash a mortar struck a nearby house, killing three children and injuring three other children. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacked to the Taliban.

05/31/2020: A roadside landmine detonated targeting a minibus along Afgoye-Mogadishu road, Hawa Abdi, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least 10 people were killed and at least three others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/31/2020: An explosive device detonated in Shabi, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least one child was killed and another child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
05/31/2020: An explosive device detonated in Police District 11, Kabul, Afghanistan. Three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/31/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed two soldiers in Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/31/2020: An incendiary device detonated outside a residence on the 24th floor of Wing Shue House at Lei Muk Shue Estate in Tsuen Wan, Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2020: Assailants attacked Kondori, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. At least three people were killed and three other people were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Shekau faction of Boko Haram.

05/31/2020: Assailants armed with AK-47s raided the residence of Abubakar Atiku in Yantumaki, Danmusa, Katsina, Nigeria. Atiku, the Yanumaki district head, was killed and one of his guards was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

05/31/2020: A female suicide bomber detonated targeting civilians in Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. The assailant was killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/31/2020: Assailants attempted to extort a banana plantation owner in Tower, Langgal, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. Police officers intervened, killing two assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

05/31/2020: Assailants threatened workers and set fire to equipment at a road construction site in Gumla, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

05/31/2020: Assailants abducted a police officer from his residence in Thairan, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The police officer was rescued by security forces shortly after the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/31/2020: Assailants fired mortars into Al-Salakhana, Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least four people were killed and 18 others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah), who denied involvement.

05/31/2020: An assailant opened fire on a security guard while attempting to attack the residence of Mohammad Shakeel Saifi, a Republican Party of India (RPI) leader, in Nihal Vihar, Delhi, India. Saifi was not harmed; however, the security guard was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/31/2020: Assailants attacked a refugee camp in Intikane, Tahoua, Niger. At least three people were killed and a guard was abducted in the raid. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.
06/01/2020: Assailants attacked and killed two Afghan Regional Army members in Warduj district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/31/2020: Assailants set fire to civilian houses in Kichele, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

05/25/2020: Assailants raided Debiro, Biu, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks on this date. At least three assailants were killed and one civilian was injured across the three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/25/2020: Assailants raided Tarfa, Biu, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks on this date. At least three assailants were killed and one civilian was injured across the three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/25/2020: Assailants raided Dakwaima, Biu, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks on this date. At least three assailants were killed and one civilian was injured across the three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/31/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting an oil pipeline in Imad, Shabwah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, government sources attributed the attack to Southern Resistance Forces (SRF).

05/31/2020: Assailants set fire to civilian residences and farmland in Al-Qasimia, Al Hasakah, Syria. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of four related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Free Syrian Army.

05/31/2020: Assailants set fire to civilian residences and farmland in Al-Rihaniyya, Al Hasakah, Syria. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of four related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Free Syrian Army.

05/31/2020: Assailants set fire to civilian residences and farmland in Anik al-Hawa, Al Hasakah, Syria. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of four related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Free Syrian Army.

05/31/2020: Snipers opened fire on firefighters responding to crop fires northwest of Tall Tamr, Al Hasakah, Syria. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of four related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Turkish-backed militia.

05/31/2020: Assailants abducted a member of the Arakan Liberation Party (ALP) in Sar Pyin, Toungup, Rakhine, Myanmar. The whereabouts of the hostage, identified as U Win Hlaing, is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA), which the group denied.

05/31/2020: Assailants attacked Itakpa, Obi, Benue, Nigeria. At least 13 people, including the ward chair of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), were killed and at least 24 people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

05/31/2020: An assailant detonated dynamite at the entrance of the Teleamazonas channel headquarters in Centro del Carmen, Guayaquil, Guayas, Ecuador. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/31/2020: An assailant threw an incendiary device through the window of the East Valley Republican Women Federated (EVRWF) office in La Quinta, California, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested Carlos Espriu in connection with the incident and noted that he wrote “I wanna go burn sh** n get hit with tear gas" on social media three days prior to the attack.

05/31/2020: Assailants attacked government forces in Nihm district, Sanaa, Yemen. At least 30 assailants were killed in the attack, which lasted over 48 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/31/2020: An assailant armed with a handgun drove his truck into a crowd of Black Lives Matter (BLM) protesters at the intersection of Colorado boulevard and Fair Oaks avenue in Pasadena, California, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The assailant, Benjamin Hung, pleaded guilty to 11 charges related to the incident. Hung and his associates identified themselves as "Shooters of the Nest" and expressed their intent to attack members of "Antifa." Hung's pickup truck displayed flags with symbols embraced by right-wing militia groups, and a license plate that stated "WAR R1G."  Sources noted that Hung previously expressed support for the Three Percenters militia and QAnon conspiracy theories. and a license plate that stated "WAR R1G."  Sources noted that Hung previously expressed support for the Three Percenters militia and QAnon conspiracy theories.

06/01/2020: An explosive device detonated near a rickshaw in Jangal Bashi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least seven people were killed and six other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/01/2020: Assailants attacked the governor's office in Ghoryan district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/01/2020: An assailant armed with a samurai sword attacked a police station in Daha Selatan, South Hulu Sungai, South Kalimantan, Indonesia. One police officer was killed and another officer was injured before the assailant was shot and killed. A police vehicle was also set on fire in the assault. The East Asia Division of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack, and the assailant was carrying a handwritten manifesto calling for Muslims to wage jihad during the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Jamaah Ansharut Daulah.
gname: East Asia Division of the Islamic State

summary: 06/01/2020: Assailants threw molotov cocktails at and spray-painted anti-immigrant and anti-Muslim sentiments on the walls at the Koprulu Haci Ibrahim Aga Mosque in Limassol, Cyprus. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Anti-Muslim extremists.

06/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a security forces vehicle in Makhmur, Arbil, Iraq. At least two soldiers were killed and two other soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on Sayed Munir, a traffic police department head, in Mahmud Raqi, Kapisa, Afghanistan. Munir was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2020: Assailants threw four Molotov cocktails at a police station at the intersection of Irakleiou Avenue and Kosta Varnali Street in Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2020: Assailants armed with firearms attacked Ikereku village in Akinyele, Oyo, Nigeria. No casualties were reported. This was one of four related attacks in Akinyele on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

06/01/2020: Assailants armed with firearms attacked Pade village in Akinyele, Oyo, Nigeria. No casualties were reported. This was one of four related attacks in Akinyele on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

06/01/2020: Assailants armed with firearms attacked Olanla village in Akinyele, Oyo, Nigeria. No casualties were reported. This was one of four related attacks in Akinyele on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

06/01/2020: Assailants armed with firearms attacked Babamogba village in Akinyele, Oyo, Nigeria. No casualties were reported. This was one of four related attacks in Akinyele on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

06/01/2020: Assailants attacked farmers near Damboa, Borno, Nigeria. Four farmers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
06/01/2020: Assailants set fire to wheat fields in Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2020: Assailants attacked military checkpoints in Yangi Qala district, Takhar, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed and five others were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/01/2020: Security forces apprehended assailants as they were planting landmines in Epaw, Las Navas, Northern Samar, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/01/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a police checkpoint in Madaing, Cabanglasan, Bukidnon, Philippines. Two police officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two incident in this area over a 24 hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/01/2020: Assailants set fire to Shakira village, Fizi, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ngumino militia.

06/01/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed four civilians in Shewa, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban. Sources noted the victims may have been targeted due to their alleged links to the public uprising forces and/or due to their religious affiliation as Ismaili Muslims.

06/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on Cameroonian military personnel in Otu, South-West, Cameroon. Five soldiers were killed and several were injured in the attack. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2020: An explosive device attached to a bicycle detonated in Mirokhan Chowk, Larkana, Sindh, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Ethiopian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base between Bardale and Qansax Dheere, Bay, Somalia. At least 24 assailants were killed and an unknown number of other assailants were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
06/01/2020: Assailants shot and killed pastor Emmanuel Bileya and his wife as they were farming in Mararaba, Donga, Taraba, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2020: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail at a police substation in New Haven, Connecticut, United States. There were no reported casualties, but the building was damaged in the attack. This was one of two related arson attempts targeting police stations in New Haven on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/01/2020: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail at a police substation in New Haven, Connecticut, United States. There were no reported casualties, but the building was damaged in the attack. This was one of two related arson attempts targeting police stations in New Haven on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/01/2020: Assailants set fire to two Molotov cocktails along a road between the Magnolia and Drayton Hall plantations in North Charleston, South Carolina, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that many historic plantations had received threats due to their connection with the American Civil War, slavery, and ongoing racial controversy.

06/01/2020: Assailants attempted to abduct two brothers of the Sawarka tribe in Joura, North Sinai, Egypt. One of the brothers was killed and the other escaped before being kidnapped. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 06/02/2020: Assailants attacked Sudanese military forces in Kutum, North Darfur, Sudan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sudan Liberation Movement.

06/01/2020: Assailants set fire to the Thelma Orr Community Policing House (COP) in Racine, Wisconsin, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. An individual identified as Justin Hernandez claimed responsibility for the incident. Police arrested a total of four individuals, including Hernandez, for the attack.

06/02/2020: In an insider attack, a police officer opened fire on his colleagues at a police outpost near Tarin Kot, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/02/2020: An explosive device detonated outside the Wazir Akbar Khan Mosque in the Green Zone area of Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two people, including a religious scholar identified as Mohammad Ayaz Niyazi, were killed and two other people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 06/02/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Three civilians were killed and four others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/02/2020: Assailants abducted a National Directorate of Security (NDS) official in Rouji-ha, Badghis, Afghanistan. The hostage was killed later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/02/2020: An explosive device detonated against a police vehicle responding to an attack the previous night in Cabanglasan, between Mandaing and Anlugan, Bukidnon, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two incident in this area over a 24 hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA).

06/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Nabil Hasan al-Quaety, an Agence France Presse photojournalist, in Dar Saad, Aden, Adan, Yemen. Al-Quaety was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian transport vehicle between Ansongo and Menaka, Mali. At least one person was killed and 50 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Kenyan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) vehicle in Hosingow, Badhadhe, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least two soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that they would continue targeting "the enemy of peace in Somalia."

06/02/2020: Assailants set fire to wheat fields in Um al-Khair, Al Hasakah, Syria. No casualties were reported, though the fires spread to civilian residences. This was one of five related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Turkish-backed militia.

06/02/2020: Assailants set fire to wheat fields in Lilan Amirt, Al Hasakah, Syria. No casualties were reported, though the fires spread to civilian residences. This was one of five related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Turkish-backed militia.

06/02/2020: Assailants set fire to wheat fields in Madba’a, Al Hasakah, Syria. No casualties were reported, though the fires spread to civilian residences. This was one of five related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Turkish-backed militia.

06/02/2020: Assailants set fire to wheat fields in Al-Amiriya, Al Hasakah, Syria. No casualties were reported, though the fires spread to civilian residences. This was one of five related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Turkish-backed militia.

06/02/2020: Assailants attacked firefighters and civilians responding to fires in wheat fields near Tal Tamer, Al Hasakah, Syria. There were no reported casualties. This was one of five related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Turkish-backed militia.

06/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on Little Flock Missionary Baptist in Louisville, Kentucky, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2020: Two explosive devices detonated near Kinchaung Bridge, Punnakyun, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were an unknown number of civilian and soldier casualties in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

06/02/2020: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail targeting a police vehicle outside an officer's residence in Duluth, Georgia, United States. No casualties were reported as the fire was extinguished shortly thereafter. This was one of two related attacks on police vehicles on this date. Authorities arrested three suspects, Alvin Joseph, Ebuka Chike-Morah, and Lakaila Mack, in connection with both attacks.

06/02/2020: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail targeting a police vehicle outside an officer's residence in Lawrenceville, Georgia, United States. No casualties were reported as the fire was extinguished shortly thereafter. This was one of two related attacks on police vehicles on this date. Authorities arrested three suspects, Alvin Joseph, Ebuka Chike-Morah, and Lakaila Mack, in connection with both attacks.

06/02/2020: Assailants set fire to a police vehicle outside an officer's residence in Gainesville, Georgia, United States. No casualties were reported but the vehicle was damaged in the attack. Authorities arrested five individuals in connection with the attack.

06/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on military forces in Douentza, Mopti, Mali. At least one assailant and one soldier were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2020: Assailants stopped a vehicle and abducted five people including a soldier, a police officer, and humanitarian workers along Monguno-Maiduguri highway near Gasarwa, Borno, Nigeria. The soldier and the police officer were killed on or before June 11, 2020. Two other hostages, identified as Abdulrahman Babagana and Joseph Prince, were killed on or before July 22, 2020. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least 24 guards were wounded and an unknown number of guards were killed, in addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties in the attack; however, Sharif escaped unharmed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

06/02/2020: Assailants set fire to mining equipment at the Pakhar bauxite mines in Pakhar, Lohardaga, Jharkhand, India. No casualties were reported, though 11 mining vehicles were destroyed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

06/02/2020: Assailants attacked Angolan Armed Forces bases in Chivovo, Cabinda, Angola. At least 12 people, including four soldiers, two assailants, and six civilians, were killed in the ensuing clash. The Front for the Liberation of Cabinda / Cabinda Armed Forces (FLEC-FAC) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Front for the Liberation of Cabinda / Cabinda Armed Forces (FLEC-FAC)

summary: 06/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on Jamil Mahar in Taluka Lakhi Ghulam Shah, Shikarpur, Sindh, Pakistan. Mahar, a journalist, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Khushkroad, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Ten civilians were killed and four others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/03/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Chino, Paktia, Afghanistan. Three police officers were killed in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Chino on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of district police chief Mohammad Homayoun while responding to a previous attack in Chino, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least two officers were killed, including Homayoun and his driver, while up to four others were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Chino on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
06/03/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a pro-government militia member in Chashma-e-Shirin, Badghis, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/03/2020: Assailants on motorcycles opened fire on the vehicle of Somerado Guro, the mayor of Lumbaca-Unayan, in Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. Rohaifa Guro, the wife of the mayor, was killed while three others were wounded including Mayor Guro, his driver, and an aide. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
06/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in Wadi Al Shay, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least 10 soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/03/2020: An assailant stabbed a police officer along Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn, New York City, United States. After stabbing the officer, the assailant was able to steal his service weapon and shoot and injure two additional officers before the assailant was shot and injured by other officers responding to the scene. Dzenan Camovic, who allegedly shouted "Allahu Akbar" before carrying out the attack, was indicted in connection with the incident. Authorities stated that he possessed materials regarding violent extremism and specifically materials related to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

06/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on military personnel in Rafah, North Sinai, Egypt. The attack resulting in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 06/03/2020: Assailants beheaded three people in Imbada, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/03/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted along National Highway 38 in Ramnagar, Assam, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA).

06/03/2020: Assailants attacked health workers in Ndop, North-West, Cameroon. At least four assailants were killed and it is unknown whether there were any other injuries when the military responded to the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

06/03/2020: An assailant armed with a knife attempted to stab guards at Hashmonaim checkpoint in Hashmonaim, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

06/03/2020: Assailants attacked Anguwan Tudu, Kajuru, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least 10 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

06/03/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Logar, Afghanistan. At least one assailant was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
06/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on refugees near 19 de Outubro (ADPP), Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/03/2020: Assailants attacked Moussa village, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 16 people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of Congo (CODECO).
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 06/03/2020: Assailants raided a number of villages in Madagali district, Adamawa, Nigeria. An unknown number of people were killed and houses were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Kasarah, Sanaa, Yemen. At least nine soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

06/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on Dharambir Bansal Dharmu in Kyllong-Mathei, East Khasi Hills, Meghalaya, India. Dharmu was injured in the attack. The Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council (HNLC) claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the attack was a warning shot against businesses that won't pay income tax to the group.

06/04/2020: An explosives-laden bicycle detonated at a bazaar in Qarabagh district, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and three other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/15/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting pro-government militia members in Aylaq-e Sangi, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least 13 people, including nine assailants, were killed while another 29 people, including 18 assailants, were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/04/2020: Assailants abducted a farmer and his three sons near Shaykh Baba, Diyala, Iraq. The farmer was injured and released while his three sons were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

At least three people, including the Obe district police chief, National Directorate of Security head, and an army commander, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/04/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Bal'ad, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. Security forces and civilians sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

06/04/2020: An explosive device detonated along the M4 highway near Ariha, Idlib, Syria. Sources noted that the blast occurred shortly after a joint Russian-Turkish patrol had passed through the area. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Twigwaneho militia.

06/04/2020: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a truck transporting coal from Tendele coal mine along Highway R618 in Mtubatuba, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on a passenger bus near Al-Ma'in, Ibb, Yemen. At least two people were killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

06/05/2020: Assailants attacked a security convoy after detonating an explosive device in Jaldak, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least 10 police officers were killed and another officer was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/05/2020: An explosive device detonated target Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers responding to an earlier attack in Darkhan, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least 11 officers, including a commander, were killed in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/05/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Men-Qoolak, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Iraqi Volunteer Forces vehicle in Wafa, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least two volunteer forces members were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 06/05/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Qaysar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least three security personnel were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on a tribal elder and his family in Alsang, Wardak, Afghanistan. Four people, including the tribal elder and three of his family members, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/05/2020: An assailant drove his vehicle through the front doors of a Target located at 2030 Hammond Square Drive in Hammond, Louisiana, United States. The assailant then exited the vehicle, walked/ran through the store, and exited out of the back. He attempted to carjack various vehicles before he was arrested by police officers. During the incident the assailant also dropped four suspicious packages that he wanted people to believe were explosive devices. None of the packages contained explosive material. At least one person was injured by shards of glass when the assailant initially drove into the store. The assailant was identified as Walter Allbritton III. Allbritton posted multiple videos on Facebook Live during the attack and made various comments about the police and wondering whether he would be shot.

06/05/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Helmand on the same night. At least 11 assailants were killed and six were injured across the ensuing attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/05/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Washer district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Helmand on the same night. At least 11 assailants were killed and six were injured across the ensuing attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/05/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Sangin district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Helmand on the same night. At least 11 assailants were killed and six were injured across the ensuing attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/05/2020: Assailants attacked Sagme, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least four assailants were killed and one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

06/05/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused on a walking path along Upper Lisburn road in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/05/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Dehak, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 16 assailants were killed and five other assailants were injured in an airstrike carried out to prevent the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/05/2020: Assailants threw Molotov cocktails at an under-construction police headquarters in Greifswald, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/06/2020: Assailants attacked a civilian vehicle in Takatu, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/06/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian in Shaidan, Ghor, Afghanistan. The hostage was killed shortly thereafter. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/06/2020: Assailants attacked police outposts in Farza district, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least three officers were killed and four other officers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

Sources stated that Carrillo was a member of the Boogaloo movement and that he wrote phrases in support of the group at the scene of the attack.
06/06/2020: Assailants shot and killed a civilian in Adipora, Sopore, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a district intelligence chief, identified as Mohammad Yousaf, in Saberi district, Khost, Afghanistan. Yousaf was killed and two of his guards were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/06/2020: Assailants attacked Torkula, Guma, Benue, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks in Guma on this day. At least three civilians and five assailants were killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

06/06/2020: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Ghaziabad district, Kunar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/07/2020: An assailant attempted to plant an explosive device under the vehicle of Ahmed Maalim Fiqi in Galguduud, Somalia. Fiqi, the regional minister for security, was not harmed as the device was safely defused. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Al-Shabaab.

The outcome of the incident is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council (HNLC). Additionally, at least one person was arrested by police in connection with the incident.

06/07/2020: Assailants raided a construction site and set fire to three construction machines in Jamui, Bihar, India. Three workers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists and suspected that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the arrest of members of the group.

06/07/2020: Security forces arrested a suicide bomber attempting to target protesters in Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/07/2020: Security forces arrested an assailant planting an explosive device on a civilian vehicle in Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. The assailant was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers escorting vehicles along the N22 between Namssiguia and Djibo, Soum, Sahel, Burkina Faso. At least two soldiers were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Harry Rogers, a Ku Klux Klan (KKK) member, was convicted of carrying out the attack. Sources also noted that Rogers posted on social media before and after the incident.

06/07/2020: Three assailants opened fire and stabbed a female police officer in Ghazni, Afghanistan. The officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

06/08/2020: Assailants set fire to a cell phone tower along Ferndown Avenue in Papatoetoe, Auckland, New Zealand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar arson incidents targeting towers in Auckland overnight. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities suspected that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

06/08/2020: Assailants set fire to a cell phone tower along Miller Road in Mangere Bridge, Auckland, New Zealand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar arson incidents targeting towers in Auckland overnight. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities suspected that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

Sources also attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).

06/08/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting Baghdad International Airport in Baghdad, Iraq. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/08/2020: Assailants abducted Nubia Alejandra López Correa, an army officer, in Saravena, Arauca, Colombia. Correa was released on June 18, 2020. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

Incite the Believers claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Hurras al-Din.

At least one person was injured in the blast, while two assailants were killed in the ensuing clash with police. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

There were no reported casualties in the attack, which sources say occurred in response to earlier arrests of three of the assailants for violating a COVD-19 face mask regulation. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the police arrested the four assailants shortly after the incident.

The councilor’s son was killed and his daughter was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/08/2020: Assailants hurled bricks and Molotov cocktails at the office of the Third Channel, a privately owned TV station critical of the government with links to a Pro-West opposition leader currently in state detention, in Talas, Kyrgyzstan.
