summary: 06/18/2020: Assailants armed with firearms attacked Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) in Ilala, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least 17 people were killed and two people were kidnapped in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists. Sources also noted that the victims were displaced following an attack in Macomia town on May 28, 2020.

06/18/2020: Assailants set fire to two vehicles outside Damaskus Konditorei bakery in Neukolln district, Berlin, Germany. The assailants also vandalized the bakery and spray-painted swastikas on the building. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Neo-Nazi extremists claimed responsibility for the incident by spray-painting "SS" symbols and swastikas at the scene. Sources suspected that the attack may have been part of a larger trend of violence against immigrant communities in Germany.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked and killed an imam in Masjid Qadim, Baghlan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban. Sources noted that the victim was targeted because he announced the funeral ceremony for a police officer that had been killed by the Taliban.

06/19/2020: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Asadullah Walawalji, a journalist and security expert, detonated in Aino, Kabul, Afghanistan. Walawalji was not killed as he was not in the vehicle; however, at least two people, including his wife and daughter, were killed and six other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Bandi Barq, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 10 people, including seven pro-government militia members and three assailants, were killed while two others, including one militia member and one assailant, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked Taluqan, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least four people, including one pro-government militia member and three assailants, were killed and another militia member was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/19/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a motorcycle in Somak, Ghor, Afghanistan. A civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/19/2020: An assailant threw a grenade at the Ehsaas programme center in Liaquatabad, Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. At least one person was killed and eight others were injured in the attack. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Sindh on the same day. The Sindhudesh Revolutionary Army (SRA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Yakhchal, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of five related attacks in the district on this date. At least five people, including three assailants and two soldiers, were killed while eight others, including five assailants and three soldiers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Kamparak Manda, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of five related attacks in the district on this date. At least five people, including three assailants and two soldiers, were killed while eight others, including five assailants and three soldiers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Wazir Manda, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of five related attacks in the district on this date. At least five people, including three assailants and two soldiers, were killed while eight others, including five assailants and three soldiers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Popalzo Shakh, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of five related attacks in the district on this date. At least five people, including three assailants and two soldiers, were killed while eight others, including five assailants and three soldiers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Nahr-e Serak Maktab, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of five related attacks in the district on this date. At least five people, including three assailants and two soldiers, were killed while eight others, including five assailants and three soldiers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/20/2020: Assailants abducted 10 civilians in Biangolo, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The hostages were killed and their bodies discovered shortly after. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

06/19/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Rangers vehicle in Ghotki district, Sindh, Pakistan. Three people, including two Rangers and a civilian, were killed and two people, including one Ranger and one civilian, were injured in the blast. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Sindh on the same day. The Sindhudesh Revolutionary Army (SRA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/19/2020: Assailants threw an explosive device at a school in Larkana, Sindh, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Sindh on the same day. The Sindhudesh Revolutionary Army (SRA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/19/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Bohe Pahu, Basilan, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan National Army (ANA) checkpoints in Logar, Afghanistan. At least nine assailants were killed and three other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

06/19/2020: Assailants shot and killed a farmer in Sabala Bantayao, Lumba-Bayabao, Lanao del Sur, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/19/2020: Assailants armed with firearms intercepted a bus transporting forest workers in Huapitrio, Collipulli, Araucania, Chile. The assailants forced the driver to drive to the Malleco bridge where they set fire to the bus and two other vehicles. No casualties were reported. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the attack, demanding the release of Mapuche prisoners.

06/19/2020: Assailants intercepted a truck and set it on fire on a road between Puren and Contulma in Malleco Araucania, Chile. No casualties were reported. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the attack, demanding the release of Mapuche prisoners.

06/19/2020: Assailants set fire to the residence of a National Forest Corporation (CONAF) ranger in Contulmo, Malleco, Araucania, Chile. Police officers responded to the incident and two people were injured in the ensuing clash. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the attack, demanding the release of Mapuche prisoners.

06/19/2020: Assailants attempted to abduct a doctor leaving a Covid-19 treatment center in Ibb, Yemen. The abduction was foiled but the doctor was injured in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks targeting health care workers around this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that this incident was likely part of a series of incidents targeting health care workers during the Covid-19 pandemic.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked the head of surgery at a government hospital in Ibb, Yemen. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of two similar attacks targeting health care workers around this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that this incident was likely part of a series of incidents targeting health care workers during the Covid-19 pandemic.

06/19/2020: Assailants attacked a self-defense group in Ngototsi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least four assailants, two members of the self-defense group, and two civilians, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 06/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Khwarestan, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least three Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers were killed and three officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/20/2020: Assailants attacked Tulak district, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least five people, including one soldier and four assailants, were killed and two police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire targeting a police vehicle in Dahana, Herat, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed and another three were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/20/2020: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia outpost in Shamorghak, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least one militia member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/20/2020: Assailants raided Moduri village, Magumeri, Borno, Nigeria. At least three people were killed and 300 cows were stolen in the assault. This was one of three related attacks in Magumeri on this date. An unknown number of people were abducted across the attacks, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility: however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram.

06/20/2020: Assailants raided Moduri village, Magumeri, Borno, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and 80 cows were stolen in the assault. This was one of three related attacks in Magumeri on this date. An unknown number of people were abducted across the attacks, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility: however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram.

06/20/2020: Assailants raided Moduri village, Magumeri, Borno, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and 100 cows were stolen in the assault. This was one of three related attacks in Magumeri on this date. An unknown number of people were abducted across the attacks, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility: however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram.

06/20/2020: Assailants attacked a military unit in Fizi, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/20/2020: An explosive device detonated near the residence of a military officer in Wanlaweyne, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. This was one of two bombings in the area on this day. At least four people, including soldiers and civilians, were killed across the two blasts. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/20/2020: An explosive device detonated as people gathered following an earlier explosion near the residence of a military officer in Wanlaweyne, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. This was one of two bombings in the area on this day. At least four people, including soldiers and civilians, were killed across the two blasts. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/20/2020: An assailant armed with a knife stabbed civilians at Forbury Gardens park in Reading, England, United Kingdom. At least three civilians, including a US citizen, were killed and three civilians were injured in the attack. Authorities arrested Khairi Saadallah, a Libyan national who had been granted asylum, and Saadallah admitted to carrying out the attack.

06/20/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a civilian at a checkpoint in Malagim district, Al Bayda, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
06/20/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Douglas Gally Dilao, a Barangay chairman, in Caloocan, Metropolitan Manila, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/20/2020: An explosive device detonated in the garden of Valentyna Buchok in Ivanopillya, Donetsk, Ukraine. Buchok, an activist who had previously been abducted and released by the Donetsk People's Republic, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the victim suspected the involvement of the Donetsk People's Republic.

06/20/2020: Assailants opened fire on two village officials in Tubungan, Iloilo, Philippines. Harold Tablazon, a councilman, and Glen Bunda, an SK chair, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/20/2020: Assailants set fire to mining equipment, including two payloaders, a backhoe, and a mini dump truck, valued at P2.4 million ($49834.97 USD) at a quarry in Sinabuagan, Valencia City, Bukidnon, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/20/2020: Assailants armed with machetes and firearms attacked civilians in Bukaka, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 10 people were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

06/20/2020: Assailants abducted a rice trader in Sahebganj, Jharkhand, India. The hostage was killed and his body was discovered in a field in Chota Barmasia village on June 28, 2020. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Santhali Liberation Army (NSLA) and apprehended four assailants.
06/20/2020: Assailants ambushed soldiers in Gaadet Lahdjar, Ain Defla, Algeria. One soldier was killed in the attack. Al-Qaida in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/20/2020: An explosive device was discovered and defused near military hospital No 59 in Sievierodonetsk, Luhansk, Ukraine. No casualties were reported. This was one of two related explosive devices defused on the same date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that the assailant was a former Ukrainian soldier.

06/20/2020: An explosive device was discovered and defused near Rubizhne railway station in Rubizhne, Luhansk, Ukraine. No casualties were reported. This was one of two related explosive devices defused on the same date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that the assailant was a former Ukrainian soldier.

06/20/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan forces checkpost in Hazar Sumuch district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/20/2020: Assailants used a racial slur before shooting DeJuan Young as he was leaving the Capitol Hill Organized Protest zone (CHOP) in Seattle, Washington, United States. Young was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to White extremists.
06/20/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a Shabwah elite soldier in Azzan, Shabwah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Mahfad district, Abyan, Yemen. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/20/2020: Assailants set fire to forestry equipment at Cheipi farm along Lautario-Vilcun road in Mailenco, Cautin, Araucania, Chile. No casualties were reported. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the attack, demanding the release of Mapuche prisoners.

06/20/2020: Assailants shot and killed Narendra Singh, a former Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) leader, outside of the house of former SP district president Chandresh Singh in Chakeri, Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/20/2020: Assailants discovered and safely defused three landmines in 9th Police district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed responsibility for the attack to the Taliban.

06/20/2020: Assailants abducted and killed a village leader who refused to pay a ransom in Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a security forces vehicle on in Kot Abdul Manan, Mir Ali, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/20/2020: Assailants attacked Dih Yak district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least seven assailants were killed and seven others, including one police officer and six other assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/20/2020: Assailants attacked a military camp in Retsi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 10 assailants were killed and 12 assailants and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 06/20/2020: Assailants attacked military personnel in Kampala, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least four assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 06/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Popular Mobilization Forces patrol in al-Ayth, Saladin, Iraq. At least one PMF member was killed and three were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants set fire to a mobile mast in Rijswijk, Gelderland, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suggested the attack may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security outposts in Namak Ab district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least 10 security personnel were killed and 11 security personnel were injured in the attack. The victims included police and pro-government militia members. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked a militia base in Pshtik, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least 10 militia members were killed and two other members were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
06/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a tribal elder in Bolan, Helmand, Afghanistan. The elder was injured and his son was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Zaman-Abad, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked the district center in Nahrin district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including three police officers and eight assailants, were killed and 16 others, including 11 officers and five assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers in Al-Maghara, North Sinai, Egypt. At least six soldiers were killed and five others were injured in the ensuing clashes. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 06/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Pakistan Army convoy near Mirkhoni, South Waziristan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one assailant and two soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants shot and killed a Counter-Terrorism Department (CTD) official along Hangu Road in Kohat, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

06/21/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused at the home of a tribal elder and militia leader Malik Shatir in Mamond, Bajaur, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers in Mayadin, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least eight soldiers were killed, three others were injured, and three more were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/20/2020: Assailants attacked Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) members in Zalaya, Saladin, Iraq. At least two PMF members were killed and four PMF members were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/21/2020: Suicide bombers detonated an explosives-laden vehicle after being stopped at a checkpoint outside a military base in Bacaadweyn, Mudug, Somalia. In addition to three assailants, at least three soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked the convoy of Hafiz Abdul Qayyum, the Nuristan Governor, in Mahipar, Kabul, Afghanistan. One guard was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: A farmer discovered an explosive device at his farm near Buni Yadi, Yobe, Nigeria. The device detonated as the farmer picked it up to transport it to security forces. The farmer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.

06/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Kurdistan Democratic Party (KDP) headquarters in Sulaymaniyah, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a security post in Emana, Yaounde, Central, Cameroon. No casualties were reported. This was one of two related attacks on security posts in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a security post in Etoudi, Yaounde, Central, Cameroon. No casualties were reported. This was one of two related attacks on security posts in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Zabul, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated incidents in different Afghanistan provinces on the same day. At least 25 assailants were killed and 12 other assailants were injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Ghor, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated incidents in different Afghanistan provinces on the same day. At least 25 assailants were killed and 12 other assailants were injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Logar, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated incidents in different Afghanistan provinces on the same day. At least 25 assailants were killed and 12 other assailants were injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked outposts in Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated incidents in Helmand on the same day. At least four assailants were killed and three other assailants were injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked outposts in Sangin district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated incidents in Helmand on the same day. At least four assailants were killed and three other assailants were injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked outposts in Washer district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated incidents in Helmand on the same day. At least four assailants were killed and three other assailants were injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked military checkpoints in Taymorak, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least two assailants were killed and three other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/20/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting civilians in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

06/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Dhok Defense Committee (DDC) member in Jhompari Dal, Doda, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The DDC member was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/21/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Kotal, Kapisa, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and five others were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Jargon Construction/John Mark Builders base in Zion, Maitum, Sarangani, Philippines. It is unknown whether there were any assailant casualties in the ensuing clash with Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) soldiers at the base. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Guerilla Front 73 faction of the New People's Army (NPA).

06/21/2020: An explosive device detonated near Fazel Rahman Nazarwal, a district chief, in Ghazni, Afghanistan. Following the blast, assailants then opened fire and clashed with bodyguards. Nazarwal was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/22/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Roye, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least two pro-government militia members were killed and another member was injured while there were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/22/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Solonak, Kapisa, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and one officer was injured while there were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/22/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying employees of the Attorney General's office in Deh Sabz, Kabul, Afghanistan. Five people, including two prosecutors, including two prosecutors, two other employees, and the driver, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the incident was carried out by the Taliban, which denied involvement. Sources noted that the victims were working on the implementation of the peace agreement between the United States and the Taliban, including the release of Taliban prisoners.

06/22/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Jar-Qishlaq, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least five Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers were killed and two officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/22/2020: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) patrol in Makisabo, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least one Indonesian peacekeeper was killed and another peacekeeper was injured in the assault. The Central African Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack. Sources also attributed the incident to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

summary: 06/22/2020: An explosive device detonated in Parachinar, Kurram, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. A police constable and a civilian were injure in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/22/2020: Eight explosives-laden drones were identified and destroyed by the Saudi air defenses over Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. This was one of four similar attacks overnight. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/22/2020: A roadside bomb detonated targeting Mayor Reynalbert Insular in South Upi, Maguindanao, Philippines. Insular, the mayor of South Upi, was not harmed and there were no other casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/22/2020: Assailants fired a rocket towards the Baghdad International Airport in Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/22/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Nestor Espenilla, the acting division chief of the National Irrigation Administration, in Rosary Heights, Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/22/2020: An assailant set fire to a phone mast along Sunderland Road in Gateshead, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suggested that the incident may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

06/22/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) camp in Batagund, Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/22/2020: Assailants attacked government positions in Qaniya, Al Bayda, Yemen. At least 30 people, including six government workers and 24 assailants, were killed and dozens others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

06/22/2020: Assailants opened fire on police officers at Deh Mazang square in Deh Mazang, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and two officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/22/2020: Assailants attacked border guard forces near Kon Ban Kaung, Yathedaung, Rakhine, Myanmar. At least three border guards and a civilian were killed and four other border guards and another civilian were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

06/23/2020: An explosive devices detonated near a telephone tower in La Puntilla, Quidico, Bio-Bio, Chile. Assailants then opened fire when security forces responded to the scene. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Mapuche Lavkenche Resistance (RML) claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the attack was a part of a commitment to drive capitalistic companies out of the territory.

06/22/2020: Assailants raided a village and abducted 17 people in Mainankoua, Extreme-North, Cameroon. One hostage was released later the same day, and the fate of the remaining 16 hostages is unknown. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram.

06/22/2020: Assailants raided a village and abducted six farmers in Sandaouadjiri, Extreme-North, Cameroon. Four hostages were released later the same day, and the fate of the remaining two hostages is unknown. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

06/22/2020: Assailants attacked Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed and six other officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the incident and said Sharif was "detained on charges of funding projects that sow division."

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked Djimindo village in Mopti, Mali. At least 15 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. This was one of four related attacks in Mopti on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected the involvement of Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked Pansadougou village in Mopti, Mali. At least two people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. This was one of four related attacks in Mopti on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected the involvement of Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked Diallaye village in Mopti, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four related attacks in Mopti on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected the involvement of Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).

07/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on Sharif Mukhtar at his home in Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. Mukhtar, a disability rights advocate, was killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and accused the victim of being connected to the National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA).

07/01/2020: Assailants armed with an axe and a bow and arrows attacked assistant constable Somaru Poyam inside his residence in Matwada, Chhattisgarh, India. Poyam was killed and his two parents were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on a soldier in Compound, Luz, Negros Oriental, Philippines. The soldier, identified as Mark Anthony Quiocson, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/00/2020: Sometime between June 28, 2020 and July 4, 2020, assailants attacked the brother-in-law of a police officer in Hiroli, Chhattisgarh, India. The brother-in-law was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked a military logistics convoy in Shah Wali Kot district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 18 assailants were killed and 12 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/01/2020: A sniper shot and injured child in Jarz, Ad Dali, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on Siyabuela Siswana at his house in Mfuleni, Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa. Siswana, a South African Communist Party (SACP) district secretary, and his daughter were killed while his wife was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) position in Makulu, Mbau, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two soldiers were killed and two were injured in the raid. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

07/01/2020: Assailants set fire to a mobile antenna in Limassol, Cyprus. There were no casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar attacks in Limassol on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suggested that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

07/01/2020: Assailants set fire to a mobile antenna in Limassol, Cyprus. There were no casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar attacks in Limassol on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suggested that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

07/01/2020: Assailants set fire to a mobile antenna in Limassol, Cyprus. There were no casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar attacks in Limassol on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suggested that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan forces security outposts in Sarband, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of three related incidents in Helmand on the same day. At least 13 assailants were killed across the two clashes in Grishk. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan forces security outposts in Yakhchal, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of three related incidents in Helmand on the same day. At least 13 assailants were killed across the two clashes in Grishk. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan forces security outposts in Nahr-e Bughra, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least five assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. This was one of three related incidents in Helmand on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/01/2020: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of an intelligence officer detonated in Zubair, Kut al-Ula, Basra, Iraq. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Pakh Sangani, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 12 people, including two soldiers and 10 assailants, were killed and two other soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of the Surkh Rod district chief executive detonated in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. The district chief and his son were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2020: Assailants attempted to attack security checkpoints in Mohammad Quli, Wardak, Afghanistan. At least eight assailants were killed and 12 others were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Bedka, Wardak, Afghanistan. This was one of three similar incidents in this district on the same day. At least 11 assailants were killed and nine other people, including seven assailants and two soldiers, were injured across all three clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations aid helicopter in Damasak, Borno, Nigeria. At least two civilians were killed and several other civilians were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked a police patrol along a highway in Tarnak Wa Jaldak district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least six officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Shash Gaw, Wardak, Afghanistan. This was one of three similar incidents in this district on the same day. At least 11 assailants were killed and nine other people, including seven assailants and two soldiers, were injured across all three clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Lwara, Wardak, Afghanistan. This was one of three similar incidents in this district on the same day. At least 11 assailants were killed and nine other people, including seven assailants and two soldiers, were injured across all three clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: An explosive device detonated at Rond Point Damas in Yaounde, Central, Cameroon. At least 20 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers patrolling in Gouari, Mopti, Mali. At least seven soldiers were killed and two other soldiers were injured in the incident. Additionally, three soldiers were reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

07/02/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a joint police-military quarantine control checkpoint in Labu-Labu, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. One Civilian Armed Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

07/02/2020: Assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) at a passenger bus in Iganagampong, Date Unsay, Maguindanao, Philippines. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

07/02/2020: A suicide attacker drove their vehicle through the gates of the residence of Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada, at Rideau Hall in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Once through the gates, the assailant got out of the vehicle armed with a firearm and was taken into custody by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) after negotiations. Corey Hurren, an active member of the Canadian armed forces, was arrested for the attack. Sources said he posted QAnon and other far-right conspiracy theories online. He stated that he was planning to die in the attack and he wanted his death to be a message of discontent with the COVID response. He also stated that conspiracy theories drove his desire to carry out the attack.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked regime positions near Suknah, Homs, Syria. At least 51 people, including 20 pro government fighters and 31 assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash and subsequent airstrike. Several other people were reported missing after the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/02/2020: An explosive device detonated near a medical clinic in Kamar Sar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one watchperson was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/02/2020: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle in Halim Chun, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least six people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: Assailants kidnapped 3-6 people, including two police officers, two soldiers, a public official, and a civilian in Mera, Pastaza, Ecuador. The hostages were released on July 4, 2020. Shuar extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they abducted the officials in order to demand the release of the body of their community leader, Alberto Mashutak, who was buried by the government after he died from COVID-19. Sources stated that the group viewed Mashutak's burial as "a violation of collective and cultural rights."
07/02/2020: A landmine detonated in Rathedaung, Rakhine, Myanmar. A civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Zabul, Afghanistan. Three assailants were killed and six others, including one police officer and five assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Ozlik, Faryab, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed and three others were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely as an assailant was planting it in Gurziwan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. The assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed resposnibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan security and defense forces convoy in Sholgara district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed and four other assailants were injured while it is unknown whether there were any casualties among the security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2020: Assailants abducted Ricardo Alvarado from his residence in Arauca, Colombia. Alvardo, the brother of a former governor, was released on February 10, 2021. No group claimed responsibility; however sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 07/02/2020: An explosive device detonated at the nuclear enrichment facility in Natanz, Esfahan, Iran. There were no reported casualties in the incident. The Homeland Cheetahs claimed responsibility for the attack. Officials identified the assailant as Ershad Karimi.

07/03/2020: Assailants attacked the district headquarters in Mirzakah, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Kotal-e-Hafiz, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least two officers were killed and five other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/03/2020: An explosive device detonated near a school in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. A police officer was killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

07/02/2020: An explosive device detonated in Baiji, Saladin, Iraq. At least two Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) intelligence officers were killed and an unknown number of other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/03/2020: Assailants blew up a fireworks factory in Hendek, Sakarya, Turkey. At least seven people were killed and 97 people were injured in the blast an resulting fire. The Children of Fire Initiative claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities questioned the veracity of this claim.
gname: The Children of the Fire Initiative

summary: 07/03/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle was intercepted at a checkpoint while being transported in Datu Saudi-Ampatuan district, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

07/04/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely while being planted in Ghonzi, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Taliban.

07/04/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely while being planted in Loy Qala, Paktika, Afghanistan. At least two assailants were killed and another assailant was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Taliban.
07/03/2020: Assailants attacked and killed a cousin of Afghan President Ashraf Ghani, Rishad Ahmadzai, in police district 6, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/00/2020: Sometime between July 1, 2020 and July 5, 2020, assailants opened fire on a community judge in Gora, North Sinai, Egypt. The judge and two other people were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 07/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting members of the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) in Deir ez-Zor, Syria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2020: Assailants attacked a road construction site in Hinalaan, Kalamansig, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash with security forces guarding the site. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Far South Mindanao Regional Command (FSMRC) of the New People's Army (NPA) and stated that the group had demanded "protection money" from the company.

07/03/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a military vehicle in Igbucagay, Hamtic, Antique, Philippines. One solider was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/03/2020: Assailants attacked Nduma Defense of Congo (NDC) positions in Mashango, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of five coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least one civilian was killed and one was injured in the ensuing clashes that lasted for several days. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS) and the Nyatura Militia.
gname: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS)

summary: 07/03/2020: Assailants attacked Nduma Defense of Congo (NDC) positions in Buboa, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of five coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least one civilian was killed and one was injured in the ensuing clashes that lasted for several days. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS) and the Nyatura Militia.
gname: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS)

summary: 07/03/2020: Assailants attacked Nduma Defense of Congo (NDC) positions in Butsindo, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of five coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least one civilian was killed and one was injured in the ensuing clashes that lasted for several days. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS) and the Nyatura Militia.
gname: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS)

summary: 07/03/2020: Assailants attacked Nduma Defense of Congo (NDC) positions in Bwendero, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of five coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least one civilian was killed and one was injured in the ensuing clashes that lasted for several days. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS) and the Nyatura Militia.
gname: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS)

summary: 07/03/2020: Assailants attacked Nduma Defense of Congo (NDC) positions in Butswira, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of five coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least one civilian was killed and one was injured in the ensuing clashes that lasted for several days. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS) and the Nyatura Militia.
gname: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS)

summary: 07/03/2020: Assailants threw a grenade into the office of Opposition Platform - For Life party at 88 Pushkina Street, Poltava, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Ukrainian nationalists.

07/03/2020: Assailants set fire to a mobile antenna in Limassol, Cyprus. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suggested that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

07/03/2020: An assailant intentionally rammed his truck into a motorcycle driver in Taycheedah, Wisconsin, United States. The motorcycle driver, identified as Phillip Thiessen, was killed in the assault. Police arrested Daniel Navarro in connection with the attack. Navarro stated that he targeted a motorcycle because he wanted to kill the person and targeted a Harley-Davidson because of their racist culture. He also stated that he carried out the attack because of the world being created by President Donald Trump and white people. Furthermore, he asserted that he had thoughts of causing a vehicle accident earlier in the day before he eventually carried out the attack.

07/03/2020: Assailants attacked Kusisa Health Centre in Ziralo, Kalehe, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two civilians were injured while a guard was tied up and a ventilator was stolen in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/04/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Ahmad Abad, Herat, Afghanistan. At least three officers were killed and three officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/04/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a member of the National Directorate of Security (NDS) in Mahmud Raqi, Kapisa, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on police officers in 2nd police district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least two people, including one officer and the assailant, were killed and another officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on Mamikhan Umarov outside an auto-repair shop at a shopping center in Gerasdorf, Vienna, Austria. Umarov, a Chechen asylum seeker, separatist, and critic of Chechen Prime Minister Ramzan Kadyrov, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, two other Chechen asylum-seekers, identified as Sarali Akhtaev and Salman Magamadov, were arrested in connection with the attack.

07/04/2020: A suicide bomber detonated at a police post in front of the revenue authority headquarters in Jajab, Mogadishu, Somalia. The assailant was killed and seven people, including police officers and civilians, were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2020: An explosive device intended to target a tax collection center detonated at a restaurant in Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. At least five people were killed and 10 were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2020: Assailants attacked the convoy of Kiza Mateso, the Djugu Assistant Territory Manager, in Matete, Djugu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 11 people, including four soldiers and three police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 07/04/2020: Assailants ambushed security forces and Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) members escorting civilians between Domboa and Maiduguri. on Domboa Highway, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. Nine soldiers, including the Operation Commandant of Youth Volunteer (CJTF), and 13 assailants were killed and many more were wounded. Three members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) were missing following the attack and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/04/2020: Assailant attacked the residence of Shaaban al-Ergani in Abu Tawilah, North Sinai, Egypt. At least one security detail member was killed and al-Ergani, the brother of union head Ibrahim al-Ergani, and two other people were injured in the incident. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 07/04/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) checkpoint in Diban, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. There were an unknown number of injuries in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Bati, Amhara, Ethiopia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oromo Liberation Front.

07/04/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a hotel in Bati, Amhara, Ethiopia. At least five people were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oromo Liberation Front.

07/04/2020: Assailants attempted to recruit members of the muhamasheen minority community to fight and opened fire on them when they refused in Jurfayn, Amran, Yemen. Four people, including three civilians and one assailant, were killed and another civilian was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) and Abu Ali al-Khawlani, a Houthi commander.

07/04/2020: Assailants attacked a paramilitary police camp in Fafi area, Garissa, Kenya. There were no casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

07/04/2020: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in Khair Khana area, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two people, including a police officer and a civilian, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Nadir Khan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least five assailants were killed and eight assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/04/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Dih Yak district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed and three assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/04/2020: An roadside explosive device detonated targeting a police van in Zardgulan, Daykundi, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and three were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/04/2020: Assailants attacked Simbolongo, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least three people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2020: Assailants assaulted Vauhxx Booker at Lake Monroe in Bloomington, Indiana, United States. Booker, an African-American activist, was on his way to a Lunar Eclipse viewing party at the lake when he had a confrontation with the assailants, who were claiming that the victims were trespassing on private property. During the confrontation, several men grabbed Booker and pinned him against a tree and began assaulting him and threatening to break his arm. One assailant even asked another person to grab a noose. Booker was eventually freed from the assailants by his companions. In the video the assailants can be seen attacking the victim and can be heard screaming several racial slurs and denigrating the victims. Sean Purdy and Jerry Cox were arrested and charged in connection with the attack.

07/05/2020: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire targeting a security convoy travelling to Shinkay district, Zabul, Afghanistan. Seven police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/05/2020: An explosive device detonated as security forces attempted to defuse it in Surkh Rod district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/05/2020: An assailant opened fire on Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers in Baghlani Jadid district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least two officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on a convoy of buses along Bandiagara-Docoumbo road (RN15) in Pignari Bana, Mopti, Mali. At least four passengers were killed, three were injured, and four more were kidnapped in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2020: Assailants abducted Mohamed Mohamud Siyad from his vehicle along a road near Galoley, between Balcad and Jowhar, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. Siyad, a member of the Hirshabelle regional parliament, was killed a short time later. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and accused the victim of antagonizing the group's "genuine quest for a united Somalia" where there are "equal rights" for all.

07/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) convoy in Gangoo, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One police officer was injured in the blast, and an additional explosive device was defused at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
07/06/2020: Assailants attacked a Somali National Army (SNA) convoy in Qalimow, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. Three soldiers were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2020: Assailants attacked Gentil Pasos Lizcano, a community leader, in El Puente, Algeciras, Huila, Colombia. Lizcano and one other person were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2020: Assailants fired one rocket targeting Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties as the rocket was intercepted by the Iron Dome. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

07/05/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused a remote-controlled explosive device planted on the roadside in Shewaki, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2020: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. One person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).
07/05/2020: A landmine detonated in Ain Zara, Tripoli, Libya. Two civilians were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/05/2020: Assailants fired a missile targeting the US embassy in the Green Zone, Baghdad, Iraq. The missile landed near a civilian house and a civilian was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an Iran-backed militia.

07/05/2020: Assailants launched a missile targeting Taji camp in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. Security forces repelled the attack and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an Iran-backed militia.

07/05/2020: Assailants launched a rocket targeting the Baghdad International Airport in Baghdad, Iraq. Security forces repelled the attack and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an Iran-backed militia.

07/05/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Manghopir, Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/05/2020: An assailant set fire to Harmony Baptist Church in Leeton, Missouri, United States. No casualties were reported in the blaze. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Gereshk, Helmand, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/05/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Shinkay, Zabul, Afghanistan. Six assailants were killed and four others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/05/2020: Assailants shot and killed a BJP leader and Chatra Parliament candidate, Jaivardhan Singh, in Barwadih, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jharkhand Janmukti Parishad (JJP).
07/05/2020: Assailants threw three Molotov cocktails at a school in Patras, Western Greece, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Kadarko, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least two civilians were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

07/05/2020: Four assailants attempted to set fire to the Walltopia building at 111 Tsarigradsko Shose Boulevard, Sofia, Bulgaria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Anti-LGBT extremists in retaliation to an LGBTQ flag hanging from the targeted building.

07/06/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Bala-Hisar, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/06/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a soldier near an outpost in Shindand district, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/06/2020: Assailants shot and killed Hisham al-Hashimi, a security expert, in Ziyouna district, Baghdad, Iraq. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the group issued more statements denying responsibility. Sources also attributed the attack to Kata'ib Hezbollah.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/06/2020: Two explosive devices detonated in Shahr-e Safa, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least six police officers were killed and two other officers were injured in the blasts. This was one of two attacks targeting police officers in Shahr-e Safa on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/06/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Shahr-e Safa district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least four officers were killed in the incident. This was one of two attacks targeting police officers in Shahr-e Safa on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on Nafisa Hejran, a Provincial Council member, at Milli Bairagh Square in Puli Alam, Logar, Afghanistan. Hejran and her driver were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/06/2020: Suicide bombers wearing explosives-laden vests entered a union tribe office and opened fire on tribe members in Ergani, Abu Tawilah, North Sinai, Egypt. At least three government-aligned tribal fighters and one assailant were killed and two other fighters were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Abu Tawilah on the same day. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they were targeting "apostate sahawat," in reference to the Union of Sinai Tribes who work with the government to combat the group.

summary: 07/06/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a police post in Delina, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties or damages in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Zabre, the Pensa mayor and a traditional chief, was killed in the attack, and three other people were reported missing. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

07/06/2020: Assailants launched mortars targeting African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) soldiers in Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least 0-4 soldiers were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility and stated that they would continue to target African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops if they couldn't "leave our country [Somalia] in peace."

summary: 07/06/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a security forces vehicle in Abu Khashab, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least one security forces member was killed in the attack. gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/06/2020: An explosive device detonated near a District Reserve Guards (DRG) returning from an operation in Kalepal, Chhattisgarh, India. The hostages were released after villagers marched on the assailant's encampment on July 7, 2020. 07/06/2020: Assailants abducted Eid Gomaa al-Ergani from his farm in Abu Tawilah, North Sinai, Egypt. The hostage was killed and his severed head was discovered a short time later. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Abu Tawilah on the same day. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they were targeting "apostate sahawat," in reference to the Union of Sinai Tribes who work with the government to combat the group.

summary: 07/06/2020: Assailants abducted Imad Salem Abdulhaq, a Shabwah Elite Forces member, and two companions from the Ataq Hospital in Ataq, Shabwah, Yemen. 07/06/2020: Assailant abducted Jomar Ignacio Engayas, a Manobo tribe member, while he was harvesting coconuts in Libas Sud, San Miguel, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. 07/06/2020: Assailants established a checkpoint and extorted civilians along Baghlan-Balkh highway in Chashma-e-Shir, Baghlan, Afghanistan. 07/07/2020: An assailant threw an incendiary device at a gate in Migdal Oz, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
