summary: 07/10/2020: Assailants raided Malyajame, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One person was killed and three people were reported missing in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

07/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the military vehicle of Colonel Engineer Ali Al-Shalif in Marib, Yemen. One person was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants kidnapped a police officer who was travelling on public transport in Chin Zai, Takhar, Afghanistan. The officer was later killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/11/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a pro-government militia member in Qala-i-Naw, Badghis, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/11/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a religious scholar in Barakhanah, Ghor, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: An explosive device detonated near Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) soldiers in Khalawi, Diyala, Iraq. At least three soldiers were killed and two other soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants stopped a military supply convoy and forced the drivers out of their vehicles along Diwaniya-Samawah Highway in Najma, Al Qadisiyah, Iraq. No casualties were reported, but the supply vehicles were set on fire in the attack. The Saraya Thorat Aleshreen claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Abembi, Irumu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

07/11/2020: Assailants attacked security forces near the AH76 highway in Dahana-i-Ghuri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least four soldiers were killed and 10 soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/11/2020: An explosive device detonated in Qalat, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least three children were killed and two others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: An explosive device detonated near Abdul Haq Square in 16th police district, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Istalif, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/11/2020: Assailants attacked Kigudu village in Kidugu, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least 12 people were killed and four residences were set on fire in the attack. Additionally, civilians were reported missing and their whereabouts are unknown. This was one of two related attacks in the village within 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

07/11/2020: Assailants attacked a funeral being held for victims of an earlier attack in Kigudu, Kaduna, Nigeria. No casualties were reported. This was one of two attacks in the village within 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists
07/11/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a market in Bab, Aleppo, Syria. Four people were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Abo Kala, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Eight assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police vehicle near Shareen Aab Road in Mastung, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants abducted eight civilians, including the son of a district chief, in Paktia, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban. Sources also noted that the victims were targeted to put pressure on the local people to sever ties with the government.

07/11/2020: Assailants fired a mortar targeting civilians in Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/11/2020: Assailants raided Mangazi, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

07/11/2020: Assailants attacked an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) position in Linga, Djugu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Six assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Djugu on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 07/11/2020: Assailants attempted to attack Libi, Djugu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Security forces intercepted and arrested two assailants, and there were no reported casualties. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Djugu on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 07/11/2020: Assailants stopped civilian vehicles and prevented them from passing in Saqam, Hays, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting National Directorate of Security (NDS) personnel in 2nd police district, Gardez, Paktia, Afghanistan. One NDS member was killed an three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on Marwan al-Barah, a 35th Armored Brigade commander, as he was entering a market in Turbah, Taizz, Yemen. Al-Barah was not harmed but at least one soldier was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Fourth Brigade, which is affiliated with the Al Islah Party.

07/11/2020: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attacked Jabal Baiyhan camp in Bayhan, Shabwah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Fourth Brigade, which is affiliated with the Al Islah Party.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Tamazan, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least 16 people, including four police officers and 12 assailants, were killed and one other police officer was injured in the attack. A police officer was taken hostage and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Darah-ye Qiyaq, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least six civilians were killed and eight civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/12/2020: Assailants threw two grenades at police forces in Chersu, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties as the grenades failed to detonate. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, two assailants were arrested in connection with the attack.

07/12/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Popular Mobilization Forces near Tawakul, Diyala, Iraq. Two PMF members were killed and two were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/12/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the president of the Supreme Council of Communications on the N19 between Diapaga and Kantchar, Tapoa, Est, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that the incident led to the postponement of parliamentary elections for one year.

07/12/2020: An assailant drove a minivan into the front of a church and threw and incendiary device, began dousing gasoline, and set it on fire in Ocala, Florida, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Police arrested Steven Shields who later confessed, claiming he had issues with the Catholic Church.

07/12/2020: An assailant set fire to the Umana Yana, a cultural landmark, in Kingston, Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, Guyana. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked civilians and Red Cross members searching for bodies after an attack the previous day in Abembi, Irumu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least six people, including three Red Cross members, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
07/12/2020: Assailants attacked a police vehicle in Abongan, Taytay, Palawan, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants abducted Fatima Faizi, a female police officer, in Qarabagh district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Faizi was killed and her body was discovered on July 25, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which the group denied. Sources noted that the assailants had demanded that the victim leave her job as a government employee.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked Ungwan Audu village in Ungwan Audu, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and several residences were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked military checkpoints in Dawlatabad district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 14 assailants were killed and 11 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/12/2020: Assailants shot and killed Randy Rociana, a farmer, in Asaran, Buenavista, Negros Occidental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/12/2020: Assailants opened fire on Maulana Irshadullah at his office in Chitkan, Panjgur, Balochistan, Pakistan. Irshadullah, the local head of Maddrassa Ahsan-ul-Madaaris, was killed and another person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked the Jharkhand Forest Department headquarters and detonated explosive devices in Barkelat, Jharkhand, India. An unknown number of staff members were held hostage and injured in the attack. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the attack and demanded that the forest range office be removed from the area and that the "government grant forest dwellers' rights to them."

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked a Nduma Defense of Congo (NDC) position in Mbuyi, west of Mweso, Bashali Mokoto region, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. A Red Cross worker was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

07/12/2020: A landmine detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Qoz, Taizz, Yemen. One person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Mungor, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed and two assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks in Ghazni on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Khedokhel, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks in Ghazni on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked security personnel in Sukhnah, Homs, Syria. At least 10 security personnel were killed and a few dozen other were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/12/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a senior police officer in Shakardara district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Dobandi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. At least nine people, incluidng six security personnel and three assailants, were killed and five other security personnel were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Dobandi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. At least nine people, incluidng six security personnel and three assailants, were killed and five other security personnel were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Kharah-e Asyab, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least 15 people, including 13 assailants and two soldiers, were killed while 17 others, including 16 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, three soldiers were taken hostage. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/13/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting the provincial office of the National Directorate of Security (NDS) in Aybak, Samangan, Afghanistan. Additional assailants attacked the complex following the blast. At least 16 people, including four assailants and 12 NDS personnel, were killed and 63 other people, including NDS personnel and civilians, were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Namak Ab, Shinwari, Parwan, Afghanistan. This was one of three related incident in Shinwari on the same day.At least seven people, including four soldiers and three assailants, were killed and one other soldier injured while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties across all three attacks. Three soldiers were also reported missing after the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Daraz Grd, Shinwari, Parwan, Afghanistan. This was one of three related incident in Shinwari on the same day. At least seven people, including four soldiers and three assailants, were killed and one other soldier injured while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties across all three attacks. Three soldiers were also reported missing after the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/12/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Ishturshahr, Shinwari, Parwan, Afghanistan. This was one of three related incident in Shinwari on the same day. At least seven people, including four soldiers and three assailants, were killed and one other soldier injured while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties across all three attacks. Three soldiers were also reported missing after the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on police forces as they were en route to a security outpost in Ahangaran, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and three officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Band-e-Separ, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least seven security personnel were killed and two others were injured in the attack. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.
07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed two tribal elders in Dehe Khodaydad, Ghazni, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Konchak, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least two Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers, including a commander, were killed in the attack. This was one of three similar attacks on security posts on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Makhmalkocha, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks on security posts in the district on this date. At least 14 people were killed and two others were injured across both attacks. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Pada Khwab, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks on security posts in the district on this date. At least 14 people were killed and two others were injured across both attacks. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Four assailants entered a mosque and opened fire on worshipers in Bibi Ainah, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least four people, including tribal leader Abdul Satar, were killed and five other people, including two assailants, were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/13/2020: A soldier opened fire on his colleagues as they were patrolling in Dehdadi district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least four soldiers were killed and one was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Jose Antonio Rivera, a demobilized Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) member, in los Lagos, Pitalito, Huila, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Ukrainian soldier in Zaitseve, Donetsk, Ukraine. The soldier was killed in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Donetsk People's Republic.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on medical personnel attempting to retrieve the body of a Ukrainian soldier who had been killed in Zaitseve, Donetsk, Ukraine. One medic, an Estonian national, was killed and two other personnel were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Donetsk People's Republic.

07/13/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle near the convoy of army chief General Yusuf Rage in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. General Rage was unhurt and one civilian was killed in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was a "martyrdom operation" targeting a military convoy escorting "senior apostate commanders."

07/13/2020: Assailants abducted 60-63 civilians in Mmouck Leteh, South-West, Cameroon. All hostages were released as of July 15, 2020. Separatist commander, General Ayeke, claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Fata Burnu, North Darfur, Sudan. At least nine people were killed and 17 other people were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Janjaweed.

07/13/2020: An explosive device detonated while security forces attempted to defuse it in Abbarah, Diyala, Iraq. Three people, including a police officer and two explosives experts, were killed and one government employee was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint near Balad, Saladin, Iraq. One police officer was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on military positions in Talya, Beqaa, Lebanon. This was one of four coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. One soldier was killed across the four attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on military positions in Britel, Beqaa, Lebanon. This was one of four coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. One soldier was killed across the four attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on military positions in Khudr, Beqaa, Lebanon. This was one of four coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. One soldier was killed across the four attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on military positions in Duris, Baalbek, Beqaa, Lebanon. This was one of four coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. One soldier was killed across the four attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military convoy along Maiduguri-Damaturu road, Auno, Borno, Nigeria. Two soldiers were killed and two were abducted in the attack. Both hostages were rescued the following day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi (Islamic State West Africa Province – ISWAP) faction of Boko Haram.

07/13/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely while being planted along a road near the Somali border in Geneva, Mandera, Kenya. One assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Al-Shabaab.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Gomari, Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of civilian casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/13/2020: Assailants abducted five Shabwah Elite Forces members in Ataq, Shabwah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah Party.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military convoy near Kumala, Borno, Nigeria. Eight soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi (Islamic State West Africa Province - ISWAP) faction of Boko Haram.

07/13/2020: An explosive device detonated in Barkela, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI - Maoist).

07/13/2020: A magnetic explosive device detonated near the Republic Hospital and the police headquarters in the second police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Colonel Mohammad Osman, the anti-terrorism police head, in Mihtarlam, Laghman, Afghanistan. Osman was not harmed, though one government official was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2020: Assailants shot and killed Fredy Fajardo, a former FARC member, in El Progreso, Uribe, Meta, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 07/13/2020: Assailants attacked Katanga village in Irumu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire a United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA) vehicle in Murta, South Kordofan, Sudan. At least one UNISFA member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2020: Assailants attacked pro-government militia forces in Zabikhel, Kapisa, Afghanistan. At least three militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/14/2020: Assailants attacked Qirghiz, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including two police officers and five assailants, were killed and 11 other people, including six assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/14/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Du Layna district, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least eight people, including two Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers and six assailants, were killed and 12 others, including five police officers and seven assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/14/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a joint Russian-Turkish patrol on the Aleppo-Latakia M4 highway in Ariha, Idlib, Syria. Three Russian soldiers and an unknown number of Turkish soldiers were injured in the attack. An unknown group,Kata'ib Khattab al-Shishani, claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources doubted the veracity of the claim.

07/14/2020: An explosive device detonated against a vehicle in Anargay, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least five people were killed and 11 others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/14/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Afghan soldiers in Sangin district, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed and five others were wounded in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers near Gichak in Panjgur district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least three soldiers were killed and eight others were injured in the attack. The Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2020: Assailants attacked a military barracks in Maiduguri, Nigeria. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/14/2020: Assailants abducted Dirdo Bheema from his residence near Mutheli, Chhattisgarh, India. Bheema, a former Maoist and suspected police informant, was killed in the forest a short time later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/14/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Rangers patrol providing security for a school in Lapho, Mae Lan, Pattani, Thailand. One Ranger, identified as Mujarintee Srikaew, was killed and another was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

07/14/2020: Assailants set fire to the Linden Guyana Elections Commission (GECOM) office in Wismar, Linden, Upper Demerara-Berbice, Guyana. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2020: Assailants set fire to a Criminal Investigation Department office and stuck a blade into the building near where the fire was started in Anna Regina, Pomeroon-Supenaam, Guyana. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2020: Assailants in Kunar, Afghanistan fired a mortar that struck a civilian residence in Kaga, Mamond, Bajaur, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/14/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of Salisu Usman, a Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) officer, in Gudi, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least one person, Usman's sister, was killed in the attack while Usman himself and his wife were taken hostage. Usman was killed shortly after the abduction while his wife was released on July 17, 2020 following a ransom payment. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

07/14/2020: Assailants abducted Radwan Al-Hashidi, a journalist, from Seiyun International Airport in Seiyun, Hadramawt, Yemen. The hostage was released on July 28, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah Party. Sources also noted that the victim was targeted because of his anti-ISIL views.

07/14/2020: Assailants launched projectiles and opened fire targeting residential areas of Hays, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. One civilian was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/14/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle in southern Kandahar, Afghanistan. Four people, including an intelligence officer and three civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2020: Assailants raided Kautikari, Borno, Nigeria. No casualties were reported, but several houses were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
07/14/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Ahmad Farid Sakha, a national intelligence agency officer, in Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2020: Assailants opened fire on the Montesoro gendarmerie office in Bastia, Corsica, France. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Corsican National Liberation Front (FLNC) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded that the French government "implement a real process of recognition of the Corsican people and decolonization."

07/15/2020: Assailants opened fire on a religious scholar in Incho, Parwan, Afghanistan. The scholar and his brother were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/15/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Sra Baghal, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed and four officers were injured in the ensuing clash. After the attack, 15 assailants were killed and 10 assailants were injured in airstrikes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/13/2020: Assailants attacked peacekeepers in Gedze, Nana-Mambere, Central African Republic. At least one Rwandan peacekeeper was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Return, Reclamation, Rehabilitation (3R).

07/15/2020: Assailants abducted Mehrajuddin Malla in Marazigund, Rafiabad, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Malla, a Municipal Committee Watergam vice president and local Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader, was rescued 12 hours later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

07/15/2020: Assailants opened fire on security forces traveling to a crime scene in Pan Kyan, Kyaukme, Shan, Myanmar. An unknown number of security forces were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Shan State Army - South (SSA-S).

07/15/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police ranger patrol on Panare-Sai Buri Road in Ban Maruad, Panare, Pattani, Thailand. At least 10 people, including six rangers and four civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Barisan Revolusi National (BRN).

07/15/2020: Assailants carrying incendiary devices and an explosive device were identified and arrested before they could carry out an attack near Nablus, West Bank. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists..

07/15/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device planted alongside a road in Fazel Beg area of 5th Police District, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/15/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Arghandab district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least 5 assailants were killed and two other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/15/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Arghandeh, Kabul, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/15/2020: Assailants attacked security forces post inEbrahimkhel, Paktia, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Paktia on the same night. At least 10 people, including one soldier and nine assailants, were killed and 16 others, including five soldiers and 11 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/15/2020: Assailants attacked security forces post in Zaw, Paktia, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Paktia on the same night. At least 10 people, including one soldier and nine assailants, were killed and 16 others, including five soldiers and 11 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/15/2020: Assailants attacked security forces posts in Mirali, Herat, Afghanistan. At least 10 assailants were killed and 15 were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/15/2020: An explosive device detonated tarteting a police vehicle in Anar Dara district, Farah, Afghanistan. One special police soldier was killed and seven others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/15/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) post in Kohsar, Nimroz, Afghanistan. Six solders were killed and two were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

summary: 07/00/2020: Sometime between July 1, 2020 and July 31, 2020, assailants opened fire and killed two civilians, identified as Deopanis Pacunla and Eldeson Martonillas, in Luz, Guihulngan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Chaproudha, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least three people, including one police officer and two assailants, were killed and nine others, including three officers and six assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/16/2020: A sniper opened fire and killed a soldier at a security outpost in Naw Abad, Kunduz, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Dawlatabad district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least five security personnel were killed and two other security personnel were injured in the attack. 07/16/2020: Assailants fired rockets 200 meters from a where President Ashraf Ghani was giving a speech in Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

This was one of at least five attacks in this area on this date.  No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ngumino militia, Twigwaneho militia, National Liberation Front (FNL) (Burundi), and the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked Kipupu, Mwenga, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 18 people were killed and an unknown number of people were abducted in this attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. This was one of at least five attacks in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ngumino militia, Twigwaneho militia, National Liberation Front (FNL) (Burundi), and the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked Natulonge, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were an unknown number of casualties and missing people in the attack.This was one of at least five attacks in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ngumino militia, Twigwaneho militia, National Liberation Front (FNL) (Burundi), and the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked Kalinga, Mwenga, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were an unknown number of casualties and missing people in the attack.This was one of at least five attacks in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ngumino militia, Twigwaneho militia, National Liberation Front (FNL) (Burundi), and the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked Kitete, Mutambala, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were an unknown number of casualties and missing people in the attack.This was one of at least five attacks in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ngumino militia, Twigwaneho militia, National Liberation Front (FNL) (Burundi), and the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Algeciras district, Huila, Colombia. At least four people were killed and two others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources indicated that the victims were targeted for their former involvement with the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC).

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked a COVID-19 aid convoy in Bolbar, Kordestan, Iran. At least two relief workers were killed and another worker was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/16/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device near Novotoshkivske, Luhansk, Ukraine. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Luhansk People's Republic.

07/16/2020: Assailants launched shells that struck houses in northern Lahij, Yemen. At least three people were killed and several houses were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/16/2020: Assailants opened fire on Vicente Limpiado Jr. at his farm in Sogod, Tagapul-an, Samar, Philippines. Limpiado, the Tagapul-an mayor, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on aid workers from an international non-governmental organization in Pajut, Jonglei, South Sudan. Six people, including aid workers and civilians, were killed in the attack.. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/16/2020: Assailants threw petrol bombs across the peace wall targeting civilian residences in Fountain estate, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported injuries but the petrol bomb damaged a house. This was one of two related attacks to occur in the Fountain estate on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/16/2020: Assailants threw petrol bombs at police vehicles responding to an earlier attack in Fountain estate, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported injuries but the petrol bomb damaged a police vehicle. This was one of two related attacks to occur in the Fountain estate on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked in Takhta, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including one soldier and 10 assailants, were killed and 25 others, including 15 soldiers and 10 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

This was one of two related attacks in Irumu on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

07/16/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Bwakadi village, Irumu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two civilians were killed in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Irumu on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

07/16/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police post in Aybak, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/17/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of Shah Gul Khan, a local village chief and govevrnment supporter, in Garive Esfor, Ghor, Afghanistan. Khan and his wife were executed. In response, their daughter, Qamar Gul, used the family AK-47 to shoot and kill at least two assailants and injure several other assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Taliban, which denied involvement.

07/17/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Ahmadzai, Logar, Afghanistan. At least 19 people, including nine security personnel and 10 assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/17/2020: Assailants attacked military personnel in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. Commander Ali Hamid Ghaidan and two other soldiers were killed in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

Additionally, there were an unknown number of assailant casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/17/2020: An explosive device attached to a vehicle carrying guards of the provincial police chief, Mohammad Wais Samimi, in Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least eight police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/17/2020: An explosive device detonated on Peremohy Avenue outside Shuliavska Station in Kyiv, Ukraine. One person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2020: Assailants threw an explosive device and opened fire on Beit El, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, three assailants were arrested in connection with the incident.

07/17/2020: An explosive device detonated near military personnel in Las Piramides, Corinto, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of three attacks in Cauca on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

summary: 07/17/2020: Assailants attacked Nepal Communist Party (NCP) leader Suwaran Yadav with an explosive device at his home in Siraha, Province 2, Nepal. Yadav was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2020: Assailants set fire to a 5G phone mast along Burnham Avenue, Bierley, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

07/17/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Asfandi, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least six assailants were killed and three assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. This was one of two related attacks in Ghazni on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/17/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Khogyani, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed and three assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. This was one of two related attacks in Ghazni on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/17/2020: Assailants opened fire on Khaled al-Samer in Basra, Iraq. Samer, an activist, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2020: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Naml, Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. At least two people were killed and two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2020: An explosive device detonated in Saladin, Iraq. One Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) chief officer, Tal Abu Grad, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts and fired rockets at the district governor’s office in Anarjoy, Kapisa, Afghanistan. During the clash, two mortars fired by the assailants struck a house, killing two people and injuring nine other people. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/18/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting police forces responding to an earlier attack in Ghaibato, Paktika, Afghanistan. At least four police officers, including the district chief, were killed in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Tarin Kot, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/18/2020: Assailants attacked Imam Sahib district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least one soldier and one police officer were killed and five security personnel were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attack in Kunduz on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/18/2020: An explosive device detonated as the district police chief was attempting to defuse it in Shinkay, Zabul. The Nawbahar district police chief, Sahib Jan, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Qarchaghi, Qadis district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least two security personnel were killed and four were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/18/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a pro-government militia member in Koh Sayad, Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on soldiers en route to Bagram Airbase in Qala-e-Musa, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers, who were also brothers, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers en route to the site of a purported Taliban checkpoint in Zakhel, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least seven soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian motorcycle in Gaz Qol, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/18/2020: A landmine detonated against a military patrol near the Line of Actual Control in Ladakh state, India. One soldier was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: Assailants attacked Anti-Narcotics Force officials near Mashkel, Washuk, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least two officials were killed and six others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on Venezuelan sex workers in Buenos Aires, Cauca, Colombia. Two women, who were working as sex workers, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

summary: 07/18/2020: Two explosive devices detonated targeting a military vehicle near a checkpost along the Paktia-Khost highway in Paktia province, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: Assailants threw an incendiary device at the Suriname Embassy in Queenstown, Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, Guyana. There were no reported casualties as the device hit a tree rather than the embassy. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Sarobi district, Paktika, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/18/2020: Assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire on a military vehicle in La Silla, Tibu, Norte de Santander, Colombia. At least two soldiers were killed and eight soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

07/18/2020" Assailants shot and killed Nail Vargasa, a civilian, in Agpalali, Sandayao, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/18/2020: Four assailants raided Wakoko village, Djugu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 07/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on three people on their way to a mining site in Limani, Djugu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The three victims were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 07/18/2020: Assailants abducted and sexually assaulted seven women in Okareba, Djugu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. All hostages were released a short time later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 07/18/2020: Assailants opened fire in Totso, Djugu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 07/18/2020: An explosive device detonated in Abu Ghraib district, Al Anbar, Iraq. One Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) member was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on farmers in Kuburmbula, Borno, Nigeria. At least two civilians were killed and 10 civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/18/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of deputy security minister Abdi Abdinasir Said Muse in Taleh junction, Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Muse was not harmed as he was not in the vehicle; however, one guard was killed and three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

07/18/2020: Assailants abducted five children from Pemi, Chibok, Borno, Nigeria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/18/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Khanabad, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two security personnel were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attack in Kunduz on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Karosi, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least six people, including three pro-government militia members and three assailants, were killed and four others, including three militia members and one assailant, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked a security convoy in Gharchaghai, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least five people, including four soldiers and one assailant, were killed and another soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked Dawlatabad district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least three pro-government militia members were killed and two militia members were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, one militia member was taken hostage. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/19/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Failaq al Sham leader Hossein Bedra in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. Hossein was killed and at least 13 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/19/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Salameh, Aleppo, Syria. At least eight civilians were killed and 82 others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK). Sources also attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

07/19/2020: Assailants launched mortars at Janale, Lower Shebelle region, Somalia. At least three civilians were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked Posso village, Nord, Burkina Faso. At least one security volunteer and four assailants were killed in the attack and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked a wedding party in Kukum Daji, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least 21 people were killed and 28 others were injured in the attack. Additionally, an unknown number of people were reported missing and their whereabouts are unknown. This was one of four attacks in Kaura on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked Manyii Kurum, Kaduna, Nigeria. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of four attacks in Kaura on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked Sabon Gari, Kaduna, Nigeria. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of four attacks in Kaura on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked Kaura, Kaduna, Nigeria. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of four attacks in Kaura on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

07/19/2020: Assailants ambushed Nigerian military personnel in Jibia district, Katsina, Nigeria. At least 23 soldiers were killed and two assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. An unknown number of soldiers were reported missing and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/19/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) vehicle in Jazirah, Saladin, Iraq. Two PMF members were killed and four were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/19/2020: Assailants fired three rockets towards the Green Zone, Baghdad, Iraq. The rockets were intercepted and two landed near the United States embassy. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an Iran-backed militia.

07/19/2020: An assailant threw an incendiary device targeting Pierrot Catholic Church in Pierrot, Vieux Fort, St. Lucia. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources noted that the assailant shouted "Burn Jesus, burn the Holy Ghost" as he was being arrested.

07/19/2020: Assailants attacked the governor of Herat province, Abdul Wahid Qatali, outside Herat, Afghanistan. One assailant was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/18/2020: Assailants abducted 14 female civilians from Mushapano, Maniema, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The hostages were released on July 21, 2020. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Malaika militia.

07/19/2020: Assailants set fire to ten police vehicles in Mont-Royal borough, Montreal, Quebec, Canada. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Anarchists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that "cops are murderers" and accused police officers of defending white supremacists.

07/19/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Afghan National Police along the Herat-Islam Qala highway in Kohsan district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed and three others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/19/2020: Assailants physically assaulted and injured 25 civilians in Parcheli, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/20/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Shenwari, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents near Kunduz on this date. At least nine people, including five police officers and four assailants, were killed and six other people, including three assailants, were injured in this attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/20/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of the director of Gulmiran-e-Shahid school in Golmiran, Baghlan, Afghanistan. The director was killed and two children were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/20/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Qazaq, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents near Kunduz on this date. At least six people, including three soldiers and three assailants, were killed and four other people, including two soldiers and two assailants, were injured in this attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/20/2020: Assailants attacked the district governor's office in Obe district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least nine people, including one Afghan Local Police (ALP) officer and eight assailants, were killed and 16 other people, includng three officers and 13 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/20/2020: Assailants attacked Malid security checkposts in Tor, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 32 people, including seven soldiers and 25 assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash and a retaliatory airstrike. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/20/2020: Assailants opened fire on security checkposts in Shekhan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least five assailants were killed and two other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/20/2020: Assailants abducted Hella Mewis near her office on Abu Nuwas Street in Karrada, Baghdad, Iraq. Mewis, a German activist and the head of the Bait Tarkib art collective, was released on July 24, 2020. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to an Iran-backed militia. In addition, Mewis was released in exchange for a member of a "faction close to the Hashed al-Shaabi," who had been arrested in connection with the kidnapping.

07/20/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden truck targeting a military convoy in Saydabad district, Wardak, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least eight soldiers were killed and nine soldiers were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for airstrikes against civilians.

The assailant threw a grenade which failed to detonate and opened fire on police during the attack. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an animal rights extremist, Maksym Kryvoshm. He demanded that Ukraine's president promote an animal rights documentary. Sources also noted that Kryvoshm previously expressed dissatisfaction with Ukraine's "system" on social media.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities attributed the attack to the Taliban and the group denied responsibility.

07/30/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Cheshmeh-ye Shir, Baghlan, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/30/2020: Assailants attacked two fuel tankers in Cheshmeh-ye Shir, Baghlan, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/30/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a furniture shop in Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks in Maiduguri on this date. At least three civilians were killed in this incident and 27 others were injured across all three attacks. This was one of three related attacks in Maiduguri on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/30/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a civilian home in Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks in Maiduguri on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/30/2020: An explosive device detonated near the Amour Mezam Travel Agency in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/30/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians at their house in Gindin Akwati, Plateau, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

07/30/2020: An explosive device detonated and a sniper opened fire on an army patrol in Qalah, Diyala, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

summary: 08/01/2020: Assailants set fire to the town hall in Ercilla, Araucania, Chile. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Mapuche Activists.

Over the course of the next day at least 39 people, including 10 assailants, were killed and at least 50 other people were wounded in the attack. Additionally, more than 300 inmates are believed to still be on the run. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 08/02/2020: Assailants abducted Shakir Manzoor in Rambhama village, Kulgam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Manzoor, an off-duty Army soldier, was found deceased on or before August 9, 2020. 08/02/2020: Assailants fired artillery at a military camp in Gomacoura, Segou, Mali. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. At least five soldiers were killed and five soldiers were injured across both assaults. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

Police arrested Roman Skrypnyk, an Uzbeki national on the scene. Karimov claimed responsibility for the incident and stated a number of grievances, including that the Ukrainian president had failed to fulfill promises and that one person should rule the world. Karimov also demanded 40,000 hryvnias ($1,440) and identified himself as "the Holy Spirit, Lord God." Sources noted that Karimov has a history of mental illness, including a diagnosis in 1998 of "oligophrenia."
