gname: Ansaru (Jama'atu Ansarul Muslimina Fi Biladis Sudan)

summary: 08/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on residents and set fire to residences in Magamiya, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least five people were killed and seven houses were set on fire in the assault. This was one of five coordinated attacks in this area overnight. Ansaru (Jama'atu Ansarul Muslimina Fi Biladis Sudan) claimed responsibility for the incidents. Sources also attributed the attacks to Fulani extremists.
gname: Ansaru (Jama'atu Ansarul Muslimina Fi Biladis Sudan)

summary: 08/06/2020: Assailants hijacked seven fuel tankers and set fire to two other tankers along the A76 highway in Puli Khumri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed in an ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a former police chief, Gen Mohammad Daud Amin, in Kabul, Afghanistan. One person was killed and Amin was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Moise Katumbi in Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Katumbi, an opposition party leader and former governor of Katanga, was not harmed in the attack as no casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/06/2020: Assailants attempted to attack Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Security forces repulsed the attack and there were no reported casualties. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 08/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on Sajad Ahmad Khanday near his residence in Vessu area, Qazigund neighborhood, Kulgam district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Khanday, a village sarpanch and BJP leader, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on Arif Ahmad inside his residence in Akhran, Kulgam district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Ahmad, a local sarpanch, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
08/06/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden balloon in Arad, Southern, Israel. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/06/2020: An assailant held six people hostage in a bank in Le Havre, Normandy, France. Five hostages were released, and the sixth hostage was rescued when the assailant was arrested after six hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the assailant expressed support for the Palestinian cause and wore a green-colored flag over during the attack. Authorities suspected that the assailant had "Islamist sympathies."

08/06/2020: Assailants attacked a military base along the Kandahar-Ghazni highway in Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Ghazni within 24 hours. At least 10 assailants were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/06/2020: Assailants launched mortars and opened fire on a military post in Sherk, Diyala, Iraq. At least two soldiers were killed and four soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/05/2020: Assailants attacked a checkpoint belonging to the second regiment of the Iraqi Volunteer Forces in Mutbijah wa Ishat al Walid, Saladin, Iraq. At least two soldiers were killed and three other soldiers were wounded. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/06/2020: Assailants attacked the Bharasar Bazar in Burichang, Chittagong, Bangladesh. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/06/2020: Assailants attacked Colonel Adel al-Hammadi, a member of the 35th Armored Brigade, in Al-Ain, Taizz, Yemen. Hammadi was not harmed, though one soldier was killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah Party.

08/06/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers and nomadic herders in South Kordofan, South Sudan. There were an unknown number of casualties including security forces and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sudan People's Liberation Movement - North.
08/06/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosives-laden motorcycle in Suluk, Raqqah, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/06/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosives-laden motorcycle in Mebruke, Al Hasakah, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

08/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Shakhri Kokhna, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Eshagzay, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/07/2020: Assailants abducted Pastor Tanjoh Christopher Fon from Batibo, Momo district, North-West, Cameroon. Fon, a community leader and humanitarian aid worker, was killed shortly after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

08/07/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Defense and Security Forces (ANDSF) position in Akazai, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least six people, including one army officer and five assailants, were killed and 12 other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/07/2020: Assailants attacked Mohammad Yaqoob Haidari, the governor of Kabul, in Shakardara district, Kabul, Afghanistan. Haidari was unharmed but one of his bodyguards was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/07/2020: Assailants opened fire at a livestock market in Namoungou, Est, Burkina Faso. At least 20 people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/07/2020: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia security checkpoint in Arjal, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed and five others, including two militia members and three assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
08/07/2020: Assailants set fire to Omar Mosque in Bron, Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes, France. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/07/2020: Assailants attacked Mohamed Salem al-Kholani, the Taizz Military Police commander in Jabal Habashy district, Taizz, Yemen. Kholani was not harmed but three of his bodyguards were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Abbas Brigade.

08/08/2020: A suicide bomber in an explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting a Public Protection Force base in Kotal-e-Rawza, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Following the blast, assailants then opened fire on the base. At least 10 people, including seven security personnel and three assailants, were killed and 16 other security personnel were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/08/2020: An explosive device detonated near coca eradication in Vista Hermosa district, Meta, Colombia. At least three soldiers and one civilian were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to FARC dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 08/08/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police officer in Chajo, Bajaur district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The officer was killed and his brother was injured in the attack. The Pakistan Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Pakistan Province of the Islamic State

summary: 08/07/2020: Assailants attacked a base housing Ethiopian soldiers in Luq, Gedo, Somalia. At least one soldier was killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/08/2020: Asuicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting the gates of a military base in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least eight people and the assailant were killed and 14 others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and stated the attack was to expose the helplessness and failure of the government to keep the government and military safe in the city.

08/08/2020: Assailants stopped two farmers in Poso, Central Sulawesi, Indonesia. One victim escaped, while the other was stabbed and killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Mujahidin Indonesia Timur (MIT).

08/08/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Shamir, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least four police officers were killed and there were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the attack and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.
08/08/2020: Assailants shot and injured a soldier driving in Bacho district, Narathiwat, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/08/2020: Assailants attacked security forces’ checkpoints in Gelan district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Six assailants were killed and six others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/08/2020: Assailants attacked a World Food Programme offices in Garbahaareey town, Gedo, Somalia. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

08/08/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a police patrol in Faiz Mohammad Khan Watt, Khost, Afghanistan. Three police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/08/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting police personnel in Farokhi Square, Ghazni, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and two other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/08/2020: An assailant threw explosive devices at protesters in Laurelhurst Park in Portland, Oregon, United States. One device detonated while the other failed to explode and there were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed resposnibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected Louis Gerrick Fernbaugh, who denied throwing the explosives but confirmed to sources that he was present and conducting "reconnaissance" on the night of the attack. Sources noted that Ferbaugh has "boasted on social media about infiltrating "ANTIFA."

08/08/2020: Assailants attacked military sites in At Tuhayta, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Three assailants were killed and an unknown number of others were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/08/2020: Assailants fired a Katyusha missile at Tuz Khormato district, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/08/2020: Assailants attacked Litamanda, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least five people were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

08/08/2020: Assailants intercepted and hijacked a vehicle carrying five people, including an NGO official and a school principal, along Fada Ngourma-Kantchari road, Est, Burkina Faso. The hostages were released on August 9, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/08/2020: Assailants raided a wedding and abducted two civilians in Ataq, Shabwah, Yemen. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah Party.

08/08/2020: Assailants set fire to a backhoe at a road construction project in Santa Fe, General MacArthur district, Eastern Samar, Philippines. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/28/2020: Assailants broke into a fenced parking lot and lit a Molotov cocktail inside a police vehicle at the Arkansas State Police Headquarters in Little Rock, Arkansas, United States. Other police vehicles were graffitied and had their tires slit. Police arrested Brittany Jeffrey, Renea Goddard, Emily Nowlin, and Aline Espinosa-Villegas for the incident; which occurred after a protest against police in Little Rock. Sources noted the Molotov cocktail had been prepared at Jeffrey’s house prior to the incident.

08/09/2020: Security forces discovered an explosive device in Company, Kabul, Afghanistan. As security personnel attempted to defuse the device, it detonated, killing two civilians and injuring five security personnel. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in Muhmand Dara district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Karez Elyas, Herat, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Shen Naray, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least eight people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on tourists at Koure Giraffe Centre in Koure, Tillaberi, Niger. At least six tourists, identified as French humanitarian aid workers, a driver, and a guide were killed in the attack. The Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 08/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on Abdul Hamid Najar near his residence in Mohandpura, Budgam district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Najar, a BJP leader/worker, was transported to the hospital and later died from his injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on construction personnel working on a security barrier along the border with the Gaza Strip in Kissufim, Southern, Israel. Assailants also opened fire on military personnel as they responded to the attack. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: Assailants in Gaza launched incendiary balloons targeting agricultural fields in Eshkol regional council, Southern, Israel. No casualties were reported but the fields were set on fire in the attack. Wa'ed al-Tahrir claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy transporting equipment for US forces in Dhi Qar, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: Assailants threw a molotov cockatail at a set of propoane tanks adjacent to the Sydney Community Church in Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada. There were no injuries in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/09/2020: An explosive device detonated near Tajaw, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least eight people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/07/2020: Assailants armed with machetes attacked farmers in Bolo Bolo, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least seven farmers were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Zaire Self-Defense Group and the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

08/09/2020: Assailants armed with firearms and machetes attacked Lisey, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least five people were killed in the assault. This was one of three coordinated incidents in this area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 08/09/2020: Assailants armed with firearms and machetes attacked Tchulu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two people were killed in the assault. This was one of three coordinated incidents in this area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 08/09/2020: Assailants armed with firearms and machetes attacked Aloys, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 12 people were killed in the assault. This was one of three coordinated incidents in this area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 08/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on Syed Mukhtar Hussain Shah near Ubhaya Pul, Dera Ismail Khan district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Shah, the Imambargah Chah Roshan Shah caretaker, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilian residences and farms in Jabaliyah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/09/2020: Assailants attacked tribal forces near Mount Nofan in Jabal Nawfan, Al Bayda, Yemen. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah)
08/09/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Alizaman, an influencial tribal leader, outside of his residence in Zintu, Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: Assailants attacked a military camp in Janaay Cabdalla, Lower Juba, Somalia. There were an unknown number of assailants killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

08/09/2020: An assailant set fire to Judah Temple Ministries, a predominantly black church, and vandalized numerous headstones in the church's cemetery on Snug Harbor Road in Shady Side, Maryland, United States of America. There were no injuries in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Sheikh Yahya Al-Hajouri in Marib, Yemen. Al-Hajouri, a prominent Salafi figure, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah party, which the group denied.

08/09/2020: Assailants fired a mortar that landed on a civilian home in Shirzad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least seven people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/09/2020: An explosive device planted inside a handcart detonated in Company, Kabul, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and five security personnel were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: Assailants attacked the Security Administration headquarters in Jabal Habashy district, Taizz, Yemen. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of two related attacks in the district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah Party.

08/09/2020: Assailants shelled villages near the Security Administration headquarters in Jabal Habashy district, Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in the district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Islah Party.

08/09/2020: Assailants attacked pro-government militia security checkpoints in Kaldish, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least four people were killed, including one militia member and three assailants, in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Malangi Khwla, Khost, Afghanistan. At least two children were killed and one child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians and burned homes in Edikwu, Benue, Nigeria. At least 13 people were killed, several people were injured, and an unknown number of others were reported missing in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in front of Haji Nida Market along Mall Road in Chaman, Qila Abdullah district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least five people were killed and 10 others injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) and Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Frontier Constabulary vehicle in Hub, Lasbela district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least eight people, including FC and police personnel, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2020: An explosive device detonated at a US military base near the Jraischan border crossing with Kuwait near Jirishan, Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Ashab al-Kahf claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/10/2020: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in Mikrorayon, Kabul, Afghanistan. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2020: Assailants fired three rockets at a police post in Munda Qala, Lower Dir district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least three officers were injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/10/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Bupinder Singh in Tral, Pulwama district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Singh, a panchayat member, was not harmed as he was not present at the time of the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/10/2020: An explosive device detonated as it was being planted in Esfandi, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed and seven others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
08/10/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Benoit Maria, an Agronomists and Veterinarians Without Borders aid worker, in Pacam, Quiche, Guatemala. No group claimed resposnibility for the incident.
08/10/2020: An explosive device was discovered and defused at Sullatober Square in Carrickfergus, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2020: An explosive device was discovered and defused outside a Sinn Fein office along Sevastopol Street in west Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2020: Assailants shot and killed Randall Echanis, a peace consultant for the National Democratic Front of the Philippines and peasant leader, at his home in Novaliches Proper., Quezon City, Metropolitan Manila, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
08/10/2020: A sniper shot and killed a civilian in Ishma, Al Bayda, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/10/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a Pakistan Rangers headquarters in Shikarpur, Sindh, Pakistan. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of two related attacks targeting Rangers in Sindh on this day. The Sindhudesh Revolutionary Army (SRA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to the Pakistani occupation of the Sindhi nation on the anniversary of national slavery for the Sindhi nation by the "Punjabi imperialists."

08/10/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a Pakistan Rangers headquarters in Jacobabad, Sindh, Pakistan. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of two related attacks targeting Rangers in Sindh on the same day. The Sindhudesh Revolutionary Army (SRA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to the Pakistani occupation on the anniversary of national slavery for the Sindhi nation on the day in which "Punjabi imperialists" occupied their land.

08/11/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Pir Ghaibi, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including four security personnel and three assailants, were killed and five others, including two security personnel and three assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police vehicle that refused to stop at a checkpoint that they had established in Angor Bagh, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/10/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Gorokhel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least nine people, including six local police force members and three assailants, were killed and five other officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

08/11/2020: An explosive device attached to a truck carrying National Directorate of Security (NDS) personnel detonated in the 11th police district, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/11/2020: Assailants captured and shot a police officer in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on border soldiers in Chanbuzkol, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/11/2020: An explosive device detonated outside the the Arman-i-Shahr Radio station building in Puli Khumri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties, but the building was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Baghranian, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least four police officers were killed and two officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2020: Assailants executed a civilian, Comfort Tumassang, in Muyuka, South-West, Cameroon. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attack and accused the victim of being a government informant.
08/11/2020: Assailants killed a civilian in Ngoketunjia district, North-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

08/11/2020: Assailants abducted civilians from Gueskerou, Diffa, Niger. This was one of two attacks in this area over 24 hours. At least 11 people were abducted across the two incidents. The hostages were rescued on August 17, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

08/11/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Masjid-e Sabz, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least 11 assailants were killed and another ten assailants plus two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/11/2020: Assailants were repulsed as they attempted to plant a mine in Guzar Khazanadar, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least eight assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/11/2020: Assailants abducted Tauqir Sharif, an aid worker, in Idlib, Syria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hayat Tahrir al-Sham. Sources noted Sharif was abducted “because he scolded an HTS investigator.”

08/11/2020: Assailants abducted Souaibou Cissé along a road in Namsiguia, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. Cissé, the Grand Imam of Djibo, was killed and his body was discovered on August 15, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/11/2020: Assailants attacked security personnel in Juma Qala, Logar, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in this area on this day. At least six assailants were killed and seven others were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/11/2020: Assailants attacked security personnel in Omarabad, Logar, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in this area on this day. At least six assailants were killed and seven others were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2020: Assailants abducted two people, including an elder, in Naw Abad, Takhar, Afghanistan. The elder was killed shortly after and the fate of the remaining hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/11/2020: Assailants attacked a local army outpost in Pachir Agam district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a US coalition convoy near Taji military base in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2020: Assailants fired a rocket that landed and detonated in Green Zone, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Kata'ib Hezbollah.

08/11/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at the Jashan-e-Azadi stalls in Gulshan-e-Hadeed neighborhood, Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. At least seven people were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Sindh nationalists.

08/11/2020: A suicide bomber detonated targeting a Pakistani Army vehicle in Ladha, South Waziristan district Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. In addition to the assailant fatality, at least three soldiers, including a brigadier, were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2020: Assailants abducted and killed a teacher in Bamenda, Mezam, North-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists. Sources also noted that the victim was targeted for taking part General Certificate Exam (GCE) preparation scheduled for the following day.

08/11/2020: Assailants accidentally detonated their own mine in Dabra Gol, Kunar, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed, including Mawlawi Bahar a commander of the Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP). No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP).

08/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on an 81st Infantry Battalion (IB) patrol in Suagayan, Ilocos Sur, Philippines. At least one soldier, one civilian, and five assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/11/2020: Assailants attacked a gendarme and prison in Kimparana, Segou, Mali. At least two people, including a gendarme and prison guard, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that at least five prisoners escaped during the attack.

08/11/2020: Assailants attacked pro-government militia soldiers near Tabani, Raqqah, Syria. At least three militia soldiers were killed in the attack. summary: 08/11/2020: A mortar shell landed and detonated near a Kurdistan Democratic Party (KDP) office on 52nd Street, Karrada, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

The deputy police chief was not harmed, but four police officers were killed and 15 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle transporting National Water Affairs Regulation Authority engineers along Kabul-Parwan Highway in Nopula, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two engineers were killed and the driver was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Taliban.

08/12/2020: Assailants abducted three soldiers in Kabul, Afghanistan. The soldiers were killed shortly after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/12/2020: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia outpost in Timor Sarai, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least 10 people, including four militia members and six assailants, were killed and two other militia members were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/12/2020: Assailants abducted two civilians in Khwaja-e-Sorkh, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. The hostages were killed shortly after the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/12/2020: Assailants abducted civilians from Gueskerou, Diffa, Niger. This was one of two attacks in this area over 24 hours. At least 11 people were abducted across the two incidents. The hostages were rescued on August 17, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

A clash ensued when militia and military forces intervened, and six civilians and five assailants were killed and 20 assailants and five civilians were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack, stating that the targeted village was a Somali military base.

08/12/2020: Assailants attacked the port of Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were an unknown number of casualties. In addition, two Catholic nuns were taken hostage during the assault. The hostages were released on September 6, 2020. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

The remaining hostages were released on October 7, 2020. Colonel Assimi Goita, the leader of the National Committee for the Salvation of the People, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "By making this intervention, we have put Mali first" and "Mali is in a sociopolitical and security crisis, There is no more room for mistakes." The group also promised elections in a "reasonable time" and forced President Keita to resign on a television broadcast the following day.

summary: 08/28/2020: Assailants fired a missile targeting a military camp mosque in Marib, Yemen. At least five security personnel were killed and around 40 more were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/28/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in 7th police district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2020: Assailants abducted Jorge Ivan Ramosan, an Alternative Revolutionary Common Forces (FARC) leader, from his vehicle in Montecristo district, Bolivar, Colombia. Ramos was tied up, forced to walk for an hour, and then killed a short time later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) and stated that the victim was targeted for collaborating with the military.

08/28/2020: An explosive device detonated at an ice cream shop in the fifth police district of Herat, Afghanistan. At least three people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 08/28/2020: Assailants threw an explosive device targeting the residence of Yahya Hammoud Al-Ahdal in Durayhami district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Al-Ahdal, a cleric, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah), who denied responsibility.

08/28/2020: Assailants opened fire on Manobo tribes people in Bayogo, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. Two people were killed, including a member of the Citizen Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU). No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/28/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Amu, Borno, Nigeria. Two people were killed and two others were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

08/27/2020: Assailants attacked a military post in Nofal, Diyala, Iraq. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of two related attacks in Nofal on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/27/2020: Security forces pursuing retreating assailants after a previous attack triggered an explosive device planted on a bridge in Nofal, Diyala, Iraq. At least one soldiers was killed and two others were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Nofal on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/28/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle near a Turkish military post along M4 Road in Salet al-Zuhur, Idlib, Syria. Following the blast, assailants then opened fire on the post. There were an unknown number of casualties in the blast and ensuing clash. The Ansar Abi Bakr al-Siddiq Squadron claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2020: Assailants abducted Chris Sodje, the younger brother of former National Scrabble team captain Paul Sodje, in Ifon, Ondo, Nigeria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

08/28/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Harni Khajura, Bihar, India. Two civilians were killed and another civilian was injured in the attack. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victims of being police informants.

08/29/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Shahab, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least one pro-government militia member was killed and two militia members were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/29/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Merzakhel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least eight people, including two pro-government militia members and six assailants, were killed and another two militia members were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, three uprising members were abducted, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a National Uprising Movement (NUM) vehicle in Narai Kotal, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least five people, including four militia members and one civilian, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpost in Pantha Chowk, Srinagar district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Assistant Sub-Inspector Babu Ram and three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

08/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on security checkpoints in Roi, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed and several other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/29/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Global Coalition convoy transporting logistics supplies close to Nile Bridge along Highway 1 in Al-Nil, Babil, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/29/2020: Assailants fired a rocket that struck an abandoned house in the Green Zone, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2020: Assailants attacked a local police forces post in Dubandi, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 21 people, including one police officer and 20 assailants, were killed and 15 others, including two police officers and 13 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

08/29/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Bar Sanguni, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least four assailants and one soldier were killed and three assailants and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash with Somali National Army soldiers. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2020: An explosive device detonated near a civilian vehicle outside Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/29/2020: An explosive device detonated in Gardez, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least four people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol between Zalhafa and Saruj, Nineveh, Iraq. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2020: Assailants attacked Karma Agagowei, Councilor representing Ward 6 Sagbama Council Area, with firearms and machetes while he was on his way home in Opolo, Bayelsa, Nigeria. Agagowei was killed and one of his passengers was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/29/2020: An assailant opened fire and killed Aaron "Jay" Danielson, a supporter of the Patriot Prayer group, in Portland, Oregon, United States. Michael Forest Reinoehl, an Anti-Fascist activist, claimed responsibiity for the incident, stating that he acted in self-defense. Reinoehl previously posted "I am 100% ANTIFA all the way!" and "We truly have an opportunity right now to fix everything. But it will be a fight like no other! It will be a war and like all wars there will be casualties" on social media.

08/29/2020: Assailants abducted Narayan Prasad Bhandari, head teacher from Bhimsen Basic School, in Tinpatan, Sindhuli district, Bagmati, Nepal. Bhandari was released the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested an assailant and attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand.

08/30/2020: Assailants attacked the district center in Kishindih district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least three pro-government militia members were killed and two militia members were injured in the attack. In addition, the governor's office was destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/30/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Mohammad Hasan Hotak, a former senator representing Zabul, outside his residence in Qala-e Wazir, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: Assailants fired a rifle grenade at a police post in Sopore, Baramulla district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2020: Assailants launched an explosives-laden drone targeting Abha International Airport in Abha, Asir, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as security forces intercepted the drone. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/30/2020: Assailants deployed an explosives-laden boat towards Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Authorities intercepted the boat before it could detonate and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/30/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Mir Kalam Wazir in Mir Ali, North Waziristan district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Wazir, the North Waziristan member of the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Assembly, was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2020: Assailants abducted assistant sub-inspector Nagaiya Korsa in Kutru, Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, India. Korsa was killed and his body was discovered the following day. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2020: Assailants fired two rockets that landed and detonated near Baghdad International Airport in Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle near Noorzo, Helmand, Afghanistan. Two shopkeepers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2020: Assailants shot and killed Awadh Fadak, a leader in the Islamic Reform Group (Islah), while he was driving his car in Shaykh Uthman, Mansoura, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/30/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces in Beir al-Abd, North Sinai, Egypt. At least seven security forces members were killed in the attack. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 08/30/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Zaranj, Nimroz, Afghanistan. Seven officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military post between Kawkareik and Myawaddy, Kayin, Myanmar. Two soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. A suspect claimed that he was trained and ordered to carry out the attack by the Karen National Union, but the group denied involvement. Sources also attributed the attack to the Democratic Karen Buddhist Army (DKBA).

08/30/2020: Explosive devices hidden beneath the corpses of soldiers detonated between Kawkareik and Myawaddy, Kayin, Myanmar. At least two soldiers were killed and five soldiers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date; this bombing targeted military personnel responding to a previous attack. A suspect claimed that he was trained and ordered to carry out the attack by the Karen National Union, but the group denied involvement. Sources also attributed the attack to the Democratic Karen Buddhist Army (DKBA).

08/31/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Afghan Local Police (ALP) commander in Hawly, Baghlan, Afghanistan. The commander was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/31/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Gala-Chah, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Maydan Shahr, Wardak, Afghanistan. At least four police officers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Chawni, Herat, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle responding to an earlier explosion in Chawni, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and a another soldier was injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at an Indian Army convoy in Azad Gunj neighborhood, Baramulla, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least six civilians were injured in the blast. Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that their goal was to disrupt the peace, revive terrorism in Baramulla, and inspire young people to join the group.

08/31/2020: Assailants set fire to a COVID-19 testing site in Mernda, Victoria, Australia. At least one person, a security guard who suffered smoke inhalation, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: Assailants attacked At Tuhayta district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least four assailants were killed and eight assailants were injured in the ensuing clash with Giants Brigades militia forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/31/2020: Assailants threw an explosive device at a police station in Mominabad, Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. Two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: An explosive device attached to an oil tanker detonated in Shirin Jinnah Colony, Saddar Town neighborhood, Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: Assailants attacked and killed Chhattisgarh Armed Force Head Constable Kaneshwar Netam in Bodli village, Dantewada district, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that Maoists were involved.

08/31/2020: Assailants threw a petrol bomb through the window of a residence in Antrim, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no injuries in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: An explosive device detonated at Wadi Jarjara in Nasifah, Al Bayda, Yemen. At least two people were killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/31/2020: Assailants opened fire on soldiers eradicating illicit crops in La Pradera, Norte de Santander, Colombia. At least four soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 08/31/2020: Assailants attacked the house of a community figure in Talakachi, Extreme-North, Cameroon. One person was killed and three were injured in the raid. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.

09/01/2020: A suicide bomber detonated at an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp in Kouyape, Extreme-North, Cameroon. In addition to the assailant, at least four people were killed and seven people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
08/31/2020: An explosive device detonated along a railway track in Zhytomyr, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a police patrol in Hayat Serai, Lower Dir district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/28/2020: Assailants attacked a Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) headquarters in Tuwaymin, Al Hasakah, Syria. At least four SDF members were killed in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/31/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting Iraqi Army personnel and then opened fire on them in Zinjili village, Saladin, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/31/2020: Assailants set fire to vehicles and machinery at the Besalco company in Pichibureo, Bio-Bio, Chile. Three vans and six pieces of machinery were damaged but there were no reported casualties in the attack. The Arauco Malleco Coordinating Group (CAM) - Chile claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded the release of Mapuche prisoners.

08/31/2020: Assailants carried out an attack near a school exam center in Isiro, Haut-Uele, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Banyamulenge rebels. Sources also noted that the assailants intended to "sabotage the exams."

08/31/2020: Assailants attacked a center housing students preparing to take their final exam in Isiro, Haut-Uele, Democratic Republic of the Congo. An unknown number of students were sexually assaulted during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: Assailants opened fire on the headquarters of the Badr Organization in Musalla neighborhood, Kirkuk, Iraq. One guard was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting military forces in Hitaween, Adhaim subdistrict, Khalis district, Diyala, Iraq. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2020: Assailants attacked the headquarters of Dijlah TV in Karada area, Baghdad, Iraq. No casualties were reported, but equipment was destroyed and the building was set on fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sadrist Movement and the Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF). Sources noted that the attack followed the broadcast of music on the Shia religious holiday of Ashura.

09/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Mil 73, Farah, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Aliabad, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/01/2020: Assailants attacked the office of the governor in Qaysar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one police officer and 11 assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/01/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a female police officer in Shora Khak, Kunduz, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/01/2020: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Rahmat Shah, the acting district head of the National Directorate of Security (NDS), detonated in Arghistan district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Shah was killed and one of his bodyguards was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting the headquarters of the Public Protection Force in Gardez district, Paktia, Afghanistan. Following the initial blast, two suicide bombers attempted to enter the building but were shot and killed by security forces. In addition to the assailants, three Pubic Protection Force members were killed and eight others were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for operations against the group.

08/31/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of the deputy provincial police chief in Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at a checkpoint on Kirkuk-Tikrit Highway at the Mariam Bek Bridge, Kirkuk, Iraq. In addition to the assailant, one civilian was killed and three security personnel were wounded. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/01/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Al-Sena'a, Ramadi, Al Anbar, Iraq. Three people, including a security member and two civilians, were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/01/2020: Assailants launched an explosives-laden drone targeting Abha airport in Abha, Asir, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as security forces intercepted the drone. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

09/01/2020: A suicide bomber detonated their explosives at a checkpoint in Janzour, Jafara, Libya. In addition to the assailant, it is unknown if there were any casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Tripoli Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Tripoli Province of the Islamic State

summary: 09/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol at the City Chemist Roundabout in Bamenda, Mezam district, North-West, Cameroon. A police officer, Petit Bikolo, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Dand Patan district, Paktia, Afghanistan. Six soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/01/2020: Assailants armed with knives attacked Ismail Madibsh, a Third Brigade General, at his residence in Mandar, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Madibsh was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/01/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a Fifth Brigade member in Daraa, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2020: Assailants attacked Nigerian soldiers in Garin Giwa, Kukawa district, Borno, Nigeria. At least 10 soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks in Borno on this date. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) faction of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2020: Assailants attacked Nigerian soldiers in Magumeri, Borno, Nigeria. At least nine soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks in Borno on this date. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) faction of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2020: Assailants abducted four IDPs/farmers at farmlands in Molai neighborhood, Dalwa, Jere district, Borno, Nigeria. One of the hostages escaped soon after the attack while the fate of the remaining victims is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Boko Haram.

09/01/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpost in Alishing district, Laghman, Afghanistan. At least six people, including one police officer and five assailants, were killed and two assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/01/2020: Assailants set fire to a Jewish-Arab school in Newe Shalom, Jerusalem district, Israel. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on a humanitarian convoy in Central Equatoria, South Sudan. Two civilians were killed, four were injured, and several vehicles were set on fire during the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Salvation Front (NAS).

09/01/2020: Assailants abducted Paul Sodje and a companion as they were delivering a ransom payment for an earlier abduction in Idoani, Ondo, Nigeria. Sodje, the former National Scrabble team captain, was killed along with the other victim. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

09/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) patrol between Bunia and Kasenyi, Irumu district, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 09/01/2020: Assailants shot and killed an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) soldier between Bunia and Kasenyi, Irumu district, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 09/01/2020: Assailants stole cell phones, money, and valuables from civilians between Bunia and Kasenyi, Irumu district, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 09/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a mobile communications tower in Boya, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/02/2020: Assailants attacked a border force's camp in Ghaki Kando, Kunar, Afghanistan. Two border force members were killed and two others were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/02/2020: Assailants attacked police officers in Andar district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were wounded and then abducted in the attack. One hostage was later killed while the fate of the remaining hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/02/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a National Directorate of Security (NDS) member in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/02/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device at a residence in Sancharak district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least six children were killed and two other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of the mayor of Pitogo in Poblacion, Pitogo district, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. The mayor, James Yecyec, was not harmed, though one of the passengers of the vehicle was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/00/2020: Sometime between August 30, 2020 and September 5, 2020, assailants attacked and killed the wife and son of a local leader in Kayanza, Burundi. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/02/2020: Assailants attacked federal police forces in Majid, Kirkuk, Iraq. An unknown number of assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/02/2020: Assailants attacked an Iraqi border guard headquarters in Makr al-Naam, Al Anbar, Iraq. Two border guards were killed and three border guards were injured during the incident. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/02/2020: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a convoy of logistical support vehicles for the Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve (CJTF-OIR) in Dhi Qar, Iraq. It is unknown whether there were any casualties during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/02/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy of a Combined Joint Task Force company contracting in Babil, Iraq. One civilian was injured during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/02/2020: An assailant rammed his vehicle into security personnel and then attempted to stab them at Tapuah junction in Tapuah, Salfit district, West Bank. Three people, including a soldier a police officer, and the assailant, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

09/02/2020: Assailants set fire to a backhoe working on a road project between Lebak and Kalamansig districts, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. There were no casualties. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

09/02/2020: Assailants attacked an army patrol responding to a previous attack on a road construction project in Datu Ito Andong, Kalamansig district, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. One soldier, Corporal Wilson Caguimbal, was killed. This was one of two related incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

09/02/2020: A suicide bomber detonated their device targeting an Afghan Local Police (ALP) officer, in Warduj district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. The assailant was killed and four people were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/02/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Colonel Ahmad Khan, a professor at the Kabul Police Academy, in Chihil Sutun, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/02/2020: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a security patrol in Wantey, Bura-Hache, Mandera, Kenya. One security force member was killed and a vehicle was destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/02/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Abdul Bari Rahimi, the Social Affairs Department director, in Ghazni, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed resposnibility for the incident.

09/02/2020: Assailants opened fire on protesters in Damt, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least four civilians were injured during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

09/02/2020: Assailants abducted 30 activists, including Anwar Obeidel and Ammar al-Da'i, in Damt, Ad Dali, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attribute the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities apprehended a suspect in connection with the attack. Sources noted that the assailant "allegedly blamed lawyers at the firm for preventing the removal of immigrants from the UK." Sources also reported that the assailant carried a Nazi and Confederate flag during the attack.

09/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian motorcycle in Indzargay, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least two civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/11/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Juy Dukhtar, Parwan, Afghanistan. At least nine people, including four police officers and five assailants, were killed and another police officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on security posts in Qadis district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least five people, including three assailants, were killed and five other people were injured in the ensuing clash. The victims included police officers and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/11/2020: Assailants attacked residences belonging to a pro-government militia member in Pitawak, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. The militia member was killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/11/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Jebrael, Herat, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were killed and six civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/11/2020: Assailants attacked security posts in Barakhanah, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least eight people, including three soldiers and five assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
09/11/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a police officer and soldier outside their residence in Daman district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/11/2020: A soldier poisoned his colleagues at an uprising forces base in Matani, Logar, Afghanistan. Following the poisoning, additional assailants attacked the base. At least 13 pro-government militia members were killed and five militia members were injured in the attack. In addition, five militia members were taken hostage, and the outcome of the abduction is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/11/2020: Assailants abducted four Borno state ministry of reconstruction, rehabilitation and resettlement officials and one civilian in Kareto, Borno, Nigeria. The hostages were released as of October 4, 2020. Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they would attack staff of international and local NGOs who worked for "the enemies of Islam.

09/11/2020: A suicide bomber detonated in Zeleved, Mayo-Tsanaga district, Extreme-North, Cameroon. In addition to the assailant, at least five people, including the traditional ruler and his wife, were killed and 10 other people were injured in the blast. Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/11/2020: An explosive device attached to the motorycle of Malak Sherbaz detonated in Kaga Bazaar, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Five people, including Sherbaz, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

In addition to the assailant, at least three people were killed and seven people were wounded in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/11/2020: Assailants abducted and killed a forest ranger in Kondronji, Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

09/11/2020: Security forces arrested two assailants attempting to carry out a grenade attack in Najibhat, Baramulla district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no casualties in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

09/11/2020: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a cart between Titao and Woro in Loroum district, Nord, Burkina Faso. Three civilians, including two children, were killed and one civilian was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/11/2020: A roadside bomb detonated while assailants were attempting to plant it in Fafi, Garissa, Kenya. Three assailants were killed and four assailants were injured during the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Al-Shabaab.

09/11/2020: Assailants fired explosives targeting civilian residences in At Tuhayta district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attribute the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

09/11/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan Army check point in Gandomak, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least 19 people, including six soldiers and 13 assailants, were killed and five soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

09/11/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan Army check point in Hasham Khelo, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least 6-15 soldiers and 13 assailants were killed and five soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

09/11/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan Army check point in Khwaja Khel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. At least 6-15 soldiers and 13 assailants were killed and five soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

09/11/2020: Assailants attacked Maputo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties, though an unknown number of residences were set on fire during the attack.. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
09/11/2020: Assailants attacked Tete, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/11/2020: Assailants attacked Mute, Palma district, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/10/2020: Assailants attacked Belu village in Irumu district, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. At least 35 people were killed across both attacks. Additionally, at least 17 people were abducted between this attack and two other attacks on September 8, 2020. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, some sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) and the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State.

09/11/2020: Assailants attacked civilians and burned residences in Manyi-Mashin, Zangon Kataf district, Kaduna, Nigeria. Two civilians, Cecilia Ishaya and Iliya Sunday, were killed during the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

09/11/2020: Assailants shot and killed three people at al-Hol camp in Al-Hawl, Al Hasakah, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to wives of Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) members.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

Sources also noted that the attack took place as Israel and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Bahrain took part in talks to normalize relations.

This was one of at least two similar attacks in this area on the same day. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attacks were in response to Israeli aggression. Sources noted that Tokhi was responding to an earlier attack in the neighboring Yahya Khel district. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
