09/19/2020: Assailants attacked checkpoints in Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/19/2020: Police discovered and safely defused three landmines off the Kaliveru-Tagada road in Charla area, Bhadrachalam, Khammam district, Telangana, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

09/19/2020: Assailants shot a civilian in his arms and legs in Stranocum, Ballymoney district, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. The victim was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Ulster Freedom Fighters (UFF).

No casualties were reported, though the school's sign was damaged in the fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that anti-Armenian graffiti had been sprayed at the school two months prior to the incident.

The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

At least three police officers and three assailants were killed and four other officers were taken hostage in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

summary: 09/19/2020: An assailant mailed a letter containing ricin addressed to President Donald Trump at the White House in Washington, District of Columbia, United States. The letter, which also contained an explicit death threat against President Trump, was intercepted by security officials. Pascale Ferrier, a Canadian citizen, was arrested for sending the letter as she attempted to illegally cross into the United States from Canada with an automatic weapon. A Twitter account linked to Ferrier included similar language to the ricin letter, including calling the President “an ugly tyrant clown.” Ferrier has also been charged with sending a second ricin letter to a police station in Mission, Texas, United States out of personal enmity after being deported in 2019 for an expired visa and weapons charges.
09/19/2020: Assailants abducted Nour al-Shalo, a journalist, in Sarmada, Idlib, Syria. Shalo was released on January 4, 2021. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/19/2020: An assailant attacked journalist Hussein Khattab in Aleppo, Syria. Khattab was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, according to Khattab the attack was related to his report on living conditions in the village of Tar’hine, Aleppo.

In addition to five assailants, at least nine security personnel were killed and one other security personnel and three civilians were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

This was one of two related incidents in Badakhshan on the same day. Additionally, at least 10 assailants were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

At least 17 people were killed and several other people were abducted across all three assaults. At least one hostage was executed and their body was found on September 28, 2020. The fate of the remaining victims is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF). and the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities attributed the attack to conspiracy theory extremists and suspected that the attacks may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

The farmer was killed and another explosive device was found about three meters away. Security forces were able to safely remove the second device. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) and the Maute Group.

09/23/2020: Assailants threw a grenade into a livestock market in Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. One civilian was killed and four people, including two soldiers and two civilians, were injured. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

09/23/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Dehqan Qeshlaq, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks on this date. At least seven security personnel were killed and seven others were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/23/2020: Assailants attacked the Enayat military base in Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks on this date. At least seven security personnel were killed and seven others were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/23/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an international logistics convoy in Abu Ghraib, Al Anbar, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Kata'il Hezbollah claimed responsibility for the attack and stated it would continue to carry out attacks until United States forces leave Iraq.

09/23/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an International Coalition convoy in Awjah, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Ashab al-Kahf claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 09/00/2020: Sometime between September 20, 2020 and September 26, 2020, assailants raided Nabubussi, Mocimboa de Praia district, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

Badshah was not harmed; however, his son Bilal and a security guard Saeedullah were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/23/2020: Assailants sprayed pro-Biden, Black Lives Matter, and anarchist graffiti on a garage before setting fire to the garage, two trucks, a trailer, and two President Donald Trump flags at a home in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, United States. There were no reported casualties in the fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of anti-Trump extremists. Police noted the incident was suspicious and were unwilling to discuss any motive for the attack prior to the conclusion of the on-going investigation.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

09/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on Central Armed Police Force (CAPF) personnel inside a government building in Arhama, Shopian district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Mehmood recorded a video on his phone prior to the incident where he stated that he wanted to "avenging the publication of caricatures of the Prophet Mohammed." Authorities also stated that Mehmood planned to set the office on fire.

09/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on residences of security personnel in Bajwan, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one security member was killed and another was taken hostage in the attack. One hostage was rescued later the same day while the fate of the other two hostages is unknown. The Western Togoland Restoration Front (WTRF) claimed responsibility for the incident and called for the independence of Western Togoland.

10/04/2020: Assailants fired a missile that struck a village in Ardah, Jazan, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties, but a car was damaged in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested and charged a Syrian national identified as Abdullah al-HH, who was a known supporter of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and was reported to have been in contact with an ISIL recruiter. Sources suspected that the attack had homophobic and Islamist motivations.

10/04/2020: Assailants attacked military positions in Durayhami, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on Edward 'Edu' Alonte Reyes and another civilian in San Antonio, Laguna, Philippines. Reyes, a council secretary, and the civilian were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Abdul Wali Sharifi, the Jilga district governor, in Kotal-e-Murgh, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Three people, including Sharifi and two bodyguards, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/04/2020: Assailants attacked an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) convoy near Pissila, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. At least 25 people were abducted and killed in the attack. Muslim extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated the attack was conducted in retaliation for having volunteer defense fighters in the village.

10/04/2020: An assailant armed with a shovel attacked a Jewish student outside the Hohe Weide synagogue in Hamburg, Germany. The student was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources noted that the assailant was dressed in a German army uniform and had a piece of paper with a swastika in his pocket.

10/04/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Liseyi, Banyali Kilo sector, Djugo district, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least four people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 10/04/2020: Assailants armed with machetes attacked and killed a civilian at a trading center on Highway 27 in Iga Barrier, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 10/04/2020: Assailants attacked pro-government joint forces personnel in Hays district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. This was one of two similar attacks targeting Al Hudaydah on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/04/2020: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attempted to attack security personnel in Ron, Hays district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Security forces repelled the attack, resulting in an unknown number of assailant casualties, including a commander. This was one of two similar attacks targeting Al Hudaydah on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/04/2020: An assailant set fire to Enon Baptist Church along Enon road in South Fulton area, Georgia, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Assailants attacked an army outpost in Mahtab, Herat, Afghanistan. One soldier and one assailant were killed and four assailants were injured during the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/05/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Basalan, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least one person, a police commander, were killed and another police officer were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive-laden vehicle targeting the convoy of Rahmatullah Yarmal, the governor of Laghman, in Sultan Ghazi, Laghman, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, four security force members and four civilians were killed and two security force members and 38 civilians were wounded during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/04/2020: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a police vehicle in Seventh Police District, Lashkar Gah, Helmand Province, Afghanistan. A district police chief was killed and one police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Assailants launched a rocket targeting the Green Zone in Jadriyah neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. The rocket missed its target and landed behind the Babylon Hotel. This was one of two rockets attacks in this area on this day. There were no reported casualties in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Assailants launched a rocket targeting the Green Zone in Jadriyah neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. The rocket missed its target and landed near an Iraqi Airways Office. This was one of two rockets attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/05/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Fallujah, Al Anbar, Iraq. A police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) road-opening party near Kandizal Bridge in Pampore, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least two CRPF officers were killed and three CRPF officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

10/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Tral, Pulwama district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on Iraqi Federal Police officers near Nakar, Hawijah district, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least four police officers were killed and three officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 10/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on Dr. Naeemuddin Khattak, an Ahmadi professor, in Peshawar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Khattak was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources noted that the victim had an argument over religion with one of the assailants the previous day.

10/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on farmers in Igasan, Sulu, Philippines. A barangay peace officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).
10/05/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Assailants abducted six Kurdish civilians in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. The hostages were released shortly after, following the payment of a ransom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Turkish-backed militia.

10/05/2020: Assailants threw incendiary devices targeting Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) personnel near Einav, West Bank. At least one assailant was wounded when the security forces opened fire in response. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.
10/05/2020: Assailants fired two rockets that landed near Baghdad International Airport in Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Security forces intercepted and destroyed an explosives-laden boat in the Red Sea off the coast of Salif, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/05/2020: Assailants equipped with firearms and machetes attacked civilians in Mamove, 12 km west of Oicha, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 10 people were killed and one person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) and the Mayi Mayi.

10/05/2020: An assailant attempted to stab a police officer in Beit Einun, West Bank. The assailant was wounded, and there were no other reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Assailants attacked a security post along Al Khamseen street in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of two related attacks in the city on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/05/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in the Kilo 16 area in Bayt al Maru'i, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of two related attacks in the city on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah)

10/05/2020: Assailants attempted to attack security forces in Mano, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed and three others were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/00/2020: Sometime between October 3, 2020 and October 5, 2020, assailants attacked civilians travelling between Bule and Fataki in Djugo district, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least four people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.

summary: 10/05/2020: Assailants attacked the Jurm district center in Jurm district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. Nine assailants were killed and one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/05/2020: Assailants fired a rocket that landed near the Gaza Strip border in Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2020: Assailants attacked a government personnel convoy leaving a military base in Qansax Dheere, Bay, Somalia. One soldier was killed and four assailants were killed and two soldiers were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

10/05/2020: Assailants abducted four civilians from Munena, Tanganyika, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two hostages were wounded and rescued a short time later. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Hapa Na Pale.

10/05/2020: Assailants threw incendiary devices at an automotive company in Concepcion, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident through pamphlets that contained anti-state slogans and demanded freedom for prisoners.

10/05/2020: Assailants dropped an explosive device from a drone targeting a district administration office in Mirzakai, Paktia, Afghanistan. Two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/06/2020: A suicide bomber detonated a stolen explosives-laden police truck near a security outpost in Yakhchal, Helmand, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least four soldiers were killed and three other soldiers were wounded during the attack. Assailants also abducted two soldiers following the blast, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/06/2020: Assailants abducted and later killed a soldier traveling on public transportation in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/06/2020: Assailants assassinated a female appeals court employee in Khost, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/06/2020: An explosive device detonated at a cellular mobile network tower in Namaz Kot, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources noted that Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) had put up posters in area two days before the attack.

10/06/2020: Assailants attacked a passenger bus in Duse, between Dabacity and Kutulo, Mandera, Kenya. At least seven people were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

10/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on the house of Ghulam Qadir in Nunar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Qadir, the Ganderbal district vice president of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), was not harmed; however, one police officer and one assailant were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) or The Resistance Front (TRF).

10/06/2020: Assailants fired mortar shells targeting an airstrip in Dhusamareb, Dhusamareb district, Galguduud, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

10/06/2020: An explosives-laden truck detonated near a bus station in Bab, Aleppo, Syria. At least 17 people were killed and 70 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the People's Protection Units (YPG).

10/06/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying the head of Laghman province’s provincial council, Atiqullah Abdulrahimzai, in Qarghayi district, Laghman, Afghanistan. Five people, including Abdulrahimzai and four security guards, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/06/2020: Assailants abducted Mohammad Ali Ahmadi, the deputy head of security for the Ghazni Central Prison, along the Ghazni-Kabul highway in Ghazni, Afghanistan. Ahmadi was killed the next day on October 7, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/06/2020: Assailants set fire to cargo trucks and a passenger bus belonging to Del Monte Philippines in Talambao neighborhood, Bulahan, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. No casualties were reported, though the vehicles were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

10/06/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted along a dirt path between Surnaar and Tetam villages, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists and stated that the device was intended to target security forces.
10/06/2020: Assailants attacked soldiers in Birga-Peulh, Mopti, Mali. Three soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/06/2020: Assailants raided Wereng, Riyom district, Plateau, Nigeria. At least six people, including a traditional ruler Prince Chungyang Mwankwon Tengwong, were killed and several people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists carried out the attack, which was denied by a herders' organization.
10/05/2020: An explosive device detonated in Kalacha, Kabul, Afghanistan. A soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/06/2020: Assailants attacked military positions in Fazzah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. This was one of six related attacks in Al Hudaydah on this date. At least 12 assailants were killed between this incident and a later attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/06/2020: Assailants launched a remote-controlled explosives-laden drone targeting Najran, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as the drone was intercepted by Saudi coalition forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/06/2020: Assailants shelled Hid, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. Houses and farms were also damaged in the attack. This was one of six related attacks in Al Hudaydah on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/06/2020: Assailants shelled Hawak, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least one person was killed and seven people were injured in the attack. This was one of six related attacks in Al Hudaydah on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah), which the group denied, instead attributing the attack to the Saudi coalition.

10/06/2020: Assailants attempted to plant explosive devices near Al-Rabsa, Hawak district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Security forces intercepted the assailants before they were able to plant the explosives. No casualties were reported. This was one of six related attacks in Al Hudaydah on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/06/2020: Assailants attacked a security position in Bayt al Maru'i, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least 13 assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of six related attacks in Al Hudaydah on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/06/2020: Assailants attacked military positions in Jabaliya, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. This was one of six related attacks in Al Hudaydah on this date. At least 12 assailants were killed between this incident and a later attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/06/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Sasobai, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a bus transporting civilians along the N1 between Muxungue and Mutindir in Chibabava district, Sofala, Mozambique. At least five civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Renamo Military Junta.

10/06/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely while being planted in a military vehicle in Mukha, Taizz, Yemen. The assailant was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/06/2020: Assailants shelled a residential area of Battar, Ad Dali, Yemen. No casualties were reported, though property was damaged in the attack. 10/06/2020: Assailants shelled a residential area of Hajar, Ad Dali, Yemen. No casualties were reported, though property was damaged in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks in Ad Dali on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
10/06/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed the bodyguard of the deputy governor at a market in Seiyun, Hadramawt, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/06/2020: Assailants abducted 20 villagers at a market in Farabougou, Segou, Mali. One person was killed and 10 people were released a short time later. The fate of the remaining nine hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/07/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a Humvee carrying the district governor, Sayid Sharif Pacha, in Anda Kori, Laghman, Afghanistan. Pacha and two police officers were killed, and two others were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/07/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Ibrahim Manda, Zabul, Afghanistan. Al least three police officers were killed and two other police officers were wounded during the incident. 10/07/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Khisha Chena, Kapisa, Afghanistan. Three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/07/2020: Assailants attacked Nahr-e-Aab, Takhar, Afghanistan. One pro-government militia member and one civilian were killed during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/07/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying soldiers in Chashma Sher, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Four soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military in Basra, Balcad district, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. At least six soldiers were killed and three others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/07/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a religious figure in Fasel, Zharay, Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/07/2020: Security forces intercepted a suicide bomber driving an explosives-laden vehicle towards a border police checkpoint in Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. 10/05/2020: Assailants detonated explosives in a tunnel under a security outpost in Khas Uruzgan District, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. 10/08/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed two pro-government militia members in Jabbar-e-Shahid , Jawzjan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/08/2020: Assailants abducted three children in Haut-Mbomou, Central African Republic. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Lord's Resistance Army (LRA).

Authorities arrested the individual and noted that he carried out the attack "in order to demonstrate his disregard for the activities of law enforcement agencies."

10/08/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Anabig, Faryab, Afghanistan. Eight assailants were killed and one civilian and five assailants were wounded in the ensuing clash with police forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/08/2020: Assailants attacked a peace and mediation committee (PMC) meeting in Sanguli-Labaldo, Saboba district, Northern, Ghana. One person was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/08/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Darqad district, Takhar, Afghanistan. Security forces repelled the attack, killing five assailants and injuring five other assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/08/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Arjun Yadev, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader, in Haripur, Uttar Pradesh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a bus in Sarayek, Herat, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were killed and 13 other civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/09/2020: An explosive device detonated killing a civilian in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants shot and killed an Iraqi refugee in Al-Hawl refugee camp, In Al-Hawl, Al Hasakah, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). Sources noted the victims may have been targeted for cooperating with security forces.

summary: 10/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle near Abu Fishkah, Mosul district, Nineveh, Iraq. A child was killed and her two parents were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Suleiman Al-Osman, a tribal elder, in Sabha, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. Al-Osman was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/09/2020: Assailants opened fire and injured Mohammad Younes, the district police chief, in Pashtun Zarghun district, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: An explosive device detonated against a police Humvee in Nahri Saraj district, Helmand, Afghanistan. Three police officers, including the deputy district police chief and two bodyguards, were killed and two officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: A magnetic mine detonated targeting a Afghan Local Police (ALP) district commander in Garmsir district, Helmand, Afghanistan. The commander was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on passenger buses between Asosa in Asosa district and Gilgel Beles in Metekel district, Benishangul-Gumuz, Ethiopia. At least 14 passengers, including a Chinese national, and 14 assailants were killed in the attack and resulting clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: An explosive device detonated against civilians in Telam, Chhattisgarh, India. Two people were injured in the blast, and one of the victims was taken hostage by assailants. Security forces rescued the hostage approximately 12 hours later. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Maoists.

10/09/2020: Assailants intercepted an assailant planting an explosive device in Telam, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties, and the assailant was arrested. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Maoists.

10/09/2020: Assailants attacked a DDT Construction compound in Dagupan, Cagayan, Philippines. No casualties were reported, but three guards were briefly held hostage during the attack and later released. In addition, bunkhouses and construction equipment was set on fire during the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices planted along a hill in Porahat forest, West Singhbhum district, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

10/09/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a military patrol in Ladha, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: Assailants stopped and opened fire on the vehicle of Ekow Quansah Hayford, a member of parliament (MP), on the road between Dominase and Mankesim in Mfantsiman district, Central, Ghana. Two people, including Hayford and his driver, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/08/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Aliabad district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least four government forces were killed and another four were wounded in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. In addition, four government forces were abducted, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed an Iraqi refugee in Al-Hawl refugee camp, in Al-Hawl, Al Hasakah, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). Sources noted the victims may have been targeted for cooperating with security forces.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/09/2020: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Eku, Delta, Nigeria. One police officer and a civilian were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a newly constructed school building in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Qaysar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least four soldiers and 23 assailants were killed and 13 other assailants were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on a teacher protection team convoy in Bang Kao, Sai Buri district, Pattani, Thailand. Two security force members were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in this area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces responding to an earlier attack in Bang Kao, Sai Buri district, Pattani, Thailand. One ranger volunteer was killed and three others were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks that occurred in this area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/09/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused and explosive device in Bubhanbhat, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Naresh Tyagi, the brother-in-law of a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA and a former BJP minister, in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/09/2020: Assailants set fire to forestry equipment in Angol, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the attack, leaving behind flyers that contained messages of support for their cause. Sources noted writings left at the scene also contained messages alluding to calls for freedom of Mapuche prisoners.

10/09/2020: An assailant set fire to hay bales emblazoned with a pro-Biden message at Holiday Brook Farm along North street in Dalton, Massachusetts, United States. No casualties were reported. Lonnie Durfee, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and "expressed support for law enforcement, anger at news organizations that he said 'keep lieing [sic]' about Trump, and said Black people have more 'rights than us'." Sources also noted that Durfee had photos on his phone that showed him standing by a burning Black Lives Matter sign.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Puli Khumri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Three soldiers were killed and four soldiers were wounded during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Alamkhil, Balkh, Afghanistan. Four police officers were killed, two police officers were injured, and seven police officers were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. Assailants captured the base and seized all weapons and equipment. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: A roadside explosive device targeting a passenger bus in Muhajer Bazaar, Helmand, Afghanistan. Five civilians were killed and nine other civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Sandoq Sai, Kunduz, Afghanistan. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least seven police officers were killed and a Humvee was destroyed during the incident. Four police officers were also abducted, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Two roadside explosive devices detonated and assailants opened fire targeting a military convoy in Balghali, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least 10 soldiers and three civilians were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked security posts over several days in Nawa-i-Barakzayi district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of four related attacks in Helmand on this date. At least 30 people, including four security personnel and 26 assailants, were killed while 12 others, including eight security personnel and four assailants, were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked security posts over several days in Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of four related attacks in Helmand on this date. At least 30 people, including four security personnel and 26 assailants, were killed while 12 others, including eight security personnel and four assailants, were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked security forces over several days in Babaji, Helmand , Afghanistan. This was one of four related attacks in Helmand on this date. At least 30 people, including four security personnel and 26 assailants, were killed while 12 others, including eight security personnel and four assailants, were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Farabougou, Segou, Mali. At least nine civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

10/10/2020: Assailants fired rockets targeting a security post in Shawal, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two soldiers were killed and three other soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy of Iraqi trucks transporting international coalition equipment on the highway between Samawah and Diwaniyah, Muthanna, Iraq. There were no reported casualties, but one vehicle was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Maulana Adil Khan, a religious scholar and head of the Jamia Farooqia seminary, in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. Khan and his driver were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on an environmental patrol guard post in Virunga National Park in Sarambwe, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One guard was killed in the attack. This was one of two attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR).
gname: Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR)

summary: 10/10/2020: Gunmen looted villages in North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of two attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR).
gname: Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR)

summary: 10/10/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at an Assam Rifles camp in Purana Bazaar neighborhood, Dimapur, Nagaland, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on a civilian vehicle along kpareke- Agbudu-Agaga road in Koton-Karfe district, Kogi, Nigeria. Seven people were killed and an unknown number of others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked National Uprising security posts in Adraskan district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least 12 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked security posts over several days in Nahri Saraj district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of four related attacks in Helmand on this date. At least 30 people, including four security personnel and 26 assailants, were killed while 12 others, including eight security personnel and four assailants, were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Maqbil Dara, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least 15 assailants and one police officer were killed and three officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked National Uprising Movement (NUM) checkpoints in Howz, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported, though 20 NUM personnel surrendered to the assailants and joined their ranks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: An assailant threw two incendiary devices at a Planned Parenthood center in Fort Myers, Florida, United States. There were no reported casualties, but the building was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, assailants arrested an individual in connection with the attack.
10/10/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a retired Afghan National Army (ANA) officer in Farah, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: An explosive device detonated inside a civilian residence in Qatiya, near Beir al-Abd, North Sinai, Egypt. At least two people were killed and one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.

summary: 10/10/2020: An explosive device detonated outside a civilian residence in Ganayen, near Beir al-Abd, North Sinai, Egypt. At least two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 10/10/2020: Assailants attempted to attack security posts in Shrin Tagab, Faryab, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed and six other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on the police substation in Ercilla, Araucania, Chile. One police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked Maduri Bheemeshwara Rao at in his home in Alubaka, Telangana, India. Rao, a Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) party worker and fertilizer store owner, was taken from his house before being stabbed and killed a short time later. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Rao worked with police and charged too much for fertilizer. Sources also stated that the victim refused to pay extortion payments to the group.

10/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on a joint fact-finding team (TGPF) in Mamba, Papua, Indonesia. At least two members of the group, including a soldier and a university lecturer, were injured in the attack. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in opposition of a Jakarta-sanctioned investigation into the killing of Pastor Yeremia Zamambani.

10/10/2020: Assailants hurled grenades at a petrol pump in Mayengbam Leikai, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Khaplang (NSCN-K).

10/11/2020: Assailants shot and killed Reymond Fat, a Civilian Active Auxiliary (CAA) member, in Hinakpan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA).

10/10/2020: An explosive device detonated near Al-Malikiyah, Al Hasakah, Syria. Three civilians were killed and another four were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: Assailants raided a World Food Programme (WFP) truck in Gbadengue, Ouham, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to an Anti-Balaka militia.

10/11/2020: Assailants attacked a National Directorate of Security (NDS) compound in Ghoryan District, Herat, Afghanistan. Two NDS members were killed and three others were injured during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/11/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Gorgorak, Baghlan, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed and six soldiers were injured during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/11/2020: Assailants attacked a security forces convoy in Barakhanah, Ghor, Afghanistan. One pro-government militia member and eight assailants were killed and three police officers and six assailants were injured during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/11/2020: Assailants attacked outposts in Londiana, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Five police officers and 16 assailants were killed and 10 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/11/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Tapa-e-Zyarat, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Four police officers were killed and the outpost and all weapons were captured by assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/00/2020: Sometime between October 9, 2020 and October 12, 2020, assailants raided Pangane, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least seven people, including two soldiers, were killed and 60 people were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two related attacks on villages at this time. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Muslim extremists.

10/00/2020: Sometime between October 9, 2020 and October 12, 2020, assailants raided Nambo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least three people were killed and two were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two related attacks on villages at this time. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Muslim extremists.

10/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an army vehicle in Suruj, Mosul district, Nineveh, Iraq. Two soldiers and an officer were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/11/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted along a road in Balang area, Jharbeda, Odisha, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists and stated that the device was intended to target security personnel.

10/11/2020: Assailants launched a remote-controlled explosives-laden drone targeting Najran, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as the drone was intercepted by coalition defense forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/11/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an unknown number of explosive devices in Iqtiya, near Beir al-Abd, North Sinai, Egypt. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.

summary: 10/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle outside a restaurant in Mukha, Taizz, Yemen. Three civilian bystanders were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/11/2020: Explosive devices detonated as assailants were attempting to plant them at a market in Fakher, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least five assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/11/2020: Assailants shelled a health center in Shujayrah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least two people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. The mortars also damaged nearby houses. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/11/2020: Assailants abducted six Shia pilgrims traveling back from visiting Iran’s holy shrines as they crossed the border into Panjgur district, Balochistan, Pakistan. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/11/2020: Assailants, including a suicide bomber, attacked a police base in Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers and three assailants, including the suicide bomber, were killed and 16 police officers were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/12/2020: Assailants shot and killed Roger Alibiado, a Navy reservist, in Datag, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/12/2020: Assailants attacked Dashti Archi district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed and three soldiers were wounded during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/12/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Dahan-e-Larkhabi, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Four police officers and one assailant were killed and two police officers were injured during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/12/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Yangi Qala, Takhar, Afghanistan. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least three police officers were killed and four officers were injured in the ensuing clash. Assailants also seized a Humvee. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/12/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Qarchaghi, Badghis, Afghanistan. One police officer and two assailants were killed and one officer was injured during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/12/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a religious scholar in the Fourth Police District of Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/12/2020: Assailants attacked Malian armed forces in Socoura, Mopti, Mali. At least nine soldiers were killed and four others were injured in the attack. This was one of two attacks that occurred within 24 hours in this area. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Turkish military convoy in Kafrayah, Idlib, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Ansar Abi Bakr al-Siddiq Squadron claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/12/2020: Assailants armed with knives attacked farmers in Ngwom, 14km north of Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. At least 14 people were killed and one other was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

10/12/2020: Assailants set fire to forests in Hatay, Turkey. At least 10 people were injured as the fire spread damaging a large amount of area and forcing mass evacuations before it was put out 33 hours later. The Children of the Fire Initiative claimed responsibility for the incident, but sources doubted the veracity of this claim. Sources also attributed the incident to the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK); though the group denies involvement.
gname: The Children of the Fire Initiative

summary: 10/12/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Qatiya, near Beir al-Abd, North Sinai, Egypt. At least four people were killed and one other was wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 10/12/2020: Assailants attacked an electrical substation in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. The assailants stole equipment, set fire to the station, and abducted 20 employees in the assault. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/12/2020: An explosive device detonated after a Southern Border Provinces Administration Centre (SBPAC) ran over it in Tue Ngo village, Si Sakhon district, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2020: Assailants threw grenades at the residence of Jalalaqsi mayor Mohamed Nur in Jalalaqsi town, Hiiraan, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

10/10/2020: Assailants attacked a police station in Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan, Somalia. At least two assailants were killed and several assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

10/12/2020: A remote-controlled explosive device detonated targeting a security patrol in Mirali, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/12/2020: Assailants opened fire on a convoy of barangay councilors in Bahay, Samar, Philippines. At least two people were killed and five were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/12/2020: An explosive device detonated in the first security district of Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. Six civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/12/2020: An assailant opened fire on the Banski dvori in St. Mark’s Square, Zagreb, Croatia. One police officer was wounded in the attack. The assailant, identified later as Danijel Bezuk, committed suicide shortly after fleeing the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suggested that Bezuk had anti-government and anti-Serb sympathies, demonstrating support for the Far-Right nationalist Croatian Party of Rights’ (HSP) paramilitary wing of the Croatian Defence Forces (HOS).

10/12/2020: Assailants attacked a Philippine National Police Regional Mobile Force Battalion-7 base in Hinakpan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA).

10/12/2020: Assailants planted an explosive device intended to target security forces in Loy Karez, Kandahar, Afghanistan. However, the device detonated against a Taliban vehicle, killing 10 assailants and injuring five assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Taliban.

10/12/2020: Assailants fired a mortar into Shorabi Qeshlaq, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Five civilians were killed and seven civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/12/2020: Assailants opened fire on Fredy Guetio in Aguaclara, Cauca, Colombia. Guetio, a former indigenous governor, and his wife were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/13/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Aryaan, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. Two officers were killed during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/13/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated after a donkey stepped on it in Sang Atesh, Badghis, Afghanistan. One child was killed and another child was injured during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/13/2020: Assailants fired mortars on a residential area in Mirzakah, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least three people, including a tribal elder and a district administrative chief, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/13/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a civil activist in the Third Police District of Jalalabad, Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/13/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on Malian armed forces responding to an earlier attack in Paroukou, Mopti, Mali. At least 12 people, including three soldiers and nine assailants, were killed and 10 other soldiers were injured in the attack. An unknown number of soldiers were also reported missing. This was one of two related attacks that occurred in this area over a 24 hour period. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/13/2020: Assailants attacked a bus in Bandiagara, Mopti, Mali. At least 13 people, including civilians and soldiers, were killed and 20 others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

10/13/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a liquor store in Karada, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two incidents involving explosive devices in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/13/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in Karada, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no casualties in the blast. This was one of two incidents involving explosive devices in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/13/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Musayi district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/14/2020: Assailants attacked three National League for Democracy (NLD) candidates campaigning in Phaung Kha, Taungup township, Rakhine, Myanmar. At least 10 people were beaten and three candidates were abducted in the assault. The hostage was released on January 1, 2021. The Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they would release the victims if student protesters, ethnic Rakhine politicians, and other political prisoners affiliated with the AA were released by the government. The AA also called the victims "crooked" and "Burmese puppets and traitors." They further accused the victims of "disturbing the revolution and collaborating with the Myanmar army to commit torture and killings against civilians."

10/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on Adejo Akowe, a former local government area chairperson, in Anyigba, Kogi, Nigeria. The victim died of his wounds on October 17, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/13/2020: Assailants attacked Paul Okpanku, a former chairperson, along Enugu –Port Harcourt expressway, Isiala Ngwa South Local Government, Abia, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/16/2020: An assailant armed with a knife attacked and beheaded a teacher, identified as Samuel Paty, outside of a school in Conflans Sainte Honorine suburb, Paris, France. The assailant was shot and killed by security forces shortly after the attack. Abdoulakh Anzorov, and unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "From Abdullah, the servant of Allah, to Macron, the leader of the infidels, I executed one of your hell dogs who dared to belittle Muhammad" in reference to the victim, Samuel Paty, who showed cartoons of the Prophet Mohammed in his classroom. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) praised the incident and took responsibility for inspiring Anzorov to carrying out the attack, referring to him as a martyr with the name "Abdallah al-Shishani."

The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/17/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Dwablola, Imam Sahib district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of five related incidents targeting security posts in Imam Sahib district overnight. At least 14 assailants were killed and injured across three of the attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/18/2020: A bomb attached to a military vehicle detonated in Belak Hai Hawayee, Kabul, Afghanistan. One security forces member was killed and three security forces members were injured during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/18/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated in Deh Rahwood district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/18/2020: Assailants fired a mortar targeting a civilian residence in Deh Rahwood District, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and two civilians were injured during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/18/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated in Kushk District, Herat, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and one civilian was wounded during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/18/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive-laden vehicle targeting a police headquarters and government ministries in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 16 people were killed and 155 people were injured in the blast; the victims included police officers and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/18/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Balkh District, Balkh, Afghanistan. One local police commander was killed during the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/18/2020: An explosive device detonated against a military vehicle escorting a senior military official between Biyo Cadde and El-Baraf villages, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. At least four soldiers were killed and an unknown number of other soldiers were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

10/18/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) patrol in a market in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. A police officer and a civilian were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/18/2020: Assailants detonated explosives targeting a bridge in Farabougou, Segou, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

10/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on a civilian vehicle near Shukir, Dibis district, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least three civilians were killed and the vehicle was set on fire in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

No casualties were reported, though the residence and other property was set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 10/18/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Iraqi Federal Police vehicle in Fatha, Kirkuk, Iraq. A police commander and a member of his security detail were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

There were an unknown number of assailant casualties as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

At least eight assailants were killed and six assailants were injured as security and uprising forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/18/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Kilagai, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least seven assailants were killed and eight assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Shkumbrin Kajtazi, a journalist for Reporteri, in southern Mitrovica, Kosovo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/18/2020: Assailants attacked Ntapuala village, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least two civilians were killed and two were injured in the attack. The assailants also set fire to houses during the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/18/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian in Pauk Nay neighborhood, Namkham, Shan, Myanmar. The hostage was released on October 19, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Ta'ang National Liberation Army (TNLA).

10/18/2020: Assailants armed with rocket propelled grenades attacked a police camp along Mandera-Lafey Road in Sheikh Barrow, Mandera, Kenya. Three police officers were wounded in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on Amhara civilians in Gura Feda subdistrict, Bench Sheko district, Southern Nations, Ethiopia. At least 19 civilians were killed and five others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/18/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Bayt al-Yazidi, Ad Dali, Yemen. An unknown number of civilians were killed and an unknown number of civilians were kidnapped in the attack. The outcome of the hostage taking is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah). Sources noted that the victims were targeted for refusing to join the ranks of the group.

10/18/2020: An assailant set fire to a ballot drop box along Baldwin Park boulevard in Baldwin Park, California, United States. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/18/2020: Assailants attacked a police security post in Dawran, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least 29 assailants were killed and four police officers and 12 assailants were wounded in the attack and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/18/2020: Assailants attempted to attack Shorabak district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in Kandahar on this day. At least 28 assailants were killed and 20 assailants were wounded between the two attacks and ensuing clashes with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/18/2020: Assailants attempted to attack Takhta Pul, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in Kandahar on this day. At least 28 assailants were killed and 20 assailants were wounded between the two attacks and ensuing clashes with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/19/2020: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Deh Rahwod District, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and four police officers were wounded during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

Two people, including Zazai and a bodyguard, were killed and one other person, a local leader, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. At least six soldiers and eight assailants were killed and four soldiers were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2020: Assailants abducted Reverend Polycarp Zango in Gombe, Plateau, Nigeria. The hostage was released on October 30, 2020. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/19/2020: Assailants shot and killed Mohammad Ashraf Bhat, a police officer, in Kanelwan, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of Salem Thamir in Awfi, Hillah district, Babil, Iraq. Thamir, a Hikma Movement Member of Parliament, was not harmed, though his nephew was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least four soldiers were killed and an unknown number of others were wounded in the attack. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2020: Assailants set fire to 10 vehicles at a construction site between Arki and Bandhgaon, Bandhgaon, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack.
