10/19/2020: Assailants opened fire and injured Ali Jan Yudek, a Turkish Red Crescent aid worker, in Aden, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/19/2020: Security forces seized an explosives-laden rickshaw in Qarghayi district, Laghman, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2020: Assailants intercepted 10 vehicles and abducted an unknown number of people along Maiduguri-Damaturu road in Jakana subdistrict, Konduga district, Borno, Nigeria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

10/19/2020: Assailants attacked Koko, Macomia district, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least one person was kidnapped and several residences were set on fire during the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2020: Assailants attacked Sixth Giants Brigade positions in At Tuhayta district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least six assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/19/2020: Security forces intercepted an assailant planting an explosive device along a road near Mahdia, Kirkuk, Iraq. The assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and stated that the device was intended to target a security convoy.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/19/2020: Assailants attacked an army patrol in Ismail Qashlaq, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. At least six soldiers and eight assailants were killed and four soldiers were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2020: An assailant rammed his SUV into the vehicle of David Lopez-Zuniga, an air conditioning repair worker, in Houston, Texas, United States. The assailant briefly held Lopez-Zuniga at gunpoint while searching his truck and there were no reported casualties in the assault. Mark Anthony Aguirre was arrested and confessed to carrying out the attack, stating that he surveilled the Lopez-Zuniga for four days on the grounds of an unsubstantiated accusation that he had 750,000 fraudulent ballots for the 2020 United States General Election in his truck. A private group called "Liberty Center for God and Country" paid Aguirre more than $260,000 to carry out the incident.
10/20/2020: Assailants killed a soldier in Chishti Sharif district, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/20/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated in the center of Kang District, Nimroz, Afghanistan. Seven police officers, including a district police chief, were killed during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/20/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a security force Humvee in Kang District, Nimroz, Afghanistan. Five security force members were killed and two security force members were wounded during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/20/2020: Assailants detonated a roadside bomb targeting a minibus in Ab Basragh, Wardak, Afghanistan. This was one of two related blasts targeting vehicles within a short period of time. At least five civilians were killed and another nine civilians were injured during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/20/2020: Assailants attacked a military base near Kangbayi central prison in Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties, however over 1,000 prisoners were freed in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in this area on this day. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that it was carried out as a part of its "Answer the Call" campaign. Sources also attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 10/20/2020: Assailants threw incendiary devices targeting the office of the Iraqi Turkmen Front in Altun Kupri, Dibis district, Kirkuk, Iraq. No casualties were reported, though the building was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

10/20/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in a car park in Manbij, Aleppo, Syria. At least five civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/20/2020: Assailants abducted Mohamed Baiyu, the head of the Libyan Media Foundation, in Tripoli, Libya. The hostage was released shortly after the abduction. The Tripoli Revolutionaries Battalion claimed responsibility for the incident in a call to the victim prior to the attack.

This was one of five attacks in this area on this day No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

Two soldiers were killed across all four incidents. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

Two soldiers were killed across all four incidents. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

Sources also noted that the victims were part of the Bani Kaab tribe, which is involved in the fight against ISIL.

The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was part of their broader "Answer the Call" campaign, which aims to increase attacks globally. Sources also noted that the victims were part of the Bani Kaab tribe, which is involved in the fight against ISIL.

summary: 10/27/2020: An explosive device detonated along a road leading to the site of an earlier attack in Khaylaniyah village, Muqdadiyah district, Diyala, Iraq. Two people were killed and two were injured in the blast. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the area on the same day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was part of their broader "Answer the Call" campaign, which aims to increase attacks globally. Sources also noted that the victims were part of the Bani Kaab tribe, which is involved in the fight against ISIL.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/27/2020: Security forces discovered and defused several explosive devices planted between Manjari and Parsa, Imamganj, Bihar, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists.

10/27/2020:: Assailants attacked a security forces checkpoint in Qalat, Zabul, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed and two were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/27/2020: Assailants shelled military positions in Dadikh, Idlib, Syria. This was one of seven related attacks targeting military positions across Syria carried out by the same assailants on this date. At least 12 soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured across all of the attacks. The National Liberation Front (NLF-Syria) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was in retaliation for a Russian airstrike that had targeted a Faylaq Al-Sham training camp the previous day. Sources also attributed the attack to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

10/27/2020: Security forces intercepted an explosive-laden drone targeting Abha airport in Abha, Asir, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/27/2020: Gunmen opened fire on Linkhae District General Administration Department officials returning from distributing polling materials in Mongpan, between Huay Zwe and Ner Won, Shan, Myanmar. Two officials were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
10/27/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military kit near a qat market in Mukha, Taizz, Yemen. One soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 10/27/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in the center of Dawlatabad District, Faryab, Afghanistan. Three assailants were killed and two were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Faryab on the same night. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/27/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in the center of Qaysar District, Faryab, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed and another was injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Faryab on the same night. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/27/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated in Arzlik, Faryab, Afghanistan. Two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/28/2020: Assailants ambushed a security force patrol in the Fourth Police District, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Three pro-government militia members were killed during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/28/2020: Assailants opened fire on police officers at a bazaar in Aliabad district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and their rifles were stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/28/2020: A sniper opened fire and killed a tailor who refused to close their business in Qaysar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/28/2020: In an insider attack, assailants killed three pro-government militia members and stole equipment in Chahar Bolak, Balkh, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/28/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a rickshaw in Sarwar Karez, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least four civilians, including three children, were killed and another civilian was wounded during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/28/2020: Assailants attacked civilians and burned down a church in Baeti, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 18 civilians were killed in the attack. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

summary: 10/27/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Band-e Baba, Herat, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two bombings targeting police in Herat on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/27/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting police officers along the Herat-Torghundi highway in Injil district, Herat, Afghanistan. Four police officers were wounded in the blast. This was one of two bombings targeting police in Herat on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/27/2020: Assailants shot and killed Ibrahim Alow, a local administrator, in Kahda neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
10/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a tractor in Haml, Khalis district, Diyala, Iraq. At least one farmer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/28/2020: Assailants opened fire on a soldier in Hasawiyah, Muqdadiyah district, Diyala, Iraq. The soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/28/2020: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices planted under a bridge along Baluganj Baranda road in Dhibra, Bihar, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists and suspected that the devices were intended to target security forces during elections in Bihar.

10/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Spin Wam, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least 2 soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/28/2020: An explosive device detonated in Buhriz, Muqdadiyah district, Diyala, Iraq. A farmer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the Kurdistan Region-Ceyhan pipeline in Mardin, Turkey. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian residence in Asifrah, Taizz, Yemen. No casualties were reported. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian residence in Asifrah, Taizz, Yemen. No casualties were reported. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/28/2020: Security forces intercepted a missile targeting Jazan, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three coordinated missile attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/28/2020: Security forces intercepted a missile targeting Najran, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three coordinated missile attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/28/2020: Security forces intercepted a missile targeting Khamis Mushayt, Asir, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three coordinated missile attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/28/2020: Assailants attacked a National Uprising Movement checkpost in Mirakhel, Kapisa, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/28/2020: Gunmen opened fire on a police post in Ado district, Benue, Nigeria. A police officer and a civilian were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

10/28/2020: An assailant threw an incendiary device into a police department’s traffic police building in Mazyr, Gomel, Belarus. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/28/2020: Assailants physically assaulted workers and set fire to forestry equipment between Lumaco and Carahue, Araucania, Chile. Two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2020: An assailant armed with a knife attacked and injured a guard of the French consulate in Jeddah, Makkah, Saudi Arabia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested an individual in connection with the attack.

10/29/2020: An assailant armed with a knife attacked civilians outside the Notre-Dame de L’Assomption Basilica in Nice, Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, France. Three people were killed in the attack, and the assailant was shot and injured before being arrested by police. Al-Mahdi in Southern Tunisia claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for caricatures of the Prophet Mohammed. The group stated that they provided training for and prepared the assailant, Brahim Aouissaoui. Authorities stated that they found photos linked to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) on Aouissaoui's phone, along with a recording in which he describes France as "a country of unbelievers." There were also photos of the perpetrator of the attack that killed Samuel Paty on October 16, 2020.

10/29/2020: An assailant armed with a gun attempted to attack civilians in Avignon, Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, France. Security forces opened fire on the assailant and the assailant was killed. Generation Identity claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Indian Army soldiers in Balakote, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) workers in Yar Khushi Pora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Three workers, including the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) district general secretary, were killed in the attack. The Resistance Front (TRF) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that it was carried out as a warning to those trying to "weaken the resistance or strengthen the occupation." Sources also attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

10/29/2020: Police identified and arrested an assailant armed with a knife attempting to board a train in the 2nd Arrondissement of Lyon, Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes, France. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

10/29/2020: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attempted to attack security forces in Nihm district, Sanaa, Yemen. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/29/2020: Assailants attacked a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) checkpoint in Ghiya, Diyala, Iraq. Two PMF members were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/29/2020: Assailants entered a mosque and opened fire on a police officer in Miran Shah, North Waziristan district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The police officer was killed and an unknown number of people were kidnapped from the mosque. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2020: Assailants attacked security positions in At Tuhayta district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least seven assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/29/2020: Assailants attacked Dimitris Bourantonis and briefly held him hostage in Athens, Greece. Bourantonis, the rector of Athens University of Economics and Business, was not harmed, though his property was damaged in the attack, and released a short time later. Anarchists claimed responsibility for the incident and expressed support for squatting.

10/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying Senator Feliciano Valencia between El Palo and Tacueyo, Cauca, Colombia. Valencia was unharmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 10/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Irama Movil Gamez in 15 de Mayo neighborhood, Riohacha, La Guajira, Colombia. Movil Gamez, a Wayuu indigenous leader and former board of directors candidate for the Regional Autonomous Corporation of La Guajira (Corpoguajira), was not harmed; however, three people, including a bodyguard and two bystanders, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2020: Assailants armed with sharp weapons assaulted civilians near Magunguna, Kajuru district, Kaduna, Nigeria. One person was killed and another person was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

10/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on Plan International aid workers near Pibor, South Sudan. One aid worker was killed and another worker was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Arghandab district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Kandahar on the same day. There was an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clashes that lasted for several days. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2020: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Kandahar on the same day. There was an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clashes that lasted for several days. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2020: Assailants attacked Lissulo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least one person was killed and two people were injured in the assault. Eight people were abducted, and the hostages were released on October 31, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2020: Assailants attacked militia members and civilians in Lisasa, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 21 people were killed in the attack. In addition, an unknown number of people were taken hostage during the assault. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

summary: 10/30/2020: Assailants attacked the provincial police chief in Qorghul, Kapisa, Afghanistan. The assailant was killed and one police officer was injured in the attack. Vitaly Antipov, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and posted a video on social media prior to the attack "asking for jihad" and shouted "Allahu Akbar" during the attack.

10/30/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) member's vehicle in Muqdadiyah district, Diyala, Iraq. The PMF member was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Mapuche activists.

10/30/2020: An explosive device detonated outside the residence of journalist Elidon Ndreka in Balldre, Lezhe, Albania. There were no casualties, but the residence was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2020: Assailants opened fire on a convoy of internally displaced persons (IDP) between Maiduguri and Baga, Borno, Nigeria. 10/31/2020: Assailants shot and killed Hridayesh, a block development committee member, in Khalour, Uttar Pradesh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2020: Assailants attacked a military post in Munira, Mosul district, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

Security forces responded to the attempted attack; killing four assailants and injuring an unknown number of assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

At least four people were killed and ten others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. In addition, seven civilians were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown.  The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Sayed Abdol Hannan Hashemi, an official of the Afghan Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, in Ahmad Shah Baba Mina, Kabul, Afghanistan. Hashemi was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a police checkpoint in Payyan Ab, Herat, Afghanistan. Three police officers were killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Chakhartut, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
11/01/2020: Assailants shot and killed a religious scholar in Guzara district, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/01/2020: An explosive device planted along a road detonated in Bagrami district, Kabul, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2020: Assailants attacked Namacule, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the district on this date. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 11/01/2020: Assailants attacked Namande, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the district on this date. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 11/01/2020: Assailants attacked Nampanha, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the district on this date. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 11/01/2020: An explosive device detonated at a snack bar in in Sector A, Nasr neighborhood, Nasm, Yaounde, Central region, Cameroon. Four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2020: Assailants abducted civilians in Gawa Qanga, Guliso, Oromia, Ethiopia. The hostages were moved to a schoolyard where they were shot and killed. Eleven people were killed in this attack and an unknown number of people injured. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. Additionally, the assailants looted properties and burned down buildings in the area. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oromo Liberation Front and the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF).

11/01/2020: Assailants abducted civilians in Gilla-Gogola, Guliso, Oromia, Ethiopia. The hostages were moved to a schoolyard in Gawa Qanga village where they were shot and killed. Eleven people were killed in this attack and an unknown number of people injured. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. Additionally, the assailants looted properties and burned down buildings in the area. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oromo Liberation Front and the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF).

11/01/2020: Assailants abducted civilians in Seka-Jerbi, Guliso, Oromia, Ethiopia. The hostages were moved to a schoolyard in Gawa Qanga village where they were shot and killed. Ten people were killed in this attack and an unknown number of people injured. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. Additionally, the assailants looted properties and burned down buildings in the area. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oromo Liberation Front and the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF).

11/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on undercover intelligence officers guarding security cameras at Dabka junction, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. Two intelligence officers and one assailant were killed and four others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
10/31/2020: Assailants shelled Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/01/2020: Assailants attacked Lashkar Gah district, Helmand, Afghanistan. The outcome of the ensuing clash is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/01/2020: Assailants attacked Faizabad, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. The outcome of the ensuing clash is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/01/2020: Assailants, armed with firearms, threw a grenade at a bridge construction site in Gumi Eldalo, Guji district, Oromia, Ethiopia. Four construction workers were killed and three workers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oromo Liberation Front.

11/01/2020: Assailants opened fire on villagers in Farabougou, Segou, Mali. At least one soldier was killed in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

11/01/2020: Assailants shot and killed Auberto Riascos, an African-Colombian leader, and Rocio Alomia Mantilla, a local community council member, in El Playon, Lopez de Micay, Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 11/02/2020: Assailants shot and killed a Wardak province military prosecutor in Police District 15, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police Humvee in Kashka, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed and two others were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. Seven civilians were killed and five others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
11/02/2020: A magnetic explosive device detonated in Police District 16, Kabul, Afghanistan. A soldier and a civilian were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2020: An assailant wearing a fake suicide vest opened fire on civilians outside of Seitenstettengasse Temple 4, 1010 Wien, in Vienna, Austria. The assailant continued to open fire on civilians in Salzgries, Fleischmarkt, Bauernmarkt, Graben and, Morzinplatz areas before being shot and killed by police. In addition to the assailant, four people were killed and 22 others were injured in the attack. Kujtim Fejzulai, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL), using the name Abu Dujana al-Albani. Sources noted the Fejzulai was previously arrested for attempting to travel to Syria to join the group. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident, calling Fejzulai a "soldier of the caliphate."

11/02/2020: A suicide bomber detonated, and two assailants stormed and opened fire on Kabul University in Police District 3, Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the three assailants, at least 22 people were killed, 27 people were injured, and an unknown number of students were taken hostage in the ensuing clash that lasted six hours. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident, stating that the attack targeted "the graduation of judges and investigators working for the apostate Afghan government." Sources also attributed the attack to the Haqqani Network and the Taliban, which denied involvement.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 11/02/2020: Assailants attacked civilians taking part in an initiation ceremony in 24 de Marco, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. 20 civilians, including 15 children, were beheaded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/02/2020: Assailants attacked the convoy of Moussa Sanogo, the Budget Minister, near Yamoussoukro city, Yamoussoukro, Ivory Coast. Sanogo was not harmed, but at least one person was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/02/2020: Assailants attacked a convoy of election officials near Abidjan city, Abidjan, Ivory Coast. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpoint in Neknam, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and two others were injured, while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/02/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) base near Dabay, Paktika, Afghanistan. Seven assailants were killed or injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/02/2020: Assailants shot and killed a journalist, Jesus Alfonso Pinuelas, in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, Mexico. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested an individual, identified as Francisco Bernardo N, in connection with the attack.
11/02/2020: An explosives-laden bicycle detonated in Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least four civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2020: An explosive device detonated at a marketplace near Ras al-Ain, Al Hasakah, Syria. At least one civilian was killed and another five were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

11/02/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a French NGO building in Al-Salam area, Khormaksar district, Aden, Adan, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2020: A landmine detonated targeting a military convoy near Mallam Fatori, Borno, Nigeria. At least nine soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/02/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan National Defense and Security Force (ANDSF) positions in Mizan district, Zabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Zabul on the same day. At least seven assailants were killed and three were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/02/2020: Assailants threw a stun grenade into a liquor store in Zayuna neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties, but the grenade started a fire and damaged the store. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces on Pole Charkhi Road in Bagrami district, Kabul, Afghanistan. Two security personnel were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Chashma Sher, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Two members of the police special forces were killed and another one was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on police and militia forces patrolling an outpost in Qadis district, Badghis, Afghanistan. One police officer and one militia member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/03/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Nahr Sufi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two police officers and four assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. Two police officers and three assailants were also injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/03/2020: Assailants attacked Khanabad district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two pro-government militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/03/2020: Assailants attacked the Presbyterian Primary and Secondary School in Kumbo, North-West, Cameroon. The assailants abducted 11 teachers and 10 students. The students and one teacher were released a short time later, and the remaining teachers were released on November 5, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ambazonian separatists.

11/03/2020: Assailants, including a suicide bomber in an explosives-laden vehicle, attacked an Afghan Border Force (ABF) base in Imam Sahib district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least three security personnel were killed and seven others were injured in the ensuing clash. Three assailants were also killed. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
11/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle in Bandiagara, Mopti, Mali. Eight people were killed and 10 people were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: Four assailants opened fire on Longla Comprehensive College in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/03/2020: Assailants attacked the Ethiopian National Defence Forces (ENDF) Northern Command military posts in Tigray, Ethiopia. Approximately 1000 military officers were kidnapped, including Northern Command Brigadier General Adamneh Mengiste. The officers were freed on December 9, 2020. The Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: Assailants in Afghanistan opened fire on a border post in Manzakai, Balochistan, Pakistan. One Frontier Corps soldier (Fakhr Abbas) was killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: Assailants raided al-Rifai, Homs, Syria. At least 11 people were killed and 15 were injured in the raid. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an Iran-backed militia.

11/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Jason Bergonia Garcia in Lipcan, Abra, Philippines. Garcia, the Lingtan village chair, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) post in Ezekere, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least five soldiers were killed and five additional soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 11/03/2020: An assailant attempted to set multiple fires at a polling station in Willow Street city, Pennsylvania, United States. There were no reported casualties, but voting materials were damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: An assailant opened fire on Jorge Luis Solano at his residence in Miraflores, Ocana, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Solano, a human rights activist, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, Colombian authorities prosecuted the alleged assailant, Jhon Freddy Espinosa Alvarez (el Burro).

11/03/2020: Assailants opened fire on Luis Gonzalo Hincapie, a Community Action Board president, in La Cristalina, El Penol, Antioquia, Colombia. Hincapie was killed and his son was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan National Defense and Security Force (ANDSF) positions in Shahjoy district, Zabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Zabul on the same day. At least seven assailants were killed and three were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/03/2020: Assailants set fire to a farm and opened fire at civilians and military personnel in Arab Suleiman, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/03/2020: Assailants shot and killed a retired Major General for the Ministry of Interior inside of his residence in Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Ali Bajiliyyah, Raqqah, Syria. At least one civilian was killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2020: Assailants attacked a police unit in Al-Mazari, Saladin, Iraq. One police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/03/2020: Assailants attacked army patrol in Pudpud, Iloilo, Philippines. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties.  No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/04/2020: Assailants armed with rockets and firearms attacked a road construction crew near the Iraqi border in Derecik district, Hakkari, Turkey. Three construction workers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

11/04/2020: Two explosive devices detonated and assailants opened fire targeting Peshmerga forces near Chamanke, Dihok, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. The People's Defense Force (HPG) of the Kurdistan Worker's Party (PKK) claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the group was acting in self-defense.

11/04/2020: Assailants attacked a military base and detonated an explosive device in Andar Abi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed and 21 others were injured in the attack. Additionally, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/04/2020: Assailants armed with machetes and firearms attacked Kulu Memorial College in Limbe, South-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties, but students and teachers were held hostage and ordered to strip while assailants set fire to the school. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.
11/04/2020: Assailants kidnapped 8 students from Fundong Town, North-West region, Cameroon. The hostages were released shortly after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Panjwai district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 13 assailants were killed in an ensuing airstrike. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/04/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police officer in Police District 2, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2020: An explosive device detonated in Police District 13, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least two police officers and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2020: An assailant opened fire on an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) checkpoint in Hativa Square, Nablus, West Bank. The assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Bilal Adnan Rawajbeh, a captain in the Palestinian Authority Preventive Security Forces.

11/04/2020: Assailants set fire to a 5G telecommunications mast on Burnham Avenue in Bierley neighborhood, Bradford, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties, but the mast was damaged in the attack. This was one of two related arsons targeting 5G masts in Bradford overnight. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, authorities suspected that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

11/04/2020: Assailants destroyed telecommunications masts in Karo, Mandera, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/04/2020: Security forces arrested five assailants as they were planting explosive devices in Bhadradri Kothagudem district, Telangana, India. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2020: Assailants launched an attack targeting Peshmerga forces protecting an oil well in Chamanke, Dihok, Iraq. Two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK).

11/04/2020: An explosive-laden vehicle detonated next to the local council building in Bab, Aleppo, Syria. One civilian was killed and another civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2020: Assailants fired mortars targeting Jam’a Al-Khair beighborhood in Taizz, Yemen. One child was killed and 5 were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/04/2020: Assailants launched an explosives-laden drone targeting a military base in Jabal Habashy, Taizz, Yemen. Ten soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/04/2020: Assailants set fire to two JCB construction machines in Hazaribagh district, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

11/04/2020: Assailants stopped a vehicle and abducted a musician in La Cantina, Norte de Santander, Colombia. The hostage was released unharmed on November 6, 2020. Los Pelusos of the Popular Liberation Army (EPL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2020: Assailants shot and killed Jainer Cordoba Paz, a former Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) member and his wife in Buga, Valle del Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2020: Assailants shot and killed Abdul Wasi Ghafari, a colonel in the Afghan National Army and the father of a female mayor, in Ahmad Shah Baba Mina, Kabul, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Tarin Kot district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and seven others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Assailants shot and killed a female police officer in Kohsan district, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: An explosive device attached to a pro-government militia vehicle detonated in Police District 1, Mahmud Raqi, Kapisa, Afghanistan. One militia commander was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2020: An explosive device planted along a road detonated in Khuram Wa Sarbagh district, Samangan, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2020: Assailants attacked a memorial ceremony in Aliabad district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Chahar Dara district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Two explosive devices detonated targeting Nazar Gul, a well-known pro-government commander and an anti-Taliban figure, in Sholgara district, Balkh, Afghanistan. Three civilians were killed and 16 security forces were injured in the blasts. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/05/2020: Assailants shot and killed Muhammad Ayub Ahangar, a shopkeeper, inside of his shop in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/05/2020: Assailants shot and injured Muhammad Aslam Wani, a taxi driver, in Wanpora area, Kakapora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Zahra, Diyala, Iraq. At least one civilian was killed and two others were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting police officers responding to the scene of an earlier attack in Zahra, Diyala, Iraq. At least three officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of Durran Ahmed Farah, the Minister of Labor and Social Affairs, in Hodan neighborhood, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. The minister was not harmed, but two bodyguards were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Al-Shabaab.

11/04/2020: Assailants launched an attack targeting an administration official for the state of Puntland in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. Abdinur Mohamed Abdulle, the official, was killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2020: Assailants attacked a J&K Bank branch in Tak Mohalla, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No casualties were reported, though money was stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Badr.

11/05/2020: Assailants set fire to a 5G telecommunications mast on New Cross Street in West Bowling neighborhood, Bradford, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties, but the mast was damaged in the attack. This was one of two related arsons targeting 5G masts in Bradford overnight. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, authorities suspected that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

11/05/2020: Assailants launched an attack targeting Oil Protection Forces officers in Amedi district, Dihok, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK).

11/05/2020: Assailants abducted 7 people, including Cardinal Christian Wihgham Tumi and the formerly exiled king of Nso, Sehm Mbinglo, in Babessi, North-West, Cameroon. Tumi was released the following day while Mbinglo and the remaining hostages were released on November 10, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on Maximo Alcansado Dollano outside his residence in San Agustin, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. Dollano, a Citizen Armed Force Geographical Forces (CAFGU) member, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/05/2020: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of Iasonas Fotilas, a Member of Parliament from the New Democracy party, outside his house in Patras, Western Greece, Greece. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, Fotilas suspected that the attack may have been related to recent student protests against increased campus security following an attack on a rector the week prior.

11/05/2020: Assailants attacked a security patrol in Kachrai, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 22 assailants were killed and seven assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Assailants attacked the district center of Gizab district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least ten assailants were killed and four assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related incidents in Gizab district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Assailants set fire to a prison building in Gizab district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of two related incidents in Gizab district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Assailants dropped an explosive device from a drone targeting a police checkpost in Yasin Camp, Zurmat district, Paktia, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated drone attacks on the same day. Five police officers were injured across the three events. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Assailants dropped an explosive device from a drone targeting a police checkpost in Muzo Camp, Zurmat district, Paktia, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated drone attacks on the same day. Five police officers were injured across the three events. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Assailants dropped an explosive device from a drone targeting a police checkpost in Rohani Baba Camp, Zurmat district, Paktia, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated drone attacks on the same day. Five police officers were injured across the three events. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/05/2020: Authorities arrested two armed individuals who drove from Virginia and parked their vehicle near the Convention Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States. There were no casualties in the incident. Conspiracy-theory extremists claimed responsibility for the incident. They claimed they intended to "straighten things out" in the Convention Center, where votes were being counted for the United States Presidential Election which took place on November 3, 2020. Sources noted that the assailants' possessed ammunition and a lock-picking tool in their vehicle, which was adorned with a QAnon sticker.

11/06/2020: Assailants shot and killed Hernando Ramos, a former Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) member, in La Balastrera, Caldono, Cauca, Colombia. Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victim of being an extortionist.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 11/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a joint patrol of armed civilians and military soldiers in Zaheer village, North Sinai, Egypt. The outcome of the attack is unknown. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/06/2020: Assailants attacked Moudjedje village, Sevare district, Mopti, Mali. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2020: An explosives-laden bicycle detonated in Police District 3, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/06/2020: Assailants attacked a village chief in Liwu La-Malale, South-West, Cameroon. The chief, identified as Molinga Francis Nangoh, was killed and his residence was set on fire during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/06/2020: Assailants attacked Muatide, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least 50 civilians were abducted, taken to a football field, and beheaded during the attack and occupation of the town and surrounding area, which lasted until November 8, 2020. In addition, several houses were set on fire during the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

11/00/2020: Sometime between November 5, 2020 and November 6, 2020, assailants attacked Nanjaba, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least two civilians were beheaded and eight women were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. In addition, several houses were set on fire during the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

11/06/2020: Assailants attacked Napala, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least three people were killed and several houses were set on fire in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

11/06/2020: Assailants set fire to vehicles and trash bins in Galliagh neighborhood, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. When police responded, assailants attacked them with fireworks and masonry. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources stated that the attack had been planned on social media to target police personnel.

11/06/2020: Assailants ambushed civilians in Dande, Kaduna, Nigeria. Four people were killed and another person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

11/06/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting police officers in Police District 10, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and three officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2020: Assailants launched a missile towards Marib, Marib province, Yemen. The missile landed in a courtyard and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/06/2020: Assailants shot and killed Abu Muhammad, a former brigadier general in the Ministry of Interior, along Muhammad al-Qasim road in Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that Muhammad had provided logistical support to protestors at Tahrir Square.

11/06/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Aspakhah, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least five assailants were killed and 10 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/06/2020: Assailants attacked a Counter-Narcotics Police convoy near Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed and three people, including two assailants and one police officer, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a bakery in Sharana, Paktika, Afghanistan. At least two people, including an employee and a soldier, were killed and four people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident. The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted the attack targeted a bakery that supplied bread to the provincial government.

11/06/2020: Assailants attempted to extort civilians in Malkhedi, Madhya Pradesh, India. Security forces responded to the incident, leading to a clash which killed one assailant and injured two other assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

11/06/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Mil78, Farah, Afghanistan. Two people were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Rangers vehicle in Chalerm tambon, Rangae district, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2020: Assailants attacked a church at Padre Feliciano 349 in El Bolson, Rio Negro, Argentina. Assailants attacked a priest, injuring him, vandalized the interior of the church, and took another member of the congregation hostage. The hostage was released hours later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Mapuche activists.

11/05/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed an Iraqi civilian in Al-Hawl camp in Al-Hawl,  Al Hasakah, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and stated that the victim was accused of cooperating with security forces.

11/07/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Qarabagh district, Kabul, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/07/2020: Assailants abducted seven people, including five daughters of Christ Embassy Church pastor Istifanus Tiswan, in Karji Kaduna, Kaduna, Nigeria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

At least two militia members were killed and two were injured in the blast. In addition, seven assailants were killed and four assailants were injured in an ensuing clash and airstrike. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2020: Assailants attacked Kisima, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least seven people, including six civilians and one soldier, were killed and an unknown number of people were reported missing in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
11/07/2020: Assailants threw a grenade targeting a police post in Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/07/2020: Assailants attacked a checkpoint in Masakin, Daraa, Syria. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2020: Assailants set fire to road construction equipment in Surigao City, Surigao del Norte, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA).
11/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a school in Phainuam Buarchep, Mizoram, India. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 11/08/2020: An assailant broke into a house and set fires in the Leschi neighborhood of Seattle, Washington, United States. There were no casualties in the attack, but other property was damaged. This was one of two similar incidents committed by the same assailant on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, police arrested Lisbeth Delacruz-Monegro, an activist with the group Morning March Seattle, at the scene. Delacruz-Monegro admitted to unlawfully entering seven houses, damaging property, and setting fires. It is unclear if there is a connection between Monegro’s activism and these attacks.

11/08/2020: An assailant broke into a house and set fires in the Leschi neighborhood of Seattle, Washington, United States. The assailant was injured in the attack, and other property was damaged. This was one of two similar incidents committed by the same assailant on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, police arrested Lisbeth Delacruz-Monegro, an activist with the group Morning March Seattle, at the scene. summary: 11/08/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Logar, Afghanistan. At least two security forces were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Logar on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/08/2020: Assailants opened fire and threw a grenade at the home of Bismillah Adil Aimaq in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. Aimaq, editor of the local Sadai Ghor radio, was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Central Africa Province of the Islamic State.

summary: 11/09/2020: Assailants, with the support of local Tigrayans, attacked non-Tigrayan ethnic groups in May Cadera, Ethiopia. The attack was initiated as on-going clashes between Tigrayans and Ethiopian armed forces reached Mai Kadera. This was one of two simultaneous attacks in May Cadera on this date. At least 767 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Samri militia and the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF). The TPLF denied their involvement, but acknowledged that associated militia members may have been involved.

11/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a security convoy in Balkana, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least two oil facility guards were killed and six members of the Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/09/2020: Several explosive devices were discovered on public roads and defused in Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents that occurred on the same day. A total of 17 explosive devices were discovered across both attempted attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on three Ethiopian Red Cross Society ambulances in Dansha, Tigray, Ethiopia. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF).

summary: 11/09/2020: Assailants, with the support of local Amharas, attacked ethnic Tigrayans in May Cadera, Tigray, Ethiopia. The attack was organized and initiated as on-going clashes between Tigrayans and Ethiopian armed forces reached May Cadera. Upon the arrival of Ethiopian armed forces, they joined together with the assailants and continued attacking Tigrayan civilians until November 10, 2020. This was one of two simultaneous attacks in May Cadera on this date. At least 767 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fano militias.

summary: 11/11/2020: Assailants attacked a National Defense Forces (NDF) base near Sukhnah, Homs, Syria. This was one of four related attacks in the area on this date. At least 21 security personnel were killed across three of the attacks. In addition, at least one NDF member was abducted and later killed in this attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

11/16/2020: Assailants fired rockets targeting civilian houses in Jarlaq, Faryab, Afghanistan. Five children were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/16/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian in Bokriskan, Arbil, Iraq. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

11/16/2020: Assailants launched an attack targeting a brigade of Iraqi Volunteer Forces in Jurf al-Nasr, Babil, Iraq. One IVF member was killed and another was injured in the ensuing clash. summary: 11/16/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Chainpur, Province 1, Nepal. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

11/16/2020: An explosive device attached to a civilian vehicle detonated in Shibirghan, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. The vehicle's owner was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2020: Assailants abducted two people travelling between Ndunda and Kimoka in South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2020: Assailants armed with firearms and rocket launchers attacked the Pul-e-Kebali outpost in Jurm district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least 11 police officers were killed, 10 officers were wounded, and four were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2020: An explosive device planted along a road detonated against security forces responding to an attack on security checkpoints in Qaramqol district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least five police officers, including police chief Safar Mohammad Bidar, were killed in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/17/2020: An explosive device detonated, and assailants attacked security forces in Kokola, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Seven people, including soldiers and civilians, were killed and one person was injured in the attack. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

summary: 11/17/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Kavuyiri, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 29 people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

11/17/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Qaramqol district, Faryab, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of two related attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/17/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police officer in Shahkas, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Gula Jan Adridi, a police sub-inspector, was killed and his driver (Nawab Afridii) was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2020: Assailants launched rockets targeting the United States Embassy in the Green Zone, Baghdad, Iraq. This was one of three attacks in this area on this date. One child was killed five civilians were injured across the three attacks. Ashab al-Kahf claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attacks were carried out in retaliation for the arrest of three of its members on November 16th.

11/17/2020: A suicide bomber detonated in a restaurant near General Kahiye Police Academy in Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. In addition to the assailant, at least five people were killed and eight were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/17/2020: Security forces discovered and defused explosive devices planted near the Israel-Syria border in Golan Heights, Israel. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2020: Assailants raided a construction site in Peshrar, Jharkhand, India. The assailants set fire to equipment and abducted an employee (Vicky Gupta) in the attack. The hostage was shot and killed a short time later. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident

11/17/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Emirates Red Crescent (ERC) medical team in Yakhlal, Taizz governorate, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2020: Assailants shot down a Nigerien helicopter in Banki, Borno, Nigeria. At least five people were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/17/2020: Assailants attacked Satomi village in Satomi village, Extreme-North, Cameroon. The village traditional leader was killed and an unknown number of his children were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/17/2020: A landmine detonated against a civilian vehicle between Tharyargone and Khayay Myaing, Rakhine, Myanmar. Three civilians were killed and 6 civilians were injured in the blast. 11/17/2020: Assailants launched rockets targeting the United States Embassy which landed at the gate at Al-Zawraa Park, Baghdad, Iraq. This was one of three attacks in this rea on this date. 11/17/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian in Pirde Shal, Arbil, Iraq. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

11/17/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Shamulzayi district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least seven assailants were killed and six were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/17/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Shahjoy district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least one assailant was killed and two were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/17/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Mizan district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least two assailants were killed and two others were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/17/2020: Assailants abducted five internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Bijombo, Uriva, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. 11/18/2020: Assailants threw a grenade targeting a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) bunker in Kakapora town, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The grenade missed the bunker and detonated on a road, injuring 12 civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
