11/18/2020: An explosive device detonated as security forces were attempting to defuse it along a road in Kamarguda village, Sukma, Chhattisgarh, India. One police officer was injured in the blast and three other devices were defused. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

11/19/2020: An explosive device detonated in At Tuhayta district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/18/2020: Assailants attacked Nuristan provincial officials in Darmalok, Kunar, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and four officials, including rural development director Syed Masoum Saeedi, were abducted. Saeedi and his driver were released on November 26, 2020. The whereabouts of the remaining hostages are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/18/2020: Assailants opened fire on a joint police and gendarmerie patrol in Kissem, Bui Division, North-West, Cameroon. Two soldiers and a civilian were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ambazonia Restoration Forces (ARF).

11/18/2020: Assailants launched a mortar which landed in a market in Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and six others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Police District 3, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and 20 others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2020: Assailants attacked Darwaz district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least 28 people, including the police chief and security director, were killed and 30 others were reported missing in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/19/2020: Assailants detonated explosive devices targeting the Arish-Qantara gas pipeline in Sabika, North Sinai, Egypt. There were no reported casualties, but the pipeline was damaged in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 11/19/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost along Baghlan-Parwan highway in Puli Khumri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least four police officers and five assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. In addition, two police officers were taken hostage. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/19/2020: Assailants threw an explosive device from a motorcycle outside the Entree Bonandale restaurant in Bonaberi, Douala, Litoral, Cameroon. Five people, including two assailants, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of Seriake Dickson in Toru Orua, Bayelsa, Nigeria. Dickson, the former Bayelsa state governor, was not harmed as he was not present at the time of the attack. One police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2020: Assailants fired four rockets targeting a residential area in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/19/2020: Assailants stopped trucks and set fire to them along the N3 road between Heidelberg and Vosloorus, Gauteng, South Africa. No casualties were reported but seven trucks were set on fire in the attack. This was one of two related attacks on trucks on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2020: Assailants stopped and set fire to trucks along the R103 road in Gauteng, South Africa. No casualties were reported, though two trucks were set on fire in the attack. This was one of two related attacks on trucks on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2020: Assailants launched an attack targeting villagers in Farabougou, Segou, Mali. Two people were killed in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

11/19/2020: Assailants armed with firearms and an explosive device attacked civilians in Mulangu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least one person was injured and at least three people were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

11/19/2020: Assailants shot and killed Bryan Steven Montes Alvarez, a former Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) member, in El Picudo, Puerto Caicedo, Putumayo, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2020: Assailants attacked civilians during Friday prayers at a mosque in Dutsen Gari, Kano­ma District, Zamfara, Nigeria. At least five people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. Additionally, at least 20 people were abducted and the outcome of the abduction is unknown. 11/20/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device planted near a mosque in Shurat, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2020: A sniper shot and killed a civilian northwest of Taizz, Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/20/2020: Explosive devices attached to a bicycle detonated in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least six civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an oil pipeline in Delta, Nigeria. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. This was one of two attacks targeting pipelines in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting Puntland security forces in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. At least one soldier was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a civilian vehicle in Ataq, Shabwah governorate, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the victim was targeted for their relationship to vice president of the General People's Congress Party.

11/20/2020: An assailant holding a fake grenade took nine people hostage at a MBC microfinance office along Tsereteli avenue in Didube neighborhood, Tbilisi, Georgia. There were no reported casualties and all hostages were released after several hours. Levan Zurabashvili, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded a ban on gambling in Georgia; a seven percent limit on interest rates for bank loans; a decrease on the price of medication; and a cap on pharmaceutical profits.

11/20/2020: Assailants attacked Linzo village, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
11/20/2020: Assailants shot and killed Jhonny Walter Castro, a local leader of the Victims' Committee in San Francisco de Linares, Narino, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2020: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in Police District 11, Kabul, Afghanistan. Three police officers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2020: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle along the Islam Qala-Herat Highway in Hotel Qorak, Herat, Afghanistan. Three civilians were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/21/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of pro-government militia members in Naw Abad, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least two militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/21/2020: An explosive device detonated at a bazaar in Maydan Shahr, Wardak, Afghanistan. At least two civilians were killed and 15 other civilians wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Al-Mashak, Saladin, Iraq. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. summary: 11/21/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Fayzabad district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Five police officers, including a deputy provincial police chief, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/21/2020: Assailants placed an explosive device that failed to explode near the area of Rachel’s tomb in Bethlehem, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident, but police arrested at least one suspect.

11/21/2020: Assailants placed an explosive device that detonated near a vehicle in Qalandiyah, West Bank. There were no casualties in the blast, and a second explosive device was discovered and defused. This was one of two incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident, but police arrested at least two suspects.

11/21/2020: Assailants shot and killed Htike Zaw, a newly elected National League for Democracy (NLD) representative, in Pin Tain village, Shan, Myanmar. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2020: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Pashtun Zarghun district, Herat, Afghanistan. One pro-government militia member was killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2020: Assailants attacked an army post in Dobandi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least four assailants and three soldiers were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/22/2020: Assailants set up a fake road block and opened fire on two vehicles in Al-Sakar, Rutbah district, Al Anbar, Iraq. Three people, including a police officer, were killed and a driver was abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/22/2020: A magnetic explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Hesa-e-Hawal-e-Khair Khana Mina, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2020: A magnetic explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Police District 10, Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a railway track near Mach, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties, but the track was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2020: An explosive device detonated inside of the municipality office in Tapli rural municipality, Udayapur district, Province 1, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. A second explosive device was also discovered and defused at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

11/22/2020: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices planted at the entrance of the Agricultural Development Office in Simkot rural municipality-6, Humla district, Karnali, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2020: Assailants opened fire on a truck driver along the R59 road between Parys and Sasolburg, Fezile Dabi district, Free State, South Africa. The driver was injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in the area overnight. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2020: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices intended to target soldiers in Mughayir village, West Bank. No group claimed responsibility for the attempted attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

11/22/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an army convoy in Hammam al-Alil, Nineveh, Iraq. Five soldiers were killed and four other soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/22/2020: Assailants detonated five explosive devices targeting power pylons in Al-Durban, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/22/2020: Assailants attempted to raid houses in Yegoua locality, Extreme-North, Cameroon. Security forces intervened and there were no reported casualties. This was one of two coordinated attacks overnight. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
11/22/2020: A roadside bomb detonated in Kandahar district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2020: Assailants attacked workers and destroyed crops at a farm in Igbatayo, Akure North district, Ondo State, Nigeria. It is unknown whether any workers were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists and noted that the farm belonged to former Secretary to the Government of Nigeria, SGF, Chief Olu Falae, who had been previously held hostage in 2015.

11/22/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire targeting the home of civil activist, Ammar al-Khazali, in Diwaniyah district, Al Qadisiyah, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: Assailants shot and killed a civilian in Ghazari, Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Taliban was involved in the attack.

11/23/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Khowajasarjo, Nimroz, Afghanistan. At least four police officers were killed and six others were injured in the attack. Additionally, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/23/2020: Assailants fired a missile targeting an Aramco oil facility in the Burayman neighborhood, Jeddah, Makkah, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties in the attack, which resulted in minimal damage to the facility. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to the Saudi-led coalition's military operations and ongoing blockade of Yemen.

11/23/2020: Assailants attacked a ship near Ilha Quifuqui, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Two civilians were killed and two more people were abducted. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).
11/23/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden motorcycle on Band-Khushdil Khan road, Pishin, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were planting it in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/23/2020: Assailants attacked a security post in Hadbakhshi, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Assailants also abducted police officer. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown.  This was one of two attacks in Baghlan on this day. At least 10 assailants and four security force members were killed and 12 assailants and three security force members were injured across both clashes. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: Assailants attacked an army convoy in Baghlani Jadid district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in Baghlan on this day. At least 10 assailants and four security force members were killed and 12 assailants and three security force members were injured across both clashes. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices in Sitio Dasulong, Pikit municipality, North Cotabato, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack as the devices were defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Danab Militia convoy in Leego, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least six Danab Militia members were killed and several others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: Assailants fired three rockets targeting the airport in Bahir Dar, Amhara, Ethiopia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. The Tigray People’s Liberation Front (TPLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: Assailants launched an attack targeting an airport in Aksum, Ethiopia. The number of casualties is unknown. The Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: Assailants attacked Minimakanda village, Bankass, Mopti, Mali. This was one of two related attacks on the same village overnight. At least seven civilians were killed and five were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Muslim or Fulani extremists were involved.

11/25/2020: Assailants raided Gabass village, Extreme-North, Cameroon. Three people were killed and one person was abducted in the raid. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/23/2020: Assailants raided Mstseliya village, Extreme-North, Cameroon. Security forces intervened and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two coordinated attacks overnight. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/23/2020: Assailants attacked a military post in Azim subdistrict, Khalis district, Saladin, Iraq. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/23/2020: Assailants attempted to storm the National Oil Corporation (NOC) headquarters in Tripoli, Libya. There were no reported casualties as the assault was repelled. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/23/2020: Assailants set fire to an apartment in Drumtara area, Ballymena, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: Assailants detonated explosives targeting a Shell Petroleum Development Company (SPDC) gas pipeline near Ikarama, Bayelsa, Nigeria. No casualties were reported, but the pipeline was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Niger Delta extremists carried out the attack.

11/23/2020: Assailants shot and killed Edgar Hernandez, the president of a local community council, and a companion in El Coqueto, Puerto Caicedo, Putumayo, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Panjwayi district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least five assailants were killed and three were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/25/2020: Assailants shot and killed an Afghan Local Police (ALP) commander in Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/24/2020: Two explosive devices detonated at Insaf market along Bazar Road in Bamyan, Afghanistan. At least 17 people were killed and 51 others were injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected the Taliban, which denied involvement.

11/24/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle along a road between At Tuhayta and Khawkhah districts, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Six civilians were killed and 6 were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/24/2020: An explosive device planted in the vehicle of a police chief detonated in Bab district, Aleppo, Syria. At least five people, including the police chief, were killed and 18 others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

11/24/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a boat carrying military personnel near Ngouboua, Lac, Chad. Four soldiers were killed and 16 soldiers were injured in the blast. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated at the Kawa junction in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least two people were killed and 17 others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to  the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

11/24/2020: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated inside a government compound in Khost, Afghanistan. Five people, including guards and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2020: Assailants opened fire at the home of a police colonel in Al-Mazari, Saladin, Iraq. Four people, including the colonel, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/24/2020: An suicide bomber wearing an explosives-laden vest opened fire after being stopped outside the Counter Terrorism Department (CTD) police station in Barki, Punjab, Pakistan. The assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attempted attack.

11/24/2020: Assailants attacked a village in Wajid district, Bakool, Somalia. At least seven civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/24/2020: Two assailants opened fire on Romeo Portes in Bukal, Pagbilao, Quezon, Philippines. Portes, the former Mayor of Pagbilao and father of the incumbent mayor, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2020: An assailant stabbed one civilian and attempted to strangle another at a department store in Lugano, Ticino, Switzerland. Two people were injured in the attack. The assailant, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and shouted slogans in reference to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) during the attack.. Sources also noted that the assailant had previously attempted to travel to Syria to allegedly connect with a Muslim extremist.

11/24/2020: Assailants attempted to set fire to a 5G telecommunications mast on Burnham Avenue in Bierley neighborhood, Bradford, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties as the mast failed to ignite. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/24/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Hazwan, Aleppo, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2020: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of journalist Marina Malkova in Chelyabinsk city, Chelyabinsk, Russia. There were no reported casualties, but the vehicle was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2020: Assailants abducted Maria Guillermina Bello and Manuel Alexis Bello, the mother and brother of former Arauca mayor Luis Emilio Tovar Bello, in Cocoras neighborhood, Arauca city, Arauca, Colombia. Maria Guillermina Bello was released on November 27, 2020, and Manuel Alexis Bello was released on December 12, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/22/2020: Assailants shot and killed Induna Prince Hlabisa, a local traditional leader, in Hlabisa, uMkhanyakude, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2020: Assailants attacked Minimakanda village, Bankass, Mopti, Mali. This was one of two related attacks on the same village overnight. At least seven civilians were killed and five were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Muslim or Fulani extremists were involved.

11/24/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Karma subdistrict, Fallujah district, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least two soldiers and one civilian were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/24/2020: Assailants threw incendiary devices at two trucks in Mpumalanga, South Africa. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/24/2020: Assailants shot and injured Private Nathapol Senamit, an off-duty soldier, along Highway 42 near Ban Pho Moh, Pattani, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/24/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed Aliya Baheni, an assistant village chief, in Khao Tum, San Buri, Pattani, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2020: Assailants attacked Diegi, Gudu district, Sokoto, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

11/24/2020: Assailants attacked and killed Paula Osorio Garcia, a former Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) member, in Atrato district, Choco, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2020: Assailants shot and injured a civilian in Coleraine, Ulster, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the North Antrim Briage of the Ulster Freedom Fighters (UFF).

11/25/2020: Assailants stopped several vehicles and abducted Hazara passengers in Siya Petab, Wardak, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in which 28 people were abducted. The hostages were released on December 1, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/25/2020: Assailants stopped several vehicles and abducted Hazara passengers in Pul-Mehrab, Wardak, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in which 28 people were abducted. The hostages were released on December 1, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/25/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the MT Agrari, a Maltese-flagged, Greek-operated oil tanker, off the coast of Shuqaiq, Jazan, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
11/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military detachment in Boura, Sikasso, Mali. At least one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a police station in Aino Mina, Kandahar, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant’s death, at least 13 police officers and four civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle near Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least five police officers were killed and several others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/25/2020: An assailant drove a car into the gate of the office of German Chancellor Angela Merkel in Berlin, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The assailant claimed responsibility for the incident by writing "stop globalization politics" and "you damn killers of children and old people" on the doors of his vehicle.

11/25/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Afghan National Defense and Security Force (ANDSF) vehicle in Ahmad Shah Baba Mina, Kabul, Afghanistan. Two soldiers and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted near the gate of a charity organization in Police District 3, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted near Mashwani primary school in Mir Bacha Kot district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Yaro Qala, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 15 assailants were killed and four assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on two prominent activists, identified as Akram Azab and Omar Farouk, in al-Talbiya, Baghdad, Iraq. One of the activists was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed that attack to Rab'Allah.

11/25/2020: Assailants attacked Iraqi Volunteer Forces personnel in Mutaybijah, Saladin, Iraq. One assailant was killed as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/25/2020: Assailants raided Guidi village, Extreme-North, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties, but the assailants burnt down five houses and stole clothing. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
11/25/2020: Assailants set fire to two trucks along N12 highway, near Daveyton, Ekurhuleni, Gauteng, South Africa. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2020: Assailants set fire to a truck on R59, near Albertsdal, Gauteng, South Africa. This was one of two related incidents targeting trucks in the area overnight. One driver was shot and injured across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2020: Security forces identified and intercepted assailants attempting to carry out an attack with explosive devices in Taluksangay, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

11/27/2020: Assailants set fire to government constructed Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) housing in Kareto, Borno, Nigeria. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/25/2020: An explosive device detonated in Mahut Subae, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Two children were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/26/2020: Assailants abducted and a short time later killed a Thunderbolt Brigade officer (Jamal Al-Tina Al-Kazami) at the Caltex roundabout in Mansourah neighborhood, Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Islah Party.

11/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on a U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) vehicle in Dombe, Manica, Mozambique. At least three PEPFAR employees were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Renamo Military Junta.

11/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on farmers in Dogofry, Segou, Mali. At least six farmers were killed and three were injured in the attack. In addition, an unknown number of people were reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack Muslim extremists.

11/26/2020: Assailants raided Shilan massage parlor and assaulted workers in Karada, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two migrant women working for the parlor were injured in the attack. Rab'Allah claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that it was their "duty to stand against societal corruption" and to fight against those who are "inspired by the corrupt ideas of America and Israel." The group later denied responsibility for the attack.

11/26/2020: A stun grenade detonated targeting a liquor store in Karada, Baghdad, Iraq. No casualties were reported, though the blast resulted in damage to nearby vehicles. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an Iran-backed militia.

11/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Indian Army convoy in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two soldiers, identified as Sepoy Ratan and Sepoy Deshmukh, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM). Authorities also suspected the involvement of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

11/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle near Mir Ali town, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Four Frontier Works Organization (FWO) construction workers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/26/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted on a car window along Knock Road, Dervock, County Antrim, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. This was one of two similar attacks in or near Dervock on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted on a car window in Glebe Park area, Derrykeighan, outside Dervock, County Antrim, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. This was one of two similar attacks in or near Dervock on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police check point on Bannu-Karak road in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One police official was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/27/2020: Security forces arrested an assailant attempting to plant an explosive device in Dhusamareb, Galguduud, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2020: An explosive device detonated in a stall in Soo Kilo market in Sutnga, Meghalaya, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council (HNLC) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2020: An explosives-laden package, disguised as a present honoring the Chilean police, detonated at 5 Ote. 1140., the Fourth Carabineros police station in Talca, Maule, Chile. Two police were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, police arrested and charged twin brothers for targeting the police station.

11/26/2020: Assailants shot and killed Shah Faisal, a Frontier Reserve Police constable, in Taru Jabba village, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2020: Assailants set fire to a truck on R59, near Albertsdal, Gauteng, South Africa. This was one of two related incidents targeting trucks in the area overnight. One driver was shot and injured across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2020: An assailant armed with a knife attacked a rabbi in Vienna, Austria. The rabbi was wounded in the attack. The assailant, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and sources indicated the assailant shouted anti-Semitic statements at the target.
11/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Ministry of Oil engineer in Baghdad, Iraq. The engineer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2020: Assailants attacked military forces in Sukhnah, Homs, Syria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of a military commander (Brigadier General Farouq Al-Kaalouli) in Al-Buraiqeh, Adan, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Islah Party.

11/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint in Saladin, Iraq. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/26/2020: Assailants hijacked a cargo ship, the Milano 1, with ten crew members on board in the Gulf of Guinea, off the coast of Bayelsa, Nigeria as it was traveling from Escravos, Nigeria to Douala, Cameroon. The ship was released along with two crew members. The rest of the crew was released on December 21, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Reformed Niger Delta Avengers (RNDA).

11/26/2020: Assailants attacked government forces in Namacande, Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

11/27/2020: Assailants armed with firearms and machetes attacked and held hostage Christian civilians at a Salvation Army outpost in Lemban Tongoa, Central Sulawesi, Indonesia. At least four people were killed and several residences and a church were set on fire during the attack. Mujahidin Indonesia Timur (MIT) claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that it was carried out in retaliation for alleged attacks by Christians against Muslims in Indonesia.

11/27/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting residential areas in Asmara, Central, Eritrea. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four rocket attack targeting areas in and around Asmara on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF).

11/27/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting residential areas in Dekemehari town, Southern, Eritrea. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four rocket attack targeting areas in and around Asmara on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF).

11/27/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting residential areas in Gemehalo, Central, Eritrea. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four rocket attack targeting areas in and around Asmara on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF).

11/27/2020: Assailants fired a rocket targeting residential areas in Nefasit, Central, Eritrea. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four rocket attack targeting areas in and around Asmara on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF).

11/27/2020: Assailants armed with firearms, incendiary devices, and disinfectant spray attacked protesters at Habboubi Square in Nasiriyah, Dhi Qar, Iraq. At least four people were killed and 70 others were injured in the attack. The Sadrist Movement claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Popular Mobilization Force patrol in Dawr district, Saladin, Iraq. At least two PMF members were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police post in Lund Khwar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2020: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle in Al-Mahashima area, Al Jawf, Yemen. One civilian was killed and one other was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan National Defense and Security Force (ANDSF) positions in Khogyani district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 12 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/27/2020: An explosive-laden vehicle detonated targeting a Free Syrian Army (FSA) checkpoint in Mabroukah, Al Hasakah, Syria. Two people were killed and another two were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of People's Protection Units (YPG).

Early reports suggested that an unknown number of women and girls were also abducted in the attack, but District Head Zanna Bukar later declared no one from the community was missing. The Shekau faction of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that it was carried out in retaliation for the arrest of Bobo Haram members by farmers who turned them over to the military.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

12/03/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a National Directorate of Security (NDS) patrol in Police District 1, Gardez, Paktia, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least three NDS personnel were killed and 14 civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a nightclub in Abu Nuwas neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast, though there was material damage. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2020: Assailants shelled the Thabit Brothers industrial complex in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Eight people were killed and 7 people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
12/03/2020: An assailant opened fire targeting soldiers in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. Three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2020: Two explosive devices detonated targeting a police patrol in Al-Kubba neighborhood, Al-Abbarah, Diyala, Iraq. At least three police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

12/03/2020: Assailants attacked the town center of Datu Piang, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for "illegal activities" conducted in the town, including the distribution of alcoholic beverages and illegal drugs. Also, sources noted that one of the political officials in the region allegedly hired the services of the assailants to attack the town center to favor his political status. Additionally, local residents stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the arrest of the assailants' family members by the local police. Sources also attributed the attack to the Maute Group.

12/03/2020: Assailants attacked Ttok village in Khanaqin district, Diyala, Iraq. Security forces repelled the assault. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/03/2020: Assailants attacked Ahmed Tahir, Diyala, Iraq. Security forces repelled the assault. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/03/2020: Assailants shot and killed Sikandar, the son of a former city coordinator, in Muslim Ganj, Kamoki, Punjab, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2020: An explosive device was discovered and defused in the brickfield of Former Minister of Manipur, Moirangthem Hemanta, in Khongjom, Manipur, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/03/2020: Assailants shot and injured a civilian in both legs in Downfine Walk, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2020: Four explosive devices detonated targeting a cement factory in Katari, Udayapur, Province 1, Nepal. Five workers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/04/2020: Assailants shot and killed a high court official in Police District 8, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a general store near Crystal Line Bus Stand in Rawalpindi, Punjab, Pakistan. One civilian was killed and seven others were wounded in the blast. A rickshaw parked in front of the store was also damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2020: Assailants attacked outposts of pro-Afghan government local militias in Nazian Darra, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Four pro-government militia members and 10 assailants were killed and four militia members and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Islam (Pakistan).

12/04/2020: Assailants opened fire on an Apni Party candidate in Sagam area, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The candidate, identified as Aneesul Islam Ganaie, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2020: Assailants attacked Ashigashiya, Extreme-North, Cameroon. Three civilians were killed and two people were abducted during the attack. The outcome of kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/04/2020: Assailants blocked a road and attempted to set fire to the vehicle of the Deputy Mayor of Mechinagar Municipality near Dhaijan, Jhapa, Province 1, Nepal. The mayor, Meena Uprety, was not harmed. The Nepal Student Union (NSU) of the Nepali Congress Party (NC) claimed responsibility for the incident, and the assailants claimed to be members of that organization.

12/04/2020: An assailant set fire to the Church of All Nations (Church of Agony), in Jerusalem, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. The fire was quickly extinguished and the assailant was arrested. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources said the assailant was an Israeli settler with extreme right-wing views.

12/04/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated outside a bakery in Jindires, Aleppo, Syria. At least one person was killed and another three people were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/04/2020: Assailants attacked a cargo ship near the port city of Nishtun, Al Mahrah, Yemen. No injuries resulted from this attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2020: Assailants killed the traditional ruler of Wemdeley village in Extreme-North, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
12/05/2020: Assailants shot and killed two police officers and one civilian in Islam Kala, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/05/2020: Assailants attacked a police convoy in Pir Koti, Paktika, Afghanistan. General Eid Mohammad, a local police commander, was killed in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/05/2020: Assailants shot and killed two civilians and a police officer in Wali Muhammadi Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: Assailants established an illegal checkpoint and abducted Jesus Quintana Garcia in Toribio district, Cauca, Colombia. Garcia, a Spanish national and director of the International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT), was released on December 7, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Dagoberto Ramos Mobile Column of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 12/05/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting a police outpost in Sufianzo, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed and five officers were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/05/2020: Assailants attacked a police station in Sheik Barrow, Mandera, Kenya. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Al-Shabaab.

12/04/2020: Assailants attacked a base camp of forestry officials and Nigerien Army soldiers in La Tapoa, Tillaberi, Niger. Two forestry officials were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. In addition, two soldiers were reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Yusufiyah, Babil, Iraq. The driver of the car was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/05/2020: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Sheikh Yahya bin Ali Mohammed Abdulwahab al-Qasem detonated in Ibb, Yemen. Al-Qasem, a tribal elder and General People's Congress party member, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/05/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan National Security Force (ANSF) positions in Kandahar district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/05/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan National Security Force (ANSF) positions in Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/05/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan National Security Force (ANSF) positions in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/05/2020: Two assailants shot and killed Khalid al-Hameidi (Khaled Humaidi), a Dhale University professor and secular thinker, in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of either the al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) or the Lahij Province of the Islamic State. Sources also noted that al-Hameidi was a known critic of Islamic extremists and encouraged mixed-gender activities at the university.

12/05/2020: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle in Baghdad, Iraq. Three activists, identified as Safaa al-Obeidi, Safad al-Nadawi, and Intisar al-Asadi, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/05/2020: Assailants attempted to attack Iraqi Volunteer Forces checkpoints in Al-Fathah, Kirkuk, Iraq. The attack was repelled and did not result in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/05/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Afghan National Army (ANA) vehicle in Gurziwan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/05/2020: Assailants attacked a joint police checkpoint in Karo, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/05/2020: Assailants attacked and killed a police officer in Qarabagh district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/05/2020: Assailants attacked indigenous people in Gualanday, Santander de Quilichao, Cauca, Colombia. At least four people, including a former Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) member were killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 12/05/2020: Assailants abducted and killed a Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) commander in Al-Sejer, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/05/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian in Shahil, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. The hostage was killed later the same day. The Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was a spy.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/06/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Chehel-Gazi, Badghis, Afghanistan. Three police officers were killed, and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Qadis district, Badghis, Afghanistan. Two members of the National Directorate of Security (NDS) were killed and one NDS officer and one police officer were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/06/2020: Assailants shot and killed a prosecutor with the Military Attorney General’s Office in Police District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/06/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Tandorsazi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Five soldiers were killed, and four soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, two soldiers were reported missing and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a joint checkpoint in Sazgaripora, Hawal area, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One police officer and one civilian were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/06/2020: Assailants attempted to attack military positions in Baqim, Saada, Yemen. Security forces identified the assailants prior to the attack, killing 13 assailants and wounding an unknown number of assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a military convoy transporting voters in Momo, North-West, Cameroon. A municipal councilor was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to armed separatists.

12/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a civilian vehicle on the outskirt of Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Two civilians, including a Catholic Priest of the Bamenda Archdiocese and a Seminarian, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/06/2020: Assailants attacked a military camp in Mabanga, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/06/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Security Force (ANSF) security post in Balghor, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the district on the same day. At least 15 assailants were killed and another five were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Security Force (ANSF) security post in Charkh Ab, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the district on the same day. At least 15 assailants were killed and another five were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Security Force (ANSF) security post in Gulbagh, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks in the district on the same day. At least 15 assailants were killed and another five were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.
12/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Mullazai area, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/06/2020: The Afghan National Army (ANA) discovered and safely defused 41 explosive devices which were placed on public roads in Uruzgan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attempted attacks to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: The Afghan National Army (ANA) discovered and safely defused 40 explosive devices which were placed on public roads in Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attempted attacks to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: Assailants opened fire on security checkpoints in Chah Ab district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least three pro-government militia members and four assailants were killed, and one militia member and two assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: Assailants attacked a Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) in South Upi, Maguindanao, Philippines. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

12/06/2020: Security forces discovered and defused nine explosive devices in Latehar, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

12/06/2020: Assailants attacked the district center in Dawlatabad, Faryab, Afghanistan. One National Directorate of Security (NDS) officer was killed, and four others were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants attempted to plant it in Gurziwan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. One assailant was killed, and one other was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Taliban.

12/06/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an unknown number of explosive devices along a road in Alaya area, Mukha, Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
12/06/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Gulgam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/07/2020: Assailants opened fire at Christ of Church polling station targeting the National Democratic Congress (NDC) candidate, Phyllis Koryoo Okunor, in Kasoa, Central, Ghana. Okunor was unharmed, however, two people injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/07/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting an electricity pylon between Qaim and Hadithah, Al Anbar, Iraq. There were no reported casualties, but the pylon was damaged in the blast. This was one of eight related attacks targeting pylons in the area on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was part of a broader effort to attack vital economic targets in Iraq. The group stated that these attacks were intended to pressure the government to deploy security forces to the targeted sites, which would consequently deplete security personnel.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/07/2020: Assailants attacked Security Belt Forces in Abyan, Yemen. Six members were killed in the attack and one was injured. Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) claimed responsibility for the attack.
12/07/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Chendawal, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/07/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting the provincial police headquarters in Daman district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant’s death, at least 33 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/07/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting military personnel in Pashmol, Kandahar, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, one soldier was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/07/2020: Assailants raided Mute, Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Security forces responded to the attack and at least one soldier was killed, and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash, which ended on December 8, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

12/07/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the home of activist Kamal Al-Aidi in Al-Nasr neighborhood, Nasiriyah, Dhi Qar, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast; however, the blast did cause material damage. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/07/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian in Dogrian village, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The civilian was rescued on December 13, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

12/07/2020: Armed assailants abducted three construction workers in Maldakumar Para, Dhalai district, Tripura, India. The hostages, who had been taken to Bangladesh, were released on December 23, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Front of Tripura (NLFT).
12/07/2020: Assailants shot and killed Qais Javed Masih, a local journalist, in his home in Madina, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/07/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Arghandab district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least eight police officers were killed, and ten Afghan security force members were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/07/2020: Two assailants shot and killed Deputy Chief Inspector of Khok Pho Police, Veerasak Sanporn, Makrut, Pattani Province, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/08/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the Biedronka Polish grocery store in Aalsmeer, North Holland, Netherlands. One civilian was injured. This was one of two related attacks on Biedronka stores on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested four suspects in relation to the attack, and sources noted that this was part of a larger spate of attack against Polish grocery stores run by the same Iraqi-Kurdish family.

12/08/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the Biedronka Polish grocery store in Heeswijk-Dinther, North Brabant, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks on Biedronka stores on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested four suspects in relation to the attack, and sources noted that this was part of a larger spate of attacks against Polish grocery stores run by the same Iraqi-Kurdish family.

12/07/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Gizab district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in Uruzgan province on this date. 16 assailants were killed, and 11 others were injured across the clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/07/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Deh Rahwod district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in Uruzgan province on this date. 16 assailants were killed, and 11 others were injured across the clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/07/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting an electricity pylon between Qaim and Hadithah, Al Anbar, Iraq. There were no reported casualties, but the pylon was damaged in the blast. This was one of eight related attacks targeting pylons in the area on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was part of a broader effort to attack vital economic targets in Iraq. The group stated that these attacks were intended to pressure the government to deploy security forces to the targeted sites, which would consequently deplete security personnel.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)
