gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/08/2020: Assailants attacked Nkongo, Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/08/2020: Assailants set fire to two vehicles near Pundanhar, Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. Following the fires, assailants closed the only road into Palma district. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/08/2020: Assailants fired a rocket which hit a house in Badiabad, Laghman, Afghanistan. Eight civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/08/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a garbage dump in Qabusiyah, Nineveh, Iraq. Two children were killed and another two children were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/08/2020: Assailants opened fire on a retired Iraqi Army soldier in Muqdadiyah district, Diyala governorate, Iraq. Retired Brigadier General Idan Shuaib al-Saadi was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/08/2020: Assailants abducted a school principal from his residence in Barkhe, Morang, Province 1, Nepal. The principal was killed shortly after the abduction. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated it was because the victim was acting as a police informant. Sources also noted that the victim had previously refused to pay them support.

12/08/2020: Assailants shot and killed three civilians in Tump area, Balochistan, Pakistan. This was one of two similar attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/08/2020: Assailants shot and killed two civilians in Hoshab area, Balochistan, Pakistan. This was one of two similar attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/07/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Maywand district, Kandahar, Afghanistan, but were repelled by the Afghan security forces. This was one of two related attacks targeting checkpoints in the province. Ten assailants were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/08/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Panjwai district, Kandahar, Afghanistan, but were repelled by the Afghan security forces. This was one of two related attacks targeting checkpoints in the province. Ten assailants were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.
12/08/2020: Assailants set fire to an Electoral Commission office in Fomena, Ashanti, Ghana. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/08/2020: Assailants attacked military positions in Medghal district, Marib, Yemen. Four soldiers and 22 assailants were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/08/2020: Assailants opened fire on an LGBTQ activist in La Vega neighborhood, El Bagre, Bajo Cauca, Antioquia, Colombia. The activist was killed and a relative was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/08/2020: Assailants intercepted a police vehicle in Sulaiman Khel, Balkh, Afghanistan. Seven police officers were abducted and then later killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/09/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting Well #33 in Khabbaz oilfield in Mariam Bek, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two incidents in this area on this day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/09/2020: Assailants threw a grenade targeting security forces in a market in Singhpora area, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The device missed the target, injuring 6 civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/09/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle and assailants opened fire on a military base in Mullah Noh Baba, Ghazni, Afghanistan. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, three soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks targeting bases in the area on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/09/2020: Security forces intercepted a suicide bomber driving an explosives-laden vehicle near a military base in Mullah Noh Baba, Ghazni, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties as the assailant escaped, and the vehicle was defused. This was one of two related attacks targeting bases in the area on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/09/2020: Assailants attacked the vehicle of the Bangi District Governor in Bangi district, Takhar, Afghanistan. The district governor and one of his bodyguards were killed and two other bodyguards were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/09/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Somali military convoy in Balanbale area, near Guriceel, Galguduud, Somalia. Six soldiers were killed, and three were injured in the ambush. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/09/2020: Assailants attacked Chai, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Assailants also robbed the local food store. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/09/2020: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting Well #44 in Khabbaz oilfield in Mariam Bek, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two incidents in this area on this day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/08/2020: Assailants attacked a trading center and military positions in Ndalya, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One soldier and one civilian were killed in the ensuing clash. In addition, an unknown number of people were reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/09/2020: Assailants launched an attack targeting a military checkpoint in Marj, Hit district, Al Anbar, Iraq. Four soldiers were killed and four additional soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/09/2020: A sniper opened fire and killed a soldier in Topzawa, Daquq district, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/09/2020: Assailants shot and killed a religious scholar and prayer leader for the Afghan National Army (ANA) in Puli Charkhi, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/09/2020: Assailants shot and killed a retired colonel in Police District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/09/2020: Security forces intercepted and destroyed two explosives-laden boats in the Red Sea, off the coast of Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/09/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Mizan district, Zabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents. Six assailants were killed, and five others were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/09/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Argahandab district, Zabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents. Six assailants were killed, and five others were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/09/2020: Assailants attacked Iraqi Volunteer Forces in Tall Dhahab, Saladin, Iraq. The attack was repelled and did not result in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/09/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the Biedronka Polish grocery store in Beverwijk, North Holland, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested four suspects in relation to the attack, and sources noted that this was part of a larger spate of attacks against Polish grocery stores run by the same Iraqi-Kurdish family.

12/09/2020: Assailants attacked Yemeni army and tribal forces in Haid Al Ahmad front, Rahabah district, Marib, Yemen. The attack resulted in an unknown number of assailant casualties. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Marib on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/09/2020: Assailants attacked Yemeni army and tribal forces in Rahum Frontier Mountain Rahaba front, Rahabah district, Marib, Yemen. The attack resulted in an unknown number of assailant casualties. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Marib on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/09/2020: Assailants attacked Yemeni army and tribal forces in Najd Majma front, Marib, Yemen. The attack resulted in an unknown number of assailant casualties. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Marib on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/09/2020: Assailants attacked Bwanga village, Djugu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Five people were killed, another five were injured, and four people were abducted during the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 12/09/2020: Assailants fired grenades at an army checkpoint in Labu-labu, Maguindanao, Philippines. It is unknown whether the assailants sustained any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

12/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of a local journalist in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. The journalist and her driver were killed in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated it was because the target was a "pro-government reporter". Sources also noted that this attack may be part of a larger trend of violence against journalists.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/10/2020: Assailants threw a grenade targeting a joint police and Central Reserve Police Forces (CRPF) party in Nehama area, Kulgam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/10/2020: Security forces intercepted a suicide bomber attempting to target Viransehir district, Sanliurfa province, Turkey. The assailant was shot and killed in the incident, and the explosive device was defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed it to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

12/10/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated at a Turkish checkpoint in Ras al-Ain, Al Hasakah, Syria. At least 16 people, including Turkish soldiers, police, and civilians, were killed and 12 others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to People's Protection Units (YPG).

12/10/2020: Assailants publicly executed a man accused of being a sorcerer in Tayeeglow district, Bakool, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/10/2020: Assailants ambushed South-West State Army soldiers at a checkpoint in Wanlaweyne, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Four soldiers were killed, and two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/10/2020: Assailants armed with assault rifles attacked Milho, Sanaag, Somalia. The village mayor, Mohamed Jama Aar (Bulbul), and other village officials were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy of trucks carrying logistical equipment for the US-led Coalition on highway 8 in Samawah, Muthanna, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Qasem al-Jabbarin of Kata'ib Hezbollah claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy of trucks carrying logistical equipment for the US-led Coalition on highway 8 between Mahmudiyah and Latafiyah, Babil, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Qasem al-Jabbarin of Kata'ib Hezbollah claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/10/2020: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Security Force (ANSF) checkpoint in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan, but was repelled with an airstrike. 38 assailants were killed, and 12 others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/10/2020: Assailants attacked an Iranian military position in Mayadin, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. Two assailants and nine Iranian-backed militia members were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/10/2020: Assailants attacked Journalist Hussein Khattab in Aleppo, Syria. Khattab was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/10/2020: Assailants abducted an unknown number of people from a fishing boat off the Macomia coast in Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The hostages were released the following day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/10/2020: Assailants set fire to the office of Michelle Benjamin, a Member of Parliament, in Indian Walk, Princes Town, Trinidad and Tobago. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on Gakara village in Extreme-North, Cameroon. One member of a vigilante group was injured and 14 houses were set on fire during the attack. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/10/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Bakarise, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least two soldiers, who were responding to an earlier attack, were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/10/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting a police checkpoint in Loi Deh, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed, and four officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on police officers guarding a banking area in Solita district, Caqueta, Colombia. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 12/10/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians and set fire to a health center in Gumsa, Yobe, Nigeria. Additionally, assailants stole an ambulance. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/10/2020: Assailants abducted six hunters from Bangko neighborhood, Tongan-Tongan, Lanao del Sur, Philippines. Two hunters escaped, while the remaining four hunters were killed with an explosive device on or before December 20, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Maute Group.

12/10/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Dorahi, Nimroz, Afghanistan. Eight soldiers were killed, and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/11/2020: Assailants shot and killed two soldiers at a bazaar in Towrgondi, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked Afghan National Security Force (ANSF) soldiers in Deh Rahwod district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed and two others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/11/2020: Assailants on motorcycles armed with guns attacked a secondary school in Mai-Gaterie neighborhood, Kankara, Katsina, Nigeria. Between 363 and 523 male students were abducted in the attack. Security forces attempted to rescue the hostages on December 15, 2021. 17 hostages were rescued, and two others killed during the attempt. 344 hostages were released on December 17, 2020. The released hostages suggested that some hostages were killed in captivity – though it is unclear if they are referencing the captives killed during the earlier rescue attempt. Many of the hostages were beaten and tortured during their abduction. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. Auwalu Daudawa, a Fulani leader, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was intended to draw attention to the "mass killing" of his people. Daudawa denied that the group demanded a ransom payment and denied any links with Boko Haram. The Shekau faction of Boko Haram also claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the kidnapping, which targeted students, "was done to promote Islam and discourage un-Islamic practices as Western education is not the type of education permitted by Allah and his holy prophet."
12/11/2020: Assailants shot and injured a civilian, identified as Mushtaq Ahmad Dar, in Wasoora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) bunker in Noorbagh area, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked the administrative post in Chai, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Four civilians were killed in the attack. This was one of seven related attacks on villages in Nangade district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked Litingina, Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Ten civilians were killed in the attack. This was one of seven related attacks on villages in Nangade district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked Namuine, Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of seven related attacks on villages in Nangade district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked 25 Setembro, Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of seven related attacks on villages in Nangade district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked Chicuaia-Nove, Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of seven related attacks on villages in Nangade district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked Lukuamba, Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of seven related attacks on villages in Nangade district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked several locations in Nzenga, Beni district, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 21 civilians were killed, and dozens were injured as a result of the attack. Additionally, at least 24 people, including a journalist, were abducted. The Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) later found the remains of six hostages. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/11/2020: Assailants abducted three gold miners in Milho, Sanaag, Somalia. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/11/2020: An explosive device detonated near a Federal Security Service (FSB) building in Uchkeken village, Karachay-Cherkessia, Russia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated blasts within five hours in the same area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: A suicide bomber detonated targeting police officers investigating the site of an earlier blast outside of a Federal Security Services (FSB) building in Uchkeken village, Karachay-Cherkessia, Russia. The assailant was killed and six officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated blasts within five hours in the same area. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to a Muslim extremist, noting that the assailant shouted "Allahu Akbar" during the attack.

12/11/2020: Explosives-laden vehicles detonated in Dikwa, Borno, Nigeria. At least four people were killed and eight others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants abducted three mineworkers from a residence in Samri area, Chhattisgarh, India. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked Tse Angbande, Makurdi district, Benue, Nigeria. At least four people were killed and seven people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Panjwai district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents targeting districts in Kandahar on this date. 90 assailants were killed, and nine others were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents targeting districts in Kandahar on this date. 90 assailants were killed, and nine others were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints and a bridge in Arghandab district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents targeting districts in Kandahar on this date. 90 assailants were killed, and nine others were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Maywand district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents targeting districts in Kandahar on this date. 90 assailants were killed, and nine others were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Shamulzayi district, Zabul, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed, and five others were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/11/2020: Assailants shot and killed Russalam Duelamae, an assistant village head, in Leeseng, Raman district, Yala, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Kalamansig district, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. One barangay kagawad and two other civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/11/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces clearing the Helmand-Kandahar highway in Helmand, Afghanistan. At least two security personnel were killed, and a police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2020: Assailants threw a grenade and opened fire on a police patrol in Timba, Cauca, Colombia. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Jaime Martinez Mobile Column of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 12/11/2020: Assailants attacked a checkpoint in Shuqra, Abyan Governorate, Yemen. Three Yemeni Armed Forces soldiers were abducted from a bus. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Islah Party.
12/13/2020: Assailants shot and killed a prosecutor with the Attorney General’s Office in Karte-e-Naw, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2020: Assailants attacked and killed a police officer in Police District 2, Kunduz, Afghanistan. The assailants also commandeered a military vehicle. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/12/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military training school located at the Baghdad International Airport in Baghdad, Iraq. A child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a police post in Sopore, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Three civilians were injured in the blast as the grenade detonated at a nearby bus stand. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested two members of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) who confessed to carrying out the attack.

12/12/2020: Assailants attacked Toumour, Diffa, Niger. 34 people were killed, and 100 were injured in the attack. The assailants also burned down 60% of the village. Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/09/2020: Assailants abducted two humanitarian workers, including a United Nations staff member and a Red Cross employee, in Shengen, Borno, Nigeria. The outcome of kidnapping is unknown. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they targeted the victims for their alleged Christian faith.

12/12/2020: Assailants fired three rockets at Kabul International Airport, Kabul, Afghanistan. A Kam Air aircraft was damaged as a result. This was one of four related incidents in Kabul on this day where assailants fired around 10 rockets. At least one person was killed and two people were injured across the attacks. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/12/2020: Assailants fired a rocket which landed in Hawashinasi, Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in Kabul on this day where assailants fired around 10 rockets. At least one person was killed and two people were injured across the attacks. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/12/2020: Assailants fired a rocket which landed in Zan Abad, Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in Kabul on this day where assailants fired around 10 rockets. At least one person was killed and two people were injured across the attacks. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/12/2020: Assailants fired at least one rocket which landed in Khwaja Rawash, Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in Kabul on this day where assailants fired around 10 rockets. At least one person was killed and two people were injured across the attacks. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/12/2020: An explosive device detonated at Star Cement factory in Lumshnong, Meghalaya State, India. One civilian was injured. The Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council (HNLC) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was the result of the factory owner's failure to pay their protection fee.

12/12/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Somali military convoy along Abdiqaasim Road, near K-4 junction, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of Al-Shabaab.
12/12/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed journalist, Hussein Khattab, in Bab, Aleppo, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) patrol along Narayanpur-Kurusnar road, Narayanpur district, Chhattisgarh, India. One ITBP trooper was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/12/2020: Assailants abducted Nelson Sheteh in Babanki, North-West, Cameroon. Sheteh, a traditional chief, was released on December 16, 2020 after a ransom payment. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Separatists, noting that the attack was carried out in retaliation for Sheteh's participation in regional elections, held on December 6, 2020.

12/12/2020: Assailants fired rockets at Al-Ahli Stadium, Taizz, Yemen. Nasser Al-Raimy and his son were killed and two children were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/12/2020: Assailants attacked Askira, Borno, Nigeria. Security forces responded to the assault. At least two assailants and one security official were killed and two soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the targeted town had geographic importance for the Nigerian military, noting its proximity to other towns frequently attacked by the group and the military's use of it for supply lines.

12/12/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Kandahar district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting checkpoints around Kandahar. At least 51 assailants were killed, and nine assailants were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/12/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting checkpoints around Kandahar. At least 51 assailants were killed, and nine assailants were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/12/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Arghandab district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting checkpoints around Kandahar. At least 51 assailants were killed, and nine assailants were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/12/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Maywand district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting checkpoints around Kandahar. At least 51 assailants were killed, and nine assailants were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/12/2020: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Shah Wali Kot district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting checkpoints around Kandahar. At least 51 assailants were killed, and nine assailants were injured across all attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/12/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive-laden vehicle in Deh Sabaz, Kandahar, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 11 civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/12/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the Biedronka Polish grocery store in Beverwijk, North Holland, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested four suspects in relation to the attack, and sources noted that this was part of a larger spate of attacks against Polish grocery stores run by the same Iraqi-Kurdish family.
12/12/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a railway track Wali Khan area, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Islamabad, Laghman, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Laghman on this day. One police officer and one assailant were killed across both incidents. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/13/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Zawi, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Four civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/13/2020: Assailants attacked and killed a former police commander in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2020: Assailants attacked pro-government militia members in Saqab, Takhar, Afghanistan. Eight militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/13/2020: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Tawfiq Wahdat, a member of Afghan parliament, detonated in Khair Khana, Kabul, Afghanistan. Wahdat was unharmed as he was not in the vehicle. However, two people were killed and two people, including Wahdat's brother, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/13/2020: Assailants shot and killed a religious scholar in Farah, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/13/2020: Assailants threw grenades towards vendors in Ganj Mandi area, Rawalpindi, Punjab, Pakistan. One person was killed and 24 people were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2020: Assailants destroyed three electricity towers between Qaim and Rawa, Al Anbar, Iraq. There were an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on a Peshmerga checkpoint in Girgash, Dihok, Iraq. One Peshmerga member and three assailants were wounded in the attack and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK), which denied initiating the clash and claimed that a PKK members were ambushed by "a force affiliated to the Kurdistan Democratic Party (KDP)."

12/13/2020: Assailants attacked security outposts in Shakarman, Laghman, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Laghman on this day. One police officer and one assailant were killed across both incidents. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/13/2020: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint in Staming, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least eight police officers and two soldiers were killed, and three people were injured in the attack. Additionally, three others were reported missing. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2020: An explosive device detonated outside the Galkayo district headquarters in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. At least four people were injured in the blast, including two soldiers and Abdirahman Sheikh Hassan, the district commissioner. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2020: An explosive device detonated as security personnel attempted to defuse it in Kasaram Nala, Kishtaram, Chhattisgarh, India. Vikas Kumar, a Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) deputy commandant, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/14/2020: Assailants launched a mortar round against a civilian house in Sambolawan, Maguindanao, Philippines. Six civilians were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

12/13/2020: Assailants raided a ceremony at the house of Chief Emmanuel Ngalle Ikome, a traditional ruler, in Dibanda Village (Mile 14), South-West, Cameroon. Ikome, two other traditional rulers (Chief Kombe and Chief Iwel), and four family members were abducted in the attack. Ikome was killed and the other two hostages were released the following day. This was one of two attacks by the same assailants on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that Ikome was targeted in retaliation for participating in regional elections on December 6, 2020.

12/13/2020: Assailants raided a shop selling beer and kidnapped the owner in Dibanda village, South-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two attacks by the same assailants on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2020: Assailants set fire to a 5G telephone mast in Acoks Green, Birmingham, West Midlands, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attacks were connected to conspiracy theories about 5G and the COVID-19 pandemic.

12/13/2020: Assailants attacked Somali National Army (SNA) personnel in Wajid, Bakool, Somalia. The attack was repelled and at least eight assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/13/2020: An assailant set fire to the back door of the Martin Luther King, Jr. Community Presbyterian Church in Springfield, Massachusetts, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Dushko Vulchev, an unaffiliated individual, was arrested and later indicted for this and two other attacks on the same predominately Black church in December 2020. Authorities stated that Vulchev had a history of expressing racial hatred towards Black people, including a message on his device stating "eliminate all N****s." His electronic devices also contained images of a "White Lives Matter" mural and an Adolf Hitler photo.

12/13/2020: Assailants opened fire at the Commission on Human Rights (CHR) office in Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. A security guard was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

This was one of two related attacks in Agia Fyla on this date. No group claimed responsibility for incident; however, sources attributed the attack to conspiracy theory extremists and noted that phrases stating, "no to 5G" and "there is resistance against 5G" were spray-painted at the scene of the incident.

12/13/2020: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail at a Hellenic Bank branch in Agia Fyla, Limassol, Cyprus. There were no reported casualties. In addition to the assailant's weapons, the police also recovered a backpack containing several lengths of rope, wire, lighters, tape, knives, a gasoline can, a Bible, and a note saying that he intended to take hostages. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, Luis Vasquez, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the alleged treatment of Latin America. In reference to US banks and corporations, Vasquez stated "we need to seize their wealth and return it to the people of Latin America."

Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident and left a letter with the man’s body stating that government officials working in Kurram and Orakzai districts and those paying taxes to the government will face the same fate.

12/18/2020: Assailants set fire to four coal transport vehicles in Tetariyakhar colliery in Balumath Jharkhand, India. Four truck cleaners were injured in the attack. Jharkhand Janmukti Parishad (JJP) claimed responsibility for the incident in a note left at the scene and warned the targeted colliery to seek permission before conducting their activities.

12/18/2020: Assailants attacked security forces in Lawah Kandu, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 10 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/18/2020: Assailants attacked Hays city, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There was an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/18/2020: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Al-Tur area, Bayt al-Faqiah district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No casualties resulted from this incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
12/18/2020: Assailants attacked Bossembele village, Ombella-M'Poko, Central African Republic. It is unknown if the clash resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated in Alam Khil, Balkh, Afghanistan. Four civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/19/2020: Assailants attacked a checkpoint in Sholgara district, Balkh, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/19/2020: Assailants attacked Ajiri, Borno, Nigeria. At least 10 assailants were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the ensuing clash. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the incident, stating that the group targeted a military barracks.

12/19/2020: Assailants fired at least four rockets targeting the Bagram Airbase in Parwan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 12/18/2020: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Qarsi, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least 30 assailants were killed, and 10 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/19/2020: Assailants abducted four civilians and stole cattle in Danbaure, Funtua district, Katsina, Nigeria. The hostages were rescued the following day. This was one of two attacks carried out by the same assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/19/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated in Loy Manda, Helmand, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/19/2020: The Afghan National Army (ANA) discovered and safely defused explosive devices planted on public roads in Shah Wali Kot district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. 12/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Afghan National Police (ANP) vehicle in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed, and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2020: Assailants fired a rocket at a police vehicle in a bazaar in Shindand district, Herat, Afghanistan. Three police officers were killed, and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/20/2020: A roadside explosive device detonated in Kot-e Sangi, Kabul, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed, and one police officer was injured in the blast. Additionally, security forces discovered and defused two additional explosive devices in the area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Mahmudiyah, Babil, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 12/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy transporting International Coalition supplied in Nasiriyah, Dhi Qar, Iraq. One security guard was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/20/2020: Assailants fired rockets targeting a residential complex near the United States embassy in the Green Zone, Baghdad, Iraq. Some of the rockets were intercepted by Iraqi security forces. There were no reported casualties, though buildings and cars were damaged in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting the embassy on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Iran-backed militias.

12/20/2020: Assailants fired rockets targeting a security checkpoint near the United States embassy in the Green Zone, Baghdad, Iraq. Some of the rockets were intercepted by Iraqi security forces. At least one civilian was injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting the embassy on this date. An Iran-backed militia claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2020: Assailants threw a grenade and opened fire on a joint police patrol in Achabal, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two people, including a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) officer and a civilian, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2020: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting the convoy of Khan Mohammad Wardak, a member of Parliament, at Spin Kalay square in Police District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least 10 people were killed and 52 people, including Wardak, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.
12/20/2020: An explosive device detonated along a road in Puli Alam, Logar, Afghanistan. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of highway patrol officers in Abdi Bai, Parwan, Afghanistan. At least five officers, including provincial highway police chief Wali Mohammad, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/20/2020: Assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) targeting a military convoy outside Mafa, Borno, Nigeria. Five soldiers were killed in the blast. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/20/2020: Assailants opened fire and killed a Rapid Response Force Police Elite Force sub-inspector in Peshawar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/20/2020: Assailants beheaded a shepherd identified as Okba Dhibi in Kasserine, Tunisia. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Jund al-Khilafah (Tunisia).

12/20/2020: An assailant assaulted Esther Hurgan with a rock near Tel Menashe, West Bank. Hurgan, an Israeli civilian, was killed in the attack. Mohammad Maroh Kabaha, a Palestinian extremist, claimed responsibility for the attack. Authorities stated that Kabaha carried out the attack to avenge the death of a friend who fell ill and died in an Israeli jail. Sources noted that Kabaha initially planned to attack Israeli soldiers, but gave up on that plan after discovering that he could not afford a weapon.

12/19/2020: Assailants abducted 80 students as they travelled between Unguwar Al-Kasim and Mahuta villages in Dandume district, Katsina, Nigeria. The hostages were rescued the following day. This was one of two related attacks carried out by the assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
12/20/2020: Assailants abducted two people on Bakori Road in Zamfarawa area, Funtua, Katsina, Nigeria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2020: An explosive device detonated, and assailants opened fire targeting a police escort convoy along Lamu-Gamba road in Nyongoro, Lango La Simba, Lamu, Kenya. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/20/2020: Security forces intercepted and eliminated a suicide bomber driving an explosives-laden vehicle toward an army checkpost in Momin Khan, Helmand, Afghanistan. The assailant was killed, and two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/20/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle in Baharak district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. Three civilians and a police officer were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2020: Assailants attacked Charkh district, Logar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/21/2020: An explosive device detonated against a rickshaw in Boday, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Four civilians were killed, and one other was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/21/2020: Assailants shot and killed a freelance journalist in Khwaja Hakim, Ghazni, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

12/21/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Puli Khumri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Two soldiers and two National Directorate of Security (NDS) members were killed while two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/20/2020: Assailants attacked a military base in Farah Rud, Farah, Afghanistan. Four soldiers and seven assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/21/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy carrying International Coalition supplied along the Babil Expressway in Babil, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Kata'ib Hezbollah group Qasem al-Jabbarin claimed responsibility for the attack and stated it sought to decrease the United States presence in the area.

12/21/2020: A magnetic explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Ahmad Shah Baba Mina, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one police officer and one civilian were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/21/2020: An assailant opened fire on police officers in Old City, Jerusalem, West Bank. The assailant was killed after police officers pursued him. One officer and a nearby civilian were injured during the clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources identified the assailant as Mahmoud Kmail, a Palestinian extremist.

12/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint in Arab Ha, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks on checkpoints in the area on this date. At least five assailants and four police officers, including a district commander, were killed while three assailants and four officers were injured across both attacks. In addition, six police officers were taken hostage. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/21/2020: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint in Arab Ha, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks on checkpoints in the area on this date. At least five assailants and four police officers, including a district commander, were killed while three assailants and four officers were injured across both attacks. In addition, six police officers were taken hostage. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/21/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted along a road in Kongba Bazaar, Imphal East, Manipur, India. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/21/2020: Assailants shot and killed Joe Bejjany, a telecom employee and a former army photographer in Kahaleh, Mount Lebanon, Lebanon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspect the involvement of Hezbollah.

12/21/2020: Assailants abducted two Quippo Oil and Gas Infrastructure employees, Pranab Kumar Gogoi and Ram Kumar, from a drilling site in Khumchaikha, Arunachal Pradesh, India. Gogoi was released on April 3, 2021, and Kumar was released two days later on April 5, 2021. The United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) and the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Khaplang (NSCN-K) jointly claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded a ransom for the release of the hostages. ULFA Commander-in-Chief, Paresh Baruah demanded the hostages' employer (Quippo Oil and Gas Infrastructure) must pay compensation for exploiting natural resources in the area, demanding the company stop operations in the region. Sources also attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah (NSCN-IM).

12/21/2020: Security forces discovered and defused four explosive devices along Pida-Kudaburu road, West Singhbhum district, Jharkhand, India. No casualties resulted from the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

12/21/2020: Assailants raided Malamai, Katsina, Nigeria. At least 17 people, including village head Kabir Muhammed Ajiya, were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/21/2020: Assailants attacked tribal fighter positions on the outskirts of Jabal Murad, Marib, Yemen. Three Yemeni Army members/tribal fighters were killed and dozens of assailants were killed and injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/21/2020: Security forces shot down an explosives-laden drone over joint security force and tribal fighter positions north of Marib, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/21/2020: Assailants attacked a military patrol in Taroun, Tillaberi, Nigeria. At least seven soldiers and 11 assailants were killed, and two soldiers and one civilian were injured in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 12/22/2020: An explosive device attached to a vehicle carrying doctors employed at the Pul-e-Charkhi Prison in Doghabad, Kabul, Afghanistan. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the doctors were targeted because of medical malpractice against jailed militants in Pul-e-Charkhi prison.

12/24/2020: Assailants raided Garkida, Adamawa, Nigeria. At least six people, including a police officer, were killed and three others were abducted in the attack. 12/24/2020: Assailants threw a hand grenade targeting a Central Reserve Police Force bunker in Braripora, Sringar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The grenade missed its target and there were no resulting casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/24/2020: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Basharan, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in the area on the same night. At least eight police officers were killed, and seven others were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/24/2020: Assailants ambushed police personnel responding to an earlier attack in Basharan, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in the area on the same night. At least eight police officers were killed, and seven others were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/24/2020: Assailants threw a grenade targeting Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) personnel in Watergam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One SSB officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/24/2020: Assailants attacked the residence of the Chairman of Katsina-Alain in Katsina Ala, Benue, Nigeria. Three police officers and two civilians were killed in the attack and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. The Chairman, Alfred Avalumun Atera, was unharmed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/24/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Farm-e-Hada, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/24/2020: An explosive device detonated at a police station in Santiago, Santiago Metropolitan, Chile. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Baghlani Jadid district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/25/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden RV in front of an AT&T Inc. building in downtown Nashville, Tennessee, United States. The assailant was killed, three people were injured, and several buildings were damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities attributed the attack to Anthony Warner, an unaffiliated individual, who issued a warning minutes prior to the attack. Sources noted that Warner held anti-government views and believed in several conspiracy theories, but it is uncertain if these inspired the attack. According to a neighbor, Warner stated "Nashville and the world is never going to forget me" a week prior to the attack.

12/25/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Iraqi contractor convoy carrying logistics supplies for the Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve (CJTF-OIR) in Diwaniyah district, Al Qadisiyah, Iraq. At least one driver was injured and three vehicles were damaged in the attack. The Martyr Karim Daraam Brigade claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "this was the first operation against the American presence…this won't be the last."

12/25/2020: A roadside bomb detonated against a military patrol vehicle in Khanabad, Balkh, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were killed, and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/25/2020: Assailants attacked Burundian United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) personnel in Dekoa, Kemo, Central African Republic. This was one of two related attacks on this day. Three peacekeepers were killed, and two others were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants attacked Burundian United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) personnel in Bakouma, Mbomou, Central African Republic. This was one of two related attacks on this day. Three peacekeepers were killed, and two others were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/24/2020: Assailants raided a civilian home in Udayn district, Ibb, Yemen. A woman, Khitam al-Ashary, was beaten and killed in the attack and two people were injured in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on Iraqi soldiers in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. Two soldiers were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants attacked a convoy carrying logistics supplies for the Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve (CJTF-OIR) in Dhi Qar, Iraq. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants set fire two trucks delivering rice straw to an army camp at a gas station along Narathiwat-Pattani Road, Sai Buri district, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five coordinated arson attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants set fire to four surveillance cameras on power poles in Jobor village, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five coordinated arson attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants set fire to the Buereh tambon administration office in Buereh, Sai Buri district, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five coordinated arson attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants set fire to two surveillance cameras at an intersection in Chamao Samton village, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five coordinated arson attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants set fire to three surveillance cameras at a school in Chamao Samton village, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five coordinated arson attacks in the district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants launched rockets targeting Ashkelon, Southern, Israel. The rockets were intercepted by the Iron Dome. There were no reported casualties in the attack; however, one woman was treated for anxiety following the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/25/2020: An explosive device targeting a liquor store detonated in Wathba area, Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2020: Assailants attacked a prayer camp and abducted 3 people in Fadan Kagoma, Kaduna state, Nigeria. The pastor and his wife were released on December 27, 2020. The third hostage was released on or before the same date. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/25/2020: Assailants opened fire on civilians at a bar in Kumbo, North-West, Cameroon. Two people were killed and an unknown number were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists and stated that the assailants carried out the attack because the local population is celebrating Christmas while they are “in the bushes fighting for independence.”
12/18/2020: Assailants seized roads leading to Bangui in Ouaka, Central African Republic. No further information is available. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on security outposts in Gardez, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least two militia members were killed, and four civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Police District 3, Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Kabul on the same day. Two police officers were killed, and one other officer was injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of a Lieutenant Colonel in Bodana Qala, Balkh, Afghanistan. The Lieutenant Colonel was killed and two of his guards were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/26/2020: Assailants detonated explosive devices in a tunnel under the police headquarters of Gizab district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Three police officers were killed, and three other officers were injured in the blast. The headquarters was destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/26/2020: Assailants shot and killed a former soldier in Sepak, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/26/2020: Assailants armed with firearms and rockets attacked a Frontier Corps paramilitary check post in Shahrag, Balochistan Province, Pakistan. Seven security forces were killed and six were wounded in the attack. The Baloch Liberation Army claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/26/2020: An explosive device detonated at Aftab Shaheed Football ground in Panjgur, Balochistan Province, Pakistan. Two people were killed and 6 were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/26/2020: An explosive device detonated in Police District 8, Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Kabul on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying an official from the VIP protection unit in Police District 6, Kabul, Afghanistan. Two police officers were injured in the blast. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Kabul on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Dih Sabz district, Kabul, Afghanistan. Three security forces members were injured in the blast. This is an error on my part and it should include “This was one of four coordinated attacks in Kabul on the same day. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/26/2020: Assailants attacked Shaffa, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of four coordinated attacks on villages in Borno on the same day. At least 10 people were killed and six were injured across the attacks. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incidents and stated that the attacks targeted Christian civilians.

12/26/2020: Assailants attacked Tashon Alade, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of four coordinated attacks on villages in Borno on the same day. At least 10 people were killed and six were injured across the attacks. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incidents and stated that the attacks targeted Christian civilians.

12/26/2020: Assailants attacked Khiributu Debiro, Hawul district, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of four coordinated attacks on villages in Borno on the same day. At least 10 people were killed and six were injured across the attacks. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incidents and stated that the attacks targeted Christian civilians.

12/26/2020: Assailants attacked Azare, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of four coordinated attacks on villages in Borno on the same day. At least 10 people were killed and six were injured across the attacks. The Al-Barnawi faction (Islamic State West Africa Province-ISWAP) of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incidents and stated that the attacks targeted Christian civilians.

12/26/2020: A landmine detonated targeting the vehicle of Agha Mir Wadan, the National Directorate of Security (NDS) district head, in Nawa-i-Barakzayi district, Helmand, Afghanistan. Two people, including Wadan and a bodyguard, were killed and three bodyguards were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/26/2020: Assailants abducted two Cameroonian Gendarmes and a civilian near the CAR-Cameroon border in Adamawa, Cameroon. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Return, Reclamation, Rehabilitation (3R).

12/00/2020: Sometime between December 23, 2020 and December 29, 2020, assailants detonated explosives targeting a civilian house in Madarat area, Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in this attack. This was one of 14 related attacks targeting civilian residences in the same week. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/26/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) vehicle in Shahil, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. One SDF member was killed, and another member was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
