summary: 12/26/2020: Assailants opened fire on a militia security outpost in Qabristanis, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Five militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/27/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in Bolan area, Balochistan Province, Pakistan. Six soldier were injured in the attack. Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/27/2020: Assailants shot and killed Major Nader al-Sharjabi, a procurement official in the National Resistance Force, in Aden City, Adan Governorate, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources stated that the assassination was designed to drive a wedge between National Resistance Forces and Security Belt Forces.

12/27/2020: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device attached to the vehicle of a businessman in Kismayo, Lower Juba, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/27/2020: A landmine exploded against a police vehicle guarding the Khaf-Herat Railroad in Zanda Jan district, Herat Province, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed, and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/27/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in La Honda, Bolivar, Colombia. Five people, including a former Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) member, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

12/27/2020: A grenade was discovered and defused outside the home of Jos Emonts, a journalist for the De Limburger newspaper, in Neer, Limburg, Netherlands. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/27/2020: An explosive device detonated against a logistical convoy for the Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve (CJTF-OIR) on the highway connecting Hillah and Diwaniyah, Babil, Iraq. No casualties were reported. Qasem al-Jabbarin of Kata'ib Hezbollah claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/27/2020: Assailants set fire to an indigenous “House of Thought” in Caldono, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/28/2020: Assailants abducted a businessman from his farm in Olukitibi, Akinyele district, Oyo, Nigeria. The businessman’s body was recovered on January 11, 2021, and authorities stated that he had been killed approximately ten days before. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/27/2020: Assailants looted and destroyed ballot boxes in Carnot, Mambere Kadei, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Return, Reclamation, Rehabilitation (3R) and an Anti-Balaka Militia.

12/27/2020: Assailants looted and destroyed ballot boxes in Nola, Sangha-Mbaere, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/27/2020: Assailants looted and destroyed ballot boxes in Koui, Ouham-Pende, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/27/2020: Assailants looted and destroyed ballot boxes in Bambari, Ouaka, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/27/2020: Assailants fired guns and intimidated voters in Bouar, Nana-Mambere, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related attacks on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/27/2020: Assailants fired two rockets at the electrical station in Al-Kahla district, Maysan, Iraq. There were no reported casualties or damage. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/27/2020: Assailants attacked a police patrol in Chainpur 4, Sankhuwasabha, Province 1, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

12/27/2020: Assailants abducted six civilians in Dasht, Ghazni, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of three related abductions in Ghazni on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/27/2020: Assailants abducted 15 passengers from a highway in Qarabagh district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of three related abductions in Ghazni on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/27/2020: Assailants attacked Nagu, Benue State, Nigeria. Three civilians were killed and an unknown number were injured. Those killed were family members of former Benue State House of Assembly lawmaker Ianna Jato. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded that security forces leave Shetile Island.

12/27/2020: Assailants attacked an International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) office in Bouar, Nana-Mambere, Central African Republic. At least three guards were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/27/2020: Assailants abducted 8 civilians in Zard Alo, Ghazni, Afghanistan. The hostages were released a few hours later. This was one of three related abductions in Ghazni on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a bus transporting National Statistics and Information Authority employees in Police District 7, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed, and 13 others were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/28/2020: Assailants shot and killed two Ghazni Province finance department employees in Bazizi, Ghazni, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Said Azghar Akakhail, a provincial council member, in Sahrah Bagh, Khost, Afghanistan. One bodyguard was killed and two people, including Akakhail and another bodyguard, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/28/2020: Assailants attacked military barracks in Losilosi, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 17 soldiers were killed in the attack. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated in Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. One person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/28/2020: Assailants attacked Boliel village, Yagha, Sahel, Burkina Faso. At least three people were killed, and an unknown number were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Afghan National Army (ANA) vehicle in Police District 4, Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/28/2020: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle and additional assailants opened fire targeting the police headquarters in Anar Dara district, Farah, Afghanistan. At least one police officer and five assailants were killed while three police officers and eight assailants were injured in the blast and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an Operation Barkhane vehicle near Hombori, Mopti, Mali. Three French soldiers were killed in the blast. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident, and stated it was in response to French troops in Sahel countries and France's "mockery" of the Islamic Prophet.

12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle near Tabda, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least nine civilians were killed, and an unknown number of civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Al-Shabaab.

12/28/2020: Assailants opened fire on National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) members in Bundoyinka, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. At least four NISA members were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victims were members of a security force unit that harassed locals.

12/28/2020: Assailants attacked an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base near Ceel Waaq, Gedo, Somalia. At least one Kenyan soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve (CJTF-OIR) logistics convoy in Diwaniyah district, Al Qadisiyah, Iraq. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/28/2020: Two assailants armed with knives attacked police officers and attempted to steal their weapons in Grozny, Chechnya, Russia. One police officer and both assailants were killed and a second police officer was injured in the attack. The Caucasus Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Caucasus Province of the Islamic State

summary: 12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated outside the Dikteon Medical Center in Strovolos, Nicosia, Cyprus. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/28/2020: Security forces discovered and defused 22 explosive devices in a 120-meter area along Regarbera-Arahas jungle track, West Singhbhum, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

12/28/2020: An assailant set fire to the Martin Luther King, Jr. Community Presbyterian Church in Springfield, Massachusetts, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but the church sustained extensive damages. Dushko Vulchev, an unaffiliated individual, was arrested and later indicted for this and two other attacks on the same church in December 2020. Authorities stated that Vulchev had a history of expressing racial hatred towards Black people, including a message on his device stating "eliminate all N****s." His electronic devices also contained images of a "White Lives Matter" mural and an Adolf Hitler photo.

12/28/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Nigerian military vehicle in Logomani, Borno, Nigeria. At least three soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/28/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in Ghazni on this date. One person was killed and three were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/28/2020: Assailants attacked civilians in Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in Ghazni on this date. One person was killed and three were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

12/28/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted near a residence in Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/28/2020: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted near an orphanage in Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the motorcade of the head of the Parwan attorney general's office in Ghulam Ali, Parwan, Afghanistan. At least three bodyguards were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident

12/29/2020: Assailants attacked Um Hunta, Khanaqin district, Diyala, Iraq. One assailant and one civilian were killed and three civilians were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/29/2020: An explosive device detonated in Police District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: Assailants threw a hand grenade targeting a Frontier Corps (FC) vehicle in Surab Bazar, Surab, Balochistan, Pakistan. Fourteen people, including paramilitary and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: Assailants attacked a National Guard convoy carrying out an escort mission for the Malian Solidarity Bank near Batouma, Mopti, Mali. At least two soldiers were killed, and five soldiers were injured. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Muhidin Hassan Afrah, a former member of parliament, in Kaaraan, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. Afrah was not harmed, but his bodyguard was killed, and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/29/2020: Assailants attacked Monjane, Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of two related attacks in Palma district on this date. It is unknown if there were any casualties in the ensuing clashes. In addition, an unknown number of people were abducted across both attacks. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

12/29/2020: Assailants attacked Olumbe, Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of two related attacks in Palma district on this date. It is unknown if there were any casualties in the ensuing clashes. In addition, an unknown number of people were abducted across both attacks. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

12/29/2020: Security forces intercepted an assailant attempting to plant an explosive device in Towrgondi, Herat, Afghanistan. The assailant detonated the device, killing himself in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: An explosive device planted outside the residence of an activist detonated in Iskan area, Nasiriyah, Dhi Qar, Iraq. There were no reported casualties, but the residence was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve (CJTF-OIR) logistics convoy in Diwaniyah, Al Qadisiyah, Iraq. At least one Iraqi security personnel was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: Assailants fired an anti-tank missile at a Russian military vehicle near Trumba, Idlib, Syria. Three Russian soldiers were injured in the attack. Ansar al-Tawhid claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources also attributed the attack to Turkish-backed militias.

12/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting an ambulance driving towards El Wak Referral Hospital near El Wak, Mandera, Kenya. The assailants then opened fire on the vehicle. One person was killed, two others were injured in the attack, and the vehicle was set on fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/29/2020: Assailants attacked Tungushe, Borno, Nigeria. Security forces repelled the attack. At least three assailants were killed while two soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/29/2020: Assailants detonated explosives targeting a civilian house in Madarat, Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of 14 related attacks targeting civilian residences in the same week. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy of hunters recruited by the Nigerian army to help with security in Kayamla, Borno, Nigeria. The blast caused a tire blowout and assailants opened fire on the hunters as they attempted to fix the damage. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks near Kayamla on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/29/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy of hunters recruited by the Nigerian army to help with security in Kayamla, Borno, Nigeria. The hunters were responding to an earlier ambush of a convoy of fellow hunters. At least nine hunters were killed and seven others were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks near Kayamla on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
12/29/2020: Assailants attacked National Guard soldiers in Najran, Saudi Arabia. Two guards were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on the motorcycle of an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) colonel between Nizi and Bambu, near Nizi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The colonel was killed, and his bodyguard was reported missing in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia.
gname: Cooperative for the Development of the Congo (CODECO) militia

summary: 12/29/2020: Assailants assassinated Rami al-Shabani in Diwaniyah district, Al Qadisiyah, Iraq. Al-Shabani, a leader in the Peace Brigades, affiliated with the Sadr movement, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/29/2020: Assailants attacked a village between Jalawla and Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. This was one of four attacks in this area on this day. Two people were killed in the attack, including an alleged assailant, and three people were wounded across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

Two people were killed in the attack, including an alleged assailant, and three people were wounded across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/29/2020: Assailants attacked Nzenga, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least three people were killed, and residences were set on fire in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/29/2020: Assailants attempted to attack the Congolese Nature Conservation Institute (ICCN) station in Mutsura, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Forest guards repelled the assault. No casualties were reported in the ensuing clash. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/29/2020: Assailants attempted to attack Mutwanga, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Security forces repelled the attack. No casualties were reported. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
12/30/2020: A sniper shot and killed a police officer in Qaysar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/30/2020: Assailants shot and killed a military pilot in Police District 14, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/30/2020: Assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire on three military buses near Kabajib, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least 39 soldiers were killed and 10 were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/30/2020: Assailants abducted a civilian in Burujed, Galguduud, Somalia. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

12/30/2020: Assailants attacked Aden International Airport in Aden City, Adan Governorate, Yemen. The attack was targeting aircraft which carried the Yemeni prime minister and other cabinet members. This was one of two related incidents. Thirty people were killed and 60 were injured. These totals included one journalist who was killed and 10 others who were injured; as well as staff from the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), of which one was killed and three were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah), who denied involvement. Sources also suspected the involvement of Southern Resistance Forces (SRF). Additionally, sources noted that the targeted officials were newly elected as part of a peace agreement in early December 2020.

12/30/2020: Security forces intercepted an explosives-laden drone targeting the Mashiq (Maasheq) Palace, a residence for Yemeni cabinet members, in Aden City, Adan Governorate, Yemen. This was one of two related incidents. The targeted officials included the Yemeni Prime Minister and the Saudi Ambassador to Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspect the involvement of Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah). Additionally, sources noted that the targeted officials were newly elected as part of a peace agreement in early December 2020.

12/30/2020: An explosive device detonated while being defused by Chhattisgarh Armed Force (CAF) personnel near Pusnar, Chhattisgarh, India. One CAF officer was injured in the blast. Two additional explosive devices were discovered and defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/30/2020: An explosive device was discovered on the train tracks in Starominskaya, Krasnodar, Russia. There were no reported casualties. The assailant was arrested. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/30/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces in a village near Rafah, North Sinai, Egypt. One security force member was killed, and three others were injured in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 12/30/2020: Assailants threw a grenade at a temple in Jandi village, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The grenade missed its intended target and did not cause any damage or casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/30/2020: Assailants shot Saifur Rehman Sehto in the Citizen Colony neighborhood, Hyderabad, Sindh, Pakistan. Sehto, a former Station House Officer of Bhitai Nagar Police Station, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/30/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces near Malakangiri, Odisha, India. One soldier was wounded in the blast. Additionally, security forces discovered and defused several other explosive devices. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/30/2020: Assailants set fire to a Hindu temple in Teri, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.
12/31/2020: Assailants shot and killed a tribal elder in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2020: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Syyid Khail, Wardak, Afghanistan. Explosive devices also detonated against two vehicles. At least four soldiers and three assailants were killed while three soldiers and six assailants were injured in the blast and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/31/2020: An explosive device detonated against a vehicle in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. A civilian driver was killed, and two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/31/2020: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of the Presidential Office's deputy director detonated in Police District 7, Kabul, Afghanistan. The driver was killed, and the deputy director was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2020: Assailants shot and killed Satpal Singh Nischal, a jeweler, at his shop in Saraibala area, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The Resistance Front (TRF) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated, "Domicile certificate is unacceptable and they shall be treated as occupiers." Sources noted Nischal had recently received Domicile Certificate.

12/31/2020: Assailants launched a grenade and opened fire targeting a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) patrol in Sangam, Anantnag district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One CRPF officer (Hardayal Yadav) was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/31/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting a logistics convoy in Yusufiyah, Babil, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2020: Assailants abducted 20 people in Tsamudzanzu, Irumu, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The assailants also plundered several houses and stole at least 50 goats. The hostages were freed by the assailants on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Patriotic Resistance Front in Ituri (FRPI).

12/31/2020: An assailant detonated an explosive device outside the Athens Municipal Police building in Kypseli neighborhood, Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2020: Assailants attacked farmers in Tingwe, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 25 people were killed in the attack, some of whom were beheaded. In addition, an unknown number of people were taken hostage. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/31/2020: An explosive device detonated targeting the offices of the International NGO Action Against Hunger in Aden, Adan Governorate, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2020: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of Ganesh Prasad Singh, the chairman of the Finance and Natural Resources Committee of Karnali Pradesh, in Bheri, Jajarkot, Karnali, Nepal. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2020: Assailants fired mortar shells targeting residential areas Sabaa, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/31/2020: Assailants attempted to plant explosive devices targeting civilian residences in Beit Maghari village, Hays, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. One device detonated prematurely, killing and injuring an unknown number of assailants. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/31/2020: Assailants set fire to German Army Wolf-class vehicles in Leipzig, Saxony state, Germany. No human casualties resulted from the attack; however, 7 vehicles were destroyed. Left-wing extremists claimed responsibility for this attack.
12/31/2020: Assailants shot and killed a civil society activist in Police District 15, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2020: Assailants attacked a Volunteers of the Defence of the Fatherland (VDP) position in Kelbo, Soum, Sahel, Burkina Faso. One VDP members was killed in the attack, and four others were reported missing. The bodies of the four members were discovered on January 3, 2021. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
